citizen beyond that which is available to every other citizen    conflict of interest no official or employee whether paid or unpaid shall engage in any business or transaction or shall have a financial or other personal interest direct or indirect which is incompatible with the proper discharge of his or her official duties in the public judgment or will tend to impair his or her independence or judgment or action in the performance of his or her official duties    specific conflicts of interest specific conflicts of interest are enumerated below for the guidance of officials the following list is illustrative merely and not exclusive a incompatible employment no alderperson or other public official or employee shall engage in or accept private employment or render services for private interests when such employment or service is incompatible with the proper discharge of his or her official duties or tends to impair his or her independence of judgement or action in the performance of his or her official duties in the event an alderperson official or employee possesses a financial or personal interest in any business or transaction any presumption of conflict of interest with his or her public duties shall be removed by his disclosure of the nature and extent of such investment to the common council for the records of that authority b disclosure of confidential information no alderperson other public official or employee shall without proper legal authorization disclose confidential information concerning the property government or affairs of the city nor shall he or she use such information to advance the financial or other private interest of himself or herself or others c gifts and favors no alderperson or other public official or employee shall accept any gift whether in the form of service loan thing or promise from any person who to his knowledge is interested directly or indirectly in any manner whatsoever in business dealings with the city except as permitted by the citys personnel policies d representing private interests before city agencies or courts no alderperson or other public official or employee whose salary is paid in whole or in part by the city shall appear in behalf of private interests before any agency of the city he or she shall not represent private interests in any action or proceeding against the interest of the city in any proceedings to which the city is a party e contracts with the city no city employee officer or other public official who in his or her capacity as such officer employee or public official shall participate in the making of a contract in which he or she has a private pecuniary interest direct or indirect or perform in regard to that contract some function requiring the exercise of discretion on his or her part shall enter into any contract with the city unless within the exceptions contained in 2 wisconsin statutes the provisions of this section shall not apply to the designation of a public depository of public funds nor to contracts in any one year under five thousand dollars $500000 f use of office for personal gain an elected official shall not use his or her elected office or title to develop any personal financial gain g disclosure of interest in legislation 1 an alderperson who has a financial or other private interest in any legislation shall disclose on the records of the council the nature and extent of such interest this provision shall not apply if the alderperson disqualified himself or herself from voting and council discussion of the matter 2 any other appointed or elected public official or employee including citizen members of boards and commissions who has a financial or other private interest and who participates in discussion with or gives an official opinion to the council shall disclose on the record of the council the nature and extent of such interest  8212007   2000  prior code  256   advisory opinion any questions as to the interpretation of any provisions of the code of ethics chapter shall be referred to the city attorney for an advisory opinion and such opinion shall be given to the common council for its action if any    sanctions violation of any provision of this section should raise conscientious questions for the alderpersons or any other official or employee concerned as to whether voluntary resignation or other action is indicated to promote the best interest of the city violation may constitute a cause for suspension removal from office or employment or other disciplinary action  police department chief of police the chief of police shall be appointed by the police and fire commission pursuant to wisconsin statutes and shall hold office during good behavior subject to suspension or removal by the commission for cause    organization of police department the police department shall consist of a chief of police and such other officers assistants and patrol officers as from time to time may be appointed pursuant to the provisions of the wisconsin statutes the ordinances and resolutions of the common council and the rules and regulations of the board of police and fire commissioners    records and reports a monthly reports the chief of police shall submit a written monthly report to the common council of all activities and transactions of the department during the preceding month b police records there shall be kept by the department a suitable record in which shall be entered the name of every person arrested in the city the name of the person making the arrest the date and cause of the arrest the court from which the warrant was issued the disposition made of the case the amount of fine and costs paid and to whom paid bond posted and all complaints in full    general powers of police officers every member of the police department shall a familiarize himself or herself with the ordinances of the city and the state statutes and attend to the enforcement of such ordinances by all lawful means  b help prevent crimes misdemeanors and violations of city ordinances and protect the health safety public peace and order of the city and its inhabitants  c report all street and sidewalk obstructions unlighted street lamps unlawful street signs or signals and defective or dangerous streets and sidewalks to the appropriate person or organization responsible for their repair or service  d maintain order at the scene of a fire or any other fire response within the city  e see that the necessary permits and licenses issued by the state or city are in the possession of or properly displayed by any person engaged in an activity or business within the city for which such permit or license is required and that the terms of such permits or licenses are complied with  f perform such other lawful duties as ordered by the chief of police or his or her authorized representative    responsibilities of chief of police a duties in addition to the duties imposed upon him or her elsewhere in this code of ordinances the chief of police shall 1 have command of the police department on administrative matters subject to the direction of the mayor to the extent that the council may delegate such authority of direction to him or her  2 cause to be maintained accurate records of complaints crimes traffic accidents ordinance violations arrests summons incidents and calls for police service and shall provide a system of periodic summary and analysis to ensure the most efficient and effective deployment and use of the departments resources he or she shall submit or cause to be submitted to the various agencies such reports and summaries as are required by state statutes or ordinances and shall participate in voluntary programs designed to improve law enforcement and public safety  3 submit such reports and comply with such administrative procedures as may be prescribed by the city administrator relative to fiscal and administrative matters  4 submit such reports andor information and comply with such policies as may be prescribed by common council  5 have exclusive control of the assignment hours of duty and transfer of all members of the department  6 plan organize staff direct and control all of the human and material resources of the department for the most effective and efficient discharge of its duty to protect persons and property preserve the peace protect the rights of citizens and enforce the wisconsin statutes and the ordinances of the city as are within its jurisdiction he or she shall supervise the preparation and presentation of annual reports and budgets for the police department he or she shall be required to certify to the correctness of all bills incurred by the department  7 strive to maintain suitable productive relationships with other city departments and with other governmental agencies and private organizations concerned with law enforcement crime prevention administration of justice and public safety he or she shall cooperate and exchange information with other city departments in matters relating to their various functions  8 plan and execute programs designed to prevent and repress crime apprehend and prosecute offenders recover property and regulate noncriminal conduct giving highest priority in the allocation of resources to crime and other offenses most hazardous to life and property b custody of department equipment the chief of police shall be the custodian of all city property equipment and supplies under the control of or used by the police department and shall be responsible for the care maintenance safeguarding and accurate records of such property equipment and supplies c custody of department property the chief of police shall be the custodian of all property and shall be responsible for the safekeeping lawful disposition and accurate record of the same he or she shall see that all property is returned to its lawful owner or otherwise disposed of according to the applicable statutes    rules and policies for the police department the chief of police shall establish and promulgate rules of conduct directives and policies and procedures and prescribe such duties for individual members as he or she may deem necessary for the effective and efficient command and operation of the department  providing no such rules of conduct directive or policy procedure duties or assignment shall be in conflict with the statutes ordinances and approved city personnel rules and regulations    maintenance of personnel records and performance evaluations the chief of police shall cause to be maintained adequate personnel records of employment assignment promotions attendance performance and training for all members of the department he or she shall also comply with all provisions of the law enforcement standards board in regard to background investigations he or she shall keep himself or herself adequately informed of the activities of the department and be assured that the duties of his or her subordinates are properly discharged he or she shall formulate procedures for recognizing outstanding performance by department members for investigating complaints of misconduct by any department member and for taking appropriate disciplinary action subject to the provisions of the applicable statutes and rules of the department    police chiefs responsibility for training the chief of police is responsible for the training of all members of the department he or she shall cause adequate and progressive programs or training to be organized and conducted to prepare department members in the knowledge procedures and techniques of their duties and responsibilities he or she will insure that within budgetary limitations members of the department attend training courses seminars and conferences necessary to maintain and improve their job skills and professional knowledge he or she shall encourage department members to further their education in law enforcement special courses college attendance extension programs and independent readings    civilians to assist all persons in the city when called upon by any police officer or peace officer shall promptly aid and assist him or her in the execution of his or her duties and whoever shall neglect or refuse to give such aid or assistance shall be subject to the general penalty as provided in title 1 of this code of ordinances    law enforcement personnel expenses pursuant to intermunicipal agreement a the city of sun prairie pursuant to 4 wisconsin statutes hereby elects not to be governed by those portions of wisconsin statutes relating to reimbursement of police expenses when acting outside municipal limits which are in conflict with this ordinance section b whenever sun prairie law enforcement personnel are serving in the city of fitchburg or the city of middleton the requesting city shall be responsible for all disability payments workers compensation claims damage to equipment and clothing and medical expenses arising out of these activities wage pension and all other benefits other than disability payments workers compensation claims damage to equipment and clothing and medical expenses shall be paid by sun prairie without reimbursement from middleton or fitchburg c whenever fitchburg or middleton law enforcement personnel are serving in sun prairie sun prairie shall be responsible for all disability payments workers compensation claims damage to equipment and clothing and medical expenses arising out of these activities wage pension and all other benefits other than disability payments workers compensation claims damage to equipment and clothing and medical expenses shall be paid by middleton or fitchburg without reimbursement from sun prairie d effective date 1 this ordinance section shall take effect upon notice that the common councils of middleton sun prairie and fitchburg have approved a police cooperation intergovernmental agreement containing the language specified in subsections b and c herein this ordinance section shall become null and void upon the city no longer being party to the agreement 2 this is a charter shall take effect sixty 60 days after its passage and publication unless within such sixtyday period a referendum petition as provided by 5 wisconsin statutes shall be filed in which event this ordinance section shall not take effect until it shall have been submitted to a referendum vote of the electors and approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon chtr  9202005 fire department   fire chief and officers when the city of sun prairie contracts for fire services the fire service provider shall nominate each of its officers including but not limited to its chief assistant chief captain fire ground officers and firefighters of each class as required by the department said nominations shall be submitted to and subject to confirmation by the executive committee of the fire advisory committee fire department will cooperate fully with the executive committee of the fire advisory committee in establishing criteria for nomination and hiring of all individuals interested in employment in the event of a vacancy or incapacity of an officer the next ranking officer of the department shall perform the duties of said vacancy until the vacancy is filled officers shall continue to serve in their approved position while in good standing all promotional activity for fire service provision is subject to approval of the executive committee of the fire advisory committee  12162014   11192013 editors note  adopted  repealed the former   and enacted a new   as set out herein the former   pertained to the fire chief and derived from prior code  2312 and  1993   impeding fire equipment prohibited no person shall impede the progress of the fire engine or fire truck or other fire apparatus of the sun prairie fire department along the streets or alleys of such city at the time of a fire or when the fire department of the city is using such streets or alleys in response to a fire alarm or for practice    police power of the departmentinvestigation of fires a police authority at fires 1 the chief and assistants or officers in command at any fire are vested with full and complete police authority at fires any officer of the department may cause the arrest of any person failing to give the rightofway to the fire department in responding to a fire 2 the fire chief may prescribe certain limits in the vicinity of any fire within which no persons excepting fire fighters and police officers and those admitted by order of any officer of the department shall be permitted to come 3 the chief shall have the power to cause the removal of any property whenever it shall become necessary for the preservation of such property from fire or to prevent the spreading of fire or to protect the adjoining property and during the progress of any fire he or she shall have the power to cause the removal of all wires or other facilities and the turning off of all electricity or other services where the same impedes the work of the department during the progress of a fire b fire inspection duties 1 the fire chief shall be the fire inspector of the city and shall have the power to appoint one or more deputy fire inspectors and shall perform all duties required of the fire inspectors by the laws of the state and the rules of the department of industry labor and human relations particularly wisconsin statutes 2 while acting as fire inspector pursuant to 2 wisconsin statutes the fire chief or any officer of the fire department designated by the fire chief shall have the right and authority to enter any building or upon any premises in the city at all reasonable hours for the purpose of making inspections or investigations which under the provisions of this code of ordinances he or she may deem necessary should the fire inspector find that any provisions of this code relating to fire hazards and prevention of fires are being violated or that a fire hazard exists which should be eliminated it shall be his or her duty to give such directions for the abatement of such conditions as he or she shall deem necessary and if such directions are not complied with to report such noncompliance to the city administrator for further action 3 the chief of the fire department is required by himself or herself or by officers or members of the fire department designated by him or her as fire inspectors to inspect all buildings premises and public thoroughfares except the interiors of private dwellings for the purpose of ascertaining and causing to be corrected any conditions liable to cause fire or any violations of any law or ordinance relating to the fire hazard or to the prevention of fires such inspections shall be made at least once in six months in all of the territory served by such fire department and not less than once in three months in such territory as the common council has designated or thereafter designates as within the fire limits or as a congested district subject to conflagration and more often as the chief of the fire department orders each sixmonth period shall begin on january 1 and july 1 and each threemonth period on january 1 april 1 july 1 and october 1 of each year 4 written reports of inspections shall be made and kept on file in the office of the chief of the fire department in the manner and form required by the department of industry labor and human relations a copy of such reports shall be filed with the city clerk 5 the fire chief or deputy fire inspectors may issue citations for violations of any provision of this ordinances persons cited under this provision are subject to penalties as provided in the general penalty provisions this fire chief or deputy fire inspector shall also have the power granted under this under state law to abate violations of the fire code which constitute public nuisances    damaging fire hose prohibitedparking by hydrantsblocking fire lanes a driving over fire hose no person shall willfully injure in any manner any hose hydrant or fire apparatus belonging to the city and no vehicle shall be driven over any unprotected hose of the fire department when laid down on any street private driveway or other place to be used at any fire or alarm of fire without the consent of the fire department official in command b parking vehicles near hydrants it shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle or leave any object within ten 10 feet of any fire hydrant at any time c no parking near fire it shall be unlawful for any person in case of fire to drive or park any vehicle within one block from the place of fire without the consent and authority of the fire chief or any police officer    firemen may enter adjacent property a entering adjacent property it shall be lawful for any fire fighter while acting under the direction of the fire chief or other officer in command to enter upon the premises adjacent to or in the vicinity of any building or other property then on fire for the purpose of extinguishing such fire and in case any person shall hinder resist or obstruct any fire fighter in the discharge of his or her duty as is hereinbefore provided the person so offending shall be deemed guilty of resisting fire fighters in the discharge of their duty b destruction of property to prevent the spread of fire during the progress of any fire the fire chief or his or her assistant shall have the power to order the removal or destruction of any property necessary to prevent the further spread of fire  provided that it is inevitable that unless such property is removed other property is in danger of being destroyed by fire    duty of bystanders to assist every person who shall be present at a fire shall be subject to the orders of the fire chief or officer in command and may be required to render assistance in fighting the fire or in removing or guarding property such officer shall have the power to cause the arrest of any person or persons refusing to obey such orders    vehicles to yield rightofway whenever there shall be a fire or fire alarm or the fire department shall be out for practice every person driving or riding in a motorized or other vehicle shall move and remain to the side of the street until the fire engine and fire truck and other fire apparatus shall have passed    interference with use of hydrants prohibited no person shall occupy any portion of such streets or alleys with a motorized or other vehicle between such fire engine or fire truck or other fire apparatus or any hydrant to which a fire hose may be or may be about to be attached    ambulance fees ambulance fees shall be established by resolution of the city council ambulance fees may be amended from time to time by resolution of the city council  832004   2001 municipal court municipal judgemunicipal court a established pursuant to the authority granted by wisconsin statutes there is established the municipal court for the city b office of municipal judge created pursuant to the authority granted by wisconsin statutes there is created the office of municipal judge for the municipal court for the city to be eligible for the office of municipal judge a person must be an attorney licensed to practice law and in good standing in the state of wisconsin the person must have been so licensed for five years immediately prior to election or appointment should any eligibility condition not be met or in the event the conditions of e are not met the office shall be deemed vacant c electionterm the municipal judge shall be elected at large at the spring election on the odd numbered years for a term of two years with the term commencing on may 1 succeeding the election effective with the april 1991 election and all subsequent elections the term of the municipal judge shall be for a term of four years the municipal judge shall be subject to the wisconsin judicial ethics and shall file an annual financial statement d salary the salary of the municipal judge may be increased for a new term prior to the beginning of the term for the judge and before the beginning of each succeeding year of the term e bondoath the municipal judge shall execute and file with the clerk of the circuit court for dane county the oath prescribed by wisconsin statutes and an official bond in such amount as shall be fixed by the common council f procedure in municipal court 1 the procedure in municipal court for the city shall be as provided by the ordinance codified in this chapter and state law including but not by way of limitation chapters 62 66 755 and 800 wisconsin statutes 2 the municipal court shall be open as determined by the municipal judge 3 the municipal judge shall keep his or her office and hold court in the sun prairie municipal building or such other place as the common council shall from time to time designate 4 if the municipal judge is temporarily absent sick or disabled the provisions of 1 wisconsin statutes shall apply and if the municipal judge becomes incompetent unable or fails to act or in the event of a vacancy the provisions of 2 wisconsin statutes shall apply any substitute municipal judge designated or assigned hereunder shall be compensated by the municipal judge from the municipal court budget 5 upon the proper and timely written request for substitution of the municipal judge the provisions of wisconsin statutes shall apply 6 the procedures of the municipal court shall be in accord with the applicable wisconsin statutes and city ordinances the court shall abide by the wisconsin rules of evidence and shall abide by the uniform state traffic deposit schedule in nontraffic matters the municipal judge shall draft a bond schedule which shall become effective upon approval by the common council no bond shall exceed the maximum penalty which could be imposed for the ordinance violation the police chief shall be furnished a copy of all bond schedules and amendments thereto 7 the municipal judge may impose a forfeiture for contempt upon any nonpayment of such forfeiture and any applicable costs fees assessments charges surcharges and penalties the municipal judge may impose a jail sentence the municipal judge may impose the maximum forfeiture and maximum jail sentence allowed by law g fees 1 bonds for appearance partial payments and other funds collected by the court shall be treated as escrow funds and deposited in the municipal court banking account 2 the municipal judge shall collect all forfeitures and costs in any action or proceeding before him or her and shall pay over such moneys to the city treasurer not later than the fifteenth business day succeeding the end of each month at the time of payment the municipal judge shall report to the city treasurer the title of the action the offense for which the forfeiture was imposed and the total amount of the forfeiture fees penalty assessments and costs if any the city treasurer shall disburse the fees as provided in wisconsin statutes and disburse any penalty assessments pursuant to 1b wisconsin statutes h council may abolish municipal court the city council may by ordinance or by law abolish the municipal court at the end of any term for which the judge has been elected i statutes adopted by reference chapters 755 and 800 wisconsin statutes are adopted by reference including any and all future amendments revisions or modifications of such statutes which are incorporated herein by reference and are intended to be made a part of this municipal court costs court costs in municipal court shall be thirtyeight dollars $3800   5152018    11262013   1162007   2000   1998  prior code  2313   court clerkdeputy court clerk a appointment the municipal judge shall employ such court clerk and deputy clerks as he or she deems necessary such clerk or deputy clerks shall receive salaries as determined by the municipal judge such salaries to be paid from the compensation from the city to the municipal judge for total municipal court expenses the clerks shall before entering upon the duties of their office take the oath provided by wisconsin statutes and give such bond as the council may require oath and bonds of the clerk and deputy clerks of municipal court shall be filed with the city clerk b duties the court clerk and deputy court clerks shall 1 file and review citations and complaints assuring their correctness  2 reply to departmental mail concerning routine matters as prescribed by the municipal judge  3 assign docket numbers to citations and complaints type the docket sheets and gather all material pertinent to cases  4 determine and schedule court dates and facilities  5 arrange for juvenile cases to be heard away from regular court  6 communicate with law officers attorneys and defendants regarding court proceedings  7 balance dockets at conclusion of court proceedings  8 prepare and mail warrants and summons  9 prepare monthly report of financial activities  10 assist in the collection of traffic bonds  11 prepare necessary communications for jury trials and transfers to circuit court  12 perform such other duties as may be required by the municipal judge and city administrator  boards commissions and committees generally   general provisions regarding meetings and public notice a regular meetingspublic notice every board committee and commission created by or existing under the ordinances of the city shall 1 fix a regular date time and place for its meetings  2 all meeting notices shall be filed with the city clerk who shall cause the notice to be published and posted in full compliance with the open meeting law requirements  3 publish notice in the official city newspaper in advance of each such regular meeting of the date time and place for its meetings  4 post at the front door of the city hall an agenda of the matters to be taken up at such meeting b special meetings nothing in subsection a of this section shall preclude the calling of a special meeting or with dispensing with the publication of notice or such posting of the agenda for good cause but such special meetings shall nonetheless comply in all respects with the provisions of to 1989 wisconsin statutes    residency required for service on boards commissions and committees a appointments no person not a resident of and not residing in the city shall be appointed to any city board commission or committee except as provided for in paragraph b any board commission member who moves from the city shall immediately be removed from the board or commission however the library board and the historical library and museum board pursuant to state law may have as members up to two persons who reside in towns adjacent to the city b nonresident appointments 1 a nonresident may be appointed to serve on a city board commission or committee as a representative of another governmental body or as a representative of an organization that has a significant presence in the city also a nonresident may be appointed to serve on a city board commission or committee if they hold expertise in a field that would benefit the work of the city board commission or committee to which they are appointed 2 the city clerk shall identify that a nonresident has been nominated to serve on a city board commission or committee prior to council action on the nomination c exceptions a member of any business improvement district board need not reside in the city and is excepted from the requirements of subsection a of this section provided such person owns or occupies real property in the business improvement district  762004  prior code  2415   compensation of duly appointed board and commission members effective  all board and commission members attending scheduled board and commission meetings shall be compensated twenty dollars $2000 per meeting and any member of the police and fire commission that shall participate in a grievance hearing meeting shall be compensated at twenty dollars $2000 per grievance meeting except the water and light commission which will continue to receive thirty dollars $3000 per meeting the board of review members shall receive twenty dollars $2000 per day instead of per meeting  1993  prior code  2416   business improvement district board any business improvement district board which becomes necessary due to the creation of a business improvement district pursuant to wisconsin statutes shall be established and have the powers and duties as enumerated in wisconsin statutes as amended  as provided in the operating plan for that district as adopted by the common council  and as provided generally in this code of ordinances the chamber of commerce shall appoint one of its members or employees as a liaison to any business improvement district established by the city the liaison shall function as an ex officio nonvoting member and not be counted for purposes of a quorum  712008  prior code  2417 community development authority created pursuant to wis stats   the community development authority the authority is created the authority shall be deemed a separate body politic exercising necessary public powers and having the powers duties and functions conferred on housing and community development authorities under wis stats   except as otherwise herein provided   10172017    composition the governing body of the community development authority shall consist of seven commissioners   10172017    appointment of commissioners the mayor shall subject to confirmation of the common council nominate six residents of the city having sufficient ability and experience in the fields of urban renewal community development and housing as community development authority commissioners two of the commissioners shall be members of the common council and five shall be citizen members terms of citizen members shall be four years pursuant to wis stats  2b   10172017    officers a the mayor shall serve as a voting member and the chair to the authority as referenced in b6 the commissioners shall annually appoint by a majority vote of those present a vicechairperson of the authority from among the commissioners at the first authority meeting in may vacancies occurring in the office of vicechairperson shall be filled from among the commissioners for the unexpired portion of the term b the director of community development shall be the executive director of the authority and shall be the chief administrative officer of the authority and shall direct manage and supervise the authoritys administrative operations and technical activities in accordance with the directives of the authority the executive director shall also act as secretary of the authority and shall perform such other duties and have such other powers and responsibilities as may from time to time be delegated to himher by the authority c in carrying out its duties the authority may form committees of commissioners or others hold public meetings and utilize the services of the city or other public or private services as it deems necessary subject to the policy and budgetary approval of the common council   10172017    meetings  quorum  bylaws a all meetings of the authority shall be held in compliance with the provisions of the state open meeting law wis stats  1981 et seq b four commissioners shall constitute a quorum of the authority for the purpose of conducting its business and exercising its powers and for all other purposes action may be taken by the authority upon the affirmative vote of a majority of the commissioners present at any meeting of the authority at which a quorum is present no vacancy in the membership of the authority shall impair the right of a quorum to exercise the powers and perform the functions of the authority c the authority may adopt and from time to time amend or repeal such bylaws and other rules and regulations not inconsistent with applicable law as it deems necessary in the performance of its functions   10172017    evidence of authority the filing of a certified copy of the ordinance from which this section is derived with the clerk shall be prima facie evidence of the authoritys right to transact business in any suit action or proceedings commenced against the authority a certified copy of the ordinance from which this section is derived or of this division shall be conclusive evidence that the authority is established and authorized to transact business and exercise its powers   10172017    statutory powers the authority shall have all powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes and provisions of wis stats   and all powers duties and functions set out in wis stats    and  for housing and community development authorities in this regard it is authorized to 1 exercise all powers duties and functions of redevelopment authority under wis stats   2 act as agent of the city in planning and carrying out community development programs and activities approved by the mayor and common council funded under the federal housing and community development act of 197 42 usc 5301 et seq and other federal and state laws relating to housing and community development and following review and recommendation by the plan commission to perform all acts except development of the general plan of the city and other duties performed by the plan commission under wis stats   to  and  3 act as agent of the city in performing all functions required to be performed by a sponsor of a housing rehabilitation program as set forth in wis stats   both within and outside of neighborhoods or areas designated by the common council as reinvestment neighborhoods or areas pursuant to wis stats   and in performing all other functions related to the operation and administration of the citys housing rehabilitation program and any other programs of rehabilitation financing involving financial assistance from either the federal or state government or both in which the city participates 4 issue bonds in aid of its powers and duties and functions as permitted under wis stats   or wis stats   to  wis stats    or  such bonds are declared to be issued for essential governmental and public purposes and to be public instrumentalities and together with interest thereon and income therefrom are exempt from taxes   10172017    additional powers in addition to its statutory powers the authority is further authorized within the limits of the funds available for such purposes to 1 employ such technical experts and such other agents and employees permanent and temporary as may be required from time to time in the performance of its duties and functions 2 contract with the city or any other agency or entity public or private for the provision by the city or such agency or entity of any necessary staff services associated with or required by the authority in the staff of the authority any staff services provided to the authority by the city pursuant to such contract shall be coordinated executive director of the authority or hisher designee 3 call upon any department board commission or agency of the city for assistance and cooperation in the performance of the authoritys duties and functions and all city departments boards commissions and agencies are hereby authorized and directed to cooperate with and furnish assistance to the authority in the performance of the authoritys duties and functions 4 work with business education government labor and citizens to a retain and expand existing business and commercial enterprises within the city b recruit new businesses and encourage the expansion and diversification of business and commercial enterprises within the city to expand local employment opportunities and the tax base c foster and facilitate economic development activities efforts with area business organizations adjoining municipalities the county and the state d assist new and existing businesses resources which facilitate quality growth and development within the city e publicize and promote the business employment residential educational and recreational opportunities available in the city f foster develop and enhance a sense of community a positive community image and civic pride 5 to identify itself as the community and economic development authority in anything other than contracts resolutions and financial reports 6 the authority has the power to purchase and sell property with the chair having the powers to sign all documents required for purchase and sale of such property   10172017    manner of proceeding the authority and its commissioners shall comply or cause compliance strictly with all provisions of wis stats   to  and state law and in addition thereto with each and every term provision and covenant in any contract of the authority on its part to be kept or performed   10172017    plans  recommendation  reports the authority in consultation with the city plan commission and other appropriate bodies and staff shall 1 prepare and periodically update an economic development plan and development strategy for use by the mayor and common council in formulating said plan the authority shall monitor and evaluate economic conditions in the city identify economic problem areas and prioritize any economic problems identified 2 consider alternative approaches to improving economic deficiencies in the city in problem areas identified 3 recommend specific programs and projects to allocate available city resources among the elements of the citys economic development effort 4 recommend items for inclusion in the annual city budget to implement the development strategy adopted by the common council   10172017    budget the authority together with the economic development director shall prepare an annual budget which shall be submitted to the mayor as part of the general budget process the budget shall include estimated fees for consultants travel expense for staff publication costs and other ordinary and necessary expenses   10172017    staff the authority shall receive primary staffing offices of the economic development director and the director of community development   10172017    construction all powers duties and functions of a community development authority as set forth in wis stats   are deemed to have been granted to the authority as though set forth in this section this section and the powers granted hereunder shall be construed liberally to effectuate its purposes   10172017  city plan commission   composition the plan commission shall consist of nine voting members as follows the mayor two alderpersons one member of the park and recreation commission one member of the sun prairie area school district board and four citizens in addition the city planner shall serve as an ex officio member of the commission in a nonvoting capacity the city planner shall be responsible for taking and reporting commission reports in full accordance with city policy  672011   part 1998  prior code  245a   appointment a electionappointment of aldermen members at its annual meeting in april of each year the common council shall by a twothirds vote of its members elect one of its number as member of the city plan commission for a period of one year from and after the first day of may next ensuing the other alderperson shall be appointed by the mayor and serve for the same oneyear period b appointment and terms of citizen members the city plan commission shall consist of nine voting members as follows the mayor who shall be its presiding officer two alderpersons one member of the park and recreation commission one member of the sun prairie area school district board and four citizens citizen members shall be persons of recognized experience and qualifications the one member of the park and recreation commission and the one member of the sun prairie area school district board shall be appointed by the mayor for a oneyear term the four citizen members shall be appointed by the mayor for a fouryear term all appointments to the plan commission shall be confirmed by a majority of the common council  12202005   part 1998  prior code  245b   organization the mayor shall serve as presiding officer the plan commission shall organize by the election of a vicechairperson secretary and such other officers as may in their judgment be necessary the plan commission shall receive such compensation as determined by the common council c   record the plan commission shall keep a written record of its proceedings to include all actions taken a copy of which shall be filed with the city clerk five members shall constitute a quorum but all actions shall require the affirmative approval of a majority of all the members of the commission  part 1998  prior code  245d media center commission footnotes  1  editors note  2 adopted  amended ch 244 in its entirety to read as herein set out former ch 244   was entitled cable access telecommunication commission and derived from d e   part 2001  and  3 part 2003   appointment a the media center commission shall be composed of six citizens appointed by the mayor subject to the approval of the common council each for a term of three years the commission shall elect its own chairperson yearly any vacancy in the office shall be appointed by the mayor subject to approval by the common council for the remainder of the term no employee or person with ownership interest in a cable television franchise granted pursuant to this chapter shall be eligible for membership on the commission no employee or person with financial or familial ties with the federal communications commission shall be eligible for membership on the commission names of interested citizens willing and able to serve on the commission shall be accepted and submitted to the mayor for consideration b the mayor shall consider the submitted name as well as others as may come to the attention of the mayor as being qualified and every effort shall be made to make said board as broadly representative of the citizens of sun prairie as possible  6162015   powers and duties the duties of the media center commission shall be as follows a the media center commission serves as the citys cable access telecommunications commission as defined in wisconsin state statutes  19601 b advise the common council on applications for franchise c advise the common council on matters which might constitute grounds for revocation of the franchise in accordance with this chapter d resolve disagreements among franchisee subscribers and public and private users of the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center  such decisions of the commission shall be appealable to the common council e advise the council on the regulation of rates in accordance with this chapter f encourage use and publicize the availability of the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center among the widest range of institutions groups and individuals within the city g audit all franchisee records required by this chapter and at the commissions discretion require the preparation and filing of information additional to that required herein h conduct periodic evaluation of the system make recommendations to the council for amendments to this chapter or the franchise agreements i assure that all records rules and charges pertinent to the cable telecommunication network in the city are made available for inspection at reasonable hours upon reasonable notice j ensure that radio station logs as required by the fcc are made available for inspection at any time during normal business hours k confer with the grantee and advise on the interconnection of the citys cable system with other cable communications systems l the commission shall be responsible for the overall regulation of the cable provider and the operation of the citys community television and radio facilities in full accordance with the cable telecommunication franchise enabling as adopted on  and amended the commission shall oversee provide guidance and advisement as to the daily operation of the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center and keep the common council advised of the status of the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center m the commission shall advise on the safeguarding maintenance and supervision of the operation of the sun prairie media centerowned equipment entrusted to its care n to facilitate equitable access to community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center for all sun prairie citizens seeking access o to facilitate the development of programs to increase the publics knowledge and use of the community television and radio facilities which are made available under the franchise p subject to the general fiscal control of the common council the commission shall be responsible for the supervision and operation of the citys community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center the commission shall make rules for its own proceedings and for the operation of its department it shall employ a director and shall be authorized to hire additional personnel within the funds approved annual budgeting process all personnel hired by the commission shall be classified as city employees q the commission shall oversee the development of an annual fiscal budget and submit it to the city of sun prairie each year said budget shall include required expenditures for the regulation andor operation of the citys community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center including all expenses anticipated to be incurred for the operation and administration of the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center r the commission shall facilitate equal access to all equipment facilities and to the use of the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center to all members of the community and community groups such access shall be negotiated by the sun prairie media center director staff and community member seeking access to community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center in conjunction with sun prairie media center staff the commission shall develop rules which shall govern access within the requirements set forth in this section all access to community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center and programming for the community television and radio facilities housed at the sun prairie media center shall be done in full accordance with the policies and procedures established and approved by the commission s funds approved but not expended by the end of each fiscal year shall be carried over into the following fiscal year carry over funds shall be included in the subsequent budget for sun prairie media center t the common council shall approve an annual budget as determined by the director and approved by the media center commission u the commission shall ensure that the media center director follows the citys purchasing policy for all budgeted funds and shall comply with all city financial reporting requirements all expenditures shall be done citys finance office in full compliance with city operational procedures all required financial record keeping shall be done in conjunction with the city administrative services and the sun prairie media center in addition the city shall provide payroll service v all public access equipment shall remain the property of the sun prairie media center all equipment purchased by the sun prairie media center shall be considered as property owned by the sun prairie media center w the city shall provide all of the required insurance coverage including workmans compensation general liability property and public official liability the amount of insurance coverage shall equal the amounts set for all city departments the director shall budget funds so that the city can be reimbursed for the cost of providing said insurance coverage for the sun prairie media center x the commission is authorized to accept the monetary donations and gifts of equipment to the sun prairie media center for either the community television or radio facilities located at the sun prairie media center such monetary donations shall be so identified and shall be deposited with the city finance officer who shall deposit said donations into the sun prairie media centers revenue account the expenditure of donated money andor the acceptance of the equipment shall not in any fashion commit the city to a higher level of service to the community thereby committing the common council to a level of service not approved budget process y equipment and other expenses totaling under one thousand dollars $100000 for the sun prairie media center will be expended at the discretion of the director equipment purchases of one thousand dollars $100000 or more will need to be brought to the media center commission for a formal vote approval by the commission in no way replaces city purchasing policy and the director is expected to comply with all city operational procedures z the media center commission is prohibited from taking on any form of debt without the formal authorization of the common council aa the media center commission may authorize the entrance into cooperative agreements with other nonprofit governmental educational and public service groups or other community television and radio stations in order to produce appropriate community television programs bb the city shall retain ultimate control of all public access channels and the expenditure of all budgeted funds  6162015   recommendations to council the media center commission shall have the authority to submit proposed rules and regulations for the conduct of its business and the business of the community television and radio facilities located at the sun prairie media center to the mayor and council for approval and upon approval shall have the right to hold hearings and make recommendations to the grantee and to the educational and governmental communities on the coordination of the community television and radio facilities located at the sun prairie media center all such actions shall be only advisory  6162015   childrens programming it shall be the duty of the media center commission to allocate an appropriate share of the media center budget revenues received from the operation of the cable system franchise payment to support programming workshops and other services as deemed desirable by the media center and approved by the media center commission for children  6162015 parks and recreation commission appointments the parks and recreation commission shall consist of seven members one alderperson the superintendent of the sun prairie area school district or the superintendents designee and five citizens of recognized experience and qualifications the alderperson shall be appointed annually by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council for one year terms beginning may 1 one citizen member shall be appointed annually except for every fourth year at which time two citizen members shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the common council for a fouryear term commencing on may 1 the fifth citizen member shall be appointed for a fouryear term commencing on  the director of parks and recreation shall be an ex officio member of the commission  1999 prior code  246a   compensationoath commission members shall receive such compensation as shall be determined by the council from time to time members shall take an official oath as prescribed by wisconsin statutes to be filed with the city clerk b   officers the commission shall annually elect one member as chairperson c   procedure four members shall constitute a quorum the chairperson or acting chairperson shall be considered in determining a quorum action shall be by a majority of those present and voting the commission shall adopt rules of procedure for governing the conduct of its meetings d   powers and duties the commission shall have all the powers conferred by law upon park recreational and in cities of the fourth class and shall be chargeable with all the duties so required such as recommend oversee work and oversee funds of all parks playgrounds and recreational activities as part of properties within the city the parks and recreation commission is specifically empowered and directed a to govern manage control improve and care for all public parks located within or partly within and partly without the corporate limits of the city and secure the quiet orderly and suitable use and enjoyment thereof by the people  also to adopt rules and regulations to promote these purposes  b to acquire in the name of the city for park purposes by gift purchase devise bequest or condemnation either absolutely or in trust money real or personal property or in any incorporeal right or privilege provided gifts to the city of money or other property real or personal either absolutely or in trust for park purposes shall be accepted only after they have been recommended by the commission to the common council and approved by such common council by resolution  c with prior council approval to buy or lease lands in the name of the city for park purposes within or without the city and with the approval of the common council to sell or exchange property no longer required for its purposes  d to execute every trust imposed upon the use of property or property rights by the deed testament or other conveyance transferring the title of such property to the city for park purposes  e to have the powers necessary and convenient for the effective and efficient management control supervision and operation of the city park system and recreation program as carried out by the director subject to budgetary approval by the common council  f to have jurisdiction of the parks swimming pool and playgrounds throughout the city and assume full responsibility for the equipping developing and maintaining the physical facilities of the park system  g to establish such rules and regulations to promote the quiet orderly and suitable use of the city parks and playgrounds as the commission shall deem necessary  h to establish rules and regulations including user fees as deemed necessary as approved by the council and desirable for the proper use care and operation of parks park facilities recreation programs and other activities under their control provided however that such rules and regulations do not conflict with the laws of the state of wisconsin or this code of ordinances i and such other and further duties as may be necessary for the proper carrying out of the purposes of such board e   public recreation program the city parks and recreation commission shall determine the recreational needs and shall have jurisdiction over the public recreation program of the city and shall be empowered to a establish park rules and program policies  b cooperate and coordinate with public school activities  c cooperate with any private recreational activities  d approve schedules of all recreational activities in public parks and school buildings f   record the parks and recreation commission shall keep a written record of its proceedings to include all actions taken a copy of which shall be filed with the city clerk g   finance a budget the commission shall assist the director of parks and recreation in preparing an annual budget for submission to the city administrator which budget shall reflect the commissions recommendations as to maintenance or acquisition of city parks open spaces park and related facilities recreation programs and equipment summer or seasonal employees etc such annual budget shall contain estimates as to revenues to be derived from recreation programs or activities as well as estimated expenditures for operating the parks and recreation department the city administrator shall review the budget and submit a recommended budget to the committee of the whole b deposits all revenues and income from the operation of park and recreation programs shall be deposited with the city finance officertreasurer as general revenue of the city c monetary contributions all moneys donated to the city specifically for park or recreation use shall be deposited in city accounts as a nonlapsing fund or reserve for such specific use h   meetings the city parks and recreation commission shall meet at least once each month and a written report of such meetings shall be submitted to the city clerk within one week after such meeting i police commission footnotes  2  editors note  2 adopted and one member selected by the common council at its annual organizational meeting the remaining members shall be the president and vice president of the sun prairie volunteer fire department board of trustees or their designees  and two members agreed upon and appointed by the towns all members shall be appointed annually on may 1  12162014   11192013   6252017    scope of authority the committees governing the conduct of its meetings such rules shall be fully consistent with wisconsin state statutes and this municipal code the fire advisory committee will have authority to confirm evaluate andor discipline the fire chief the fire advisory committee will have sole authority to terminate the fire chief the chief will submit to annual performance reviews by the fire advisory committee the youth and families commission of the city whose duty will be to increase the communitys awareness of the positive contributions made to the community by youth and families and to help groups within the city to work on making sun prairie a better place for the citys youth and families a   how selected the youth and families commission shall consist of seven adult members and four youth members one adult alternate and one youth alternate to be appointed by the mayor with the approval of the common council one adult member shall be a member of the common council of the remaining six adult members no more than two of these members may reside outside of the city limits however they shall reside within the limits of the sun prairie school district of the four youth members they shall all reside within the limits of the sun prairie school district and shall not be required to reside within the city corporate limits  272006  prior code  2413b   terms the appointments shall be made in may of each year the common council member shall be appointed for one year the adult members shall be appointed for terms of three years the youth members shall be appointed for a term of one year c   officers and procedures annually the members of the commission will select a chairperson vicechairperson and secretary from its membership four members shall constitute a quorum action shall be by a majority of those members present and voting the commission shall adopt rules and procedures for governing the conduct of its meetings such rules shall be fully consistent with wisconsin state statutes and this municipal code d   ex officio members sun prairie school district administrator the police departments youth services officer the director of parks and recreation and the childrens librarian or their designees e   compensation commission members shall receive such compensation as shall be determined by the council from time to time f   meetings meetings of the commission shall utility commission footnotes  3  editors note adopted  repealed which pertained to water and light utility commission and derived from prior code  247  of 1999  of 2000  and of 2002 subsequently adopted aug 2 200 again repealed and then recreated to read as herein set out   composition a operating name the waterworks system electric light and power distribution systems and telecommunications systems of the city are combined enterprise funds and shall be operated as sun prairie utilities b organization the water and light utility commission of the city hereinafter called the utility commission shall consist of seven members whose duty it shall be to have the entire charge and management of the sun prairie utilities as a department of the city the commission shall have full authority to supervise the operation of the utility subject only to the general control and supervision of the common council c how selected the utility commission shall consist of seven commissioners which shall include the mayor one alderperson and five residents of the city the alderperson shall be appointed to the commission by the city council during the councils annual organizational meeting and shall serve a oneyear term the mayor may designate a council member to serve in his place during the annual city council organizational meeting with the appointment being confirmed by the city council and lasting for a oneyear period the terms of the remaining commissioners shall be for five years and shall be staggered so that no more than one commissioners term shall expire each year d eligibility no person shall be eligible to serve as a member of the utility commission or to hold any office or position under such commission who directly or indirectly has any pecuniary interest in any contract for furnishing heat light water power telecommunications service or other public service to or for the city or the citizens thereof or who is a stockholder in any corporation which has any such contract any such office or position shall become vacant upon the acquiring of any such interest any member selected to such commission shall take and file the official oath of office with the city clerk e vacancy in the event of a vacancy on the utility commission the mayor shall appoint on a nonpartisan basis one or more commissioners to fill the unexpired terms of any such member or members such appointment by the mayor shall be subject to confirmation by the common council the utility commission shall be continuous in existence and each member thereof shall continue thereon until his successor is appointed and qualified  152010   822005   internal organization a officers the members of the utility commission shall in the month of may of each year select from among its members a chairperson vicechairperson and secretarytreasurer the chairperson shall conduct the meetings of the utility commission and otherwise supervise such meetings the secretarytreasurer shall keep a written record of the proceedings of the commission as well as an audio recording of all utility commission meetings including special utility commission meetings such written record and audio recording shall be filed with the city clerk the city clerk shall place them in the citys official city files and distribute the written record to the mayor and city council as well as the official city newspaper b meetings the utility commission shall hold regular monthly meetings and such special meetings as are called by the chairperson or by a majority of the members of the commission as may be deemed necessary all meeting notices shall be filed with the city clerk who shall cause the notice to be published and posted in full compliance with the open meeting law requirements four members of the commission shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business c compensation all members of the commission shall receive such compensation as may be fixed from time to time by the common council  12202005   822005   duties powers and authority a management of the utility subject to the general control and supervision of the common council the utility commission shall take entire charge and management of the water and electric utilities of the city in addition to the power and authority set forth in this chapter the utility commission shall have the authority prescribed by wisconsin statutes and shall govern and administrate the department consistent with title 13 of the municipal employment the utility commission shall make rules for their own proceeding and for the government of their department the commission shall appoint a utility manager who shall act on behalf of the commission and shall employ necessary employees and fix their compensation the commission also may employ the services and fix the compensation of such other agents or consultants as the commission deems necessary c provision of telecommunications services subject to the general control and supervision of the common council the utility commission is authorized to provide telecommunications service in its service area and to carry out all associated activities to the full extent allowed by applicable federal and state laws including without limitation 5 wisconsin statutes and in compliance with such federal and state laws for purposes of this section the phrase telecommunications service has the same definition as that contained in 9m wisconsin statutes as may be amended from time to time  822005   accounts a manner and form it shall be the duty of the utility commission to have books of account kept in the manner and form prescribed for utilities of its class by the public service commission of the state of wisconsin such books of account shall be open to the public b receipts the receipts of public utilities shall be deposited in an official depository approved by the commission the utility manager of water and light shall make and file his or her financial report of such utilities each month with the commission the commission shall within one week of receipt of the financial report file it with the city administrator who shall forward copies to the mayor and city council c transfer of funds no funds of the municipallyowned utility shall in any case be transferred to the city treasury for use of the city except in accordance with the provisions of 3 wisconsin statutes d excess funds any excess funds accumulated by such utility unless deposited pursuant to law and all funds in the depreciation or retirement reserves may be invested only according to the provisions of 2 wisconsin statutes  822005   annual budget on or before october 15 of each year the utility commission shall prepare and file a complete fiscal budget with the city the utility commission and the committee of the whole shall jointly develop a budget form that is acceptable the committee of the whole shall meet to review the proposed utility budget upon approval by the common council the budget shall be implemented and followed by the commission effective january 1 of the following year by april 1 of each year the utility commission shall file with the city clerk a copy of its annual report filed with public service commission upon approval of the annual audit of the utility by the utility commission a copy of the annual audit shall be provided to the city finance department    822005   purchasing policy the utility commission shall formally enact a written purchasing policy which shall be used by the commission to insure compliance with the annual fiscal budget  822005   annual audit the utility commission shall cause an annual audit to be conducted of the utility accounts and upon completion such audit shall be presented to the utility commission and the finance committee for review upon recommendation of the finance committee the common council shall officially accept the audit and direct the city clerk to place it on file the utility commission shall pay for the cost of the audit  822005   contractual commitment the utility commission shall have full authority to enter into contracts in the name of the city provided that funds have been included in the annual utility budget for the purchase of the item andor service identified under the contract in addition all contracts which require the use of funds not generated by the utility or the borrowing of funds shall be approved by the city council  822005   expenditures expenditures of the municipallyowned utilities shall be audited by the utility commission and if approved be paid for by the utility accounts upon warrants signed by the finance officer or city administrator and secretary of the utility commission or superintendent of utilities  822005 transit commission composition the transit commission shall consist of six members to be appointed by the mayor and approved by the common council one of whom shall be designated by the committee as chairperson the first members of the transit commission shall be appointed for staggered threeyear terms the term of office of each member except the representative of the common council thereafter shall be three years the mayor shall appoint one representative from the senior citizens community one representative from the school district one representative from the business community two representatives from the community at large and one member of the common council to the transit commission the member of the common council shall serve a oneyear term   942018    612004   4202004   duties duties of the commission shall include but not be limited to a act as the oversight authority for the taxi service and make recommendations for changes to the taxi service as may be necessary on topics such as rate structure expansion of service and hours of operation b review and make recommendations for future transportation alternatives c review and respond to customer complaints d review and make recommendations regarding alternative revenue options including intergovernmental agreements and grant applications e for the purpose of making recommendations regarding multimodal transportation options and associated infrastructure the ability to create subcommittees which may include members of the public that are not on the transit committee as well as bylaws or rules of conduct to direct said subcommittees   942018    4202004   officers and procedures annually members of the commission shall select a chairperson vice chairperson and secretary from its membership four members shall constitute a quorum action shall be by a majority of those members present and voting   942018    612004   4202004   compensation commission members shall receive such compensation as shall be determined by the common council from time to time  4202004   meetings meetings of the commission shall be at the call of the chairperson and such other times as the commission may determine all meetings conducted by the commission shall be subject to wisconsin open meetings law  4202004   powers all powers granted to transit commissions pursuant to wisconsin statutes are reserved by the common council until such time as this section may be amended  4202004 board of review membership the board of review shall consist of five members and one or more alternate members who are citizens of the city none of whom shall occupy any public office the alternate members shall act with full power whenever any of the five members are absent refuse recuse or are otherwise unavailable to hear an objection  2003   appointment one member shall be appointed annually by the mayor subject to the confirmation of the council for a term of five years provided that initially five members shall be appointed for terms of one two three four and five years respectively the mayor shall appoint subject to confirmation of the council one alternate member for a term of five years the mayor may appoint subject to confirmation of the council additional alternate members in addition to the one required alternate member if more than one alternate members is appointed the mayor subject to the confirmation of the council shall designate one of the existing or newly appointed alternate members as first alternate one as second alternate and so forth to establish the priority of all alternate members the terms of any additional alternate members shall be for five years unless that term must be reduced by one or more years at the time of appointment to ensure that not two alternates members terms end in the same year b 2001   clerk the clerk shall act as clerk of the board of review but shall not be a member thereof and shall keep an accurate record of all its proceedings c 2001   compensation each member of the board shall receive compensation in an amount to be as established from time to time by resolution of the common council for attendance on the dates when the board of review is in actual session each alternate member shall receive compensation in an amount to be as established from time to time by resolution of the common council for attendance on the dates when the board of review is in actual session and the alternate members attendance thereto is requested by the clerk d 2001   duties the duties functions and proceedings of the board of review shall he as prescribed in 47 wisconsin statutes e 2001   meetings the board shall meet annually as prescribed by state statutes such meeting shall be noticed published and conducted pursuant to state statutes f 2001 alcohol and licensing review board membership the alcohol and licensing review board shall consist of five members and one or more alternate members who are citizens of the city none of whom shall occupy any public office the alternate members shall act with full power whenever any of the five members are absent refuse recuse or are otherwise unavailable to hear an objection   432018   part 2003   appointment all members shall be appointed by the mayor subject to the confirmation of the council for a term of five years provided that initially five members shall be appointed for terms of one two three four and five years respectively the mayor shall appoint subject to confirmation of the council one alternate member for a term of five years the mayor may appoint subject to confirmation of the council additional alternate members in addition to the one required alternate member if more than one alternate member is appointed the mayor subject to the confirmation of the council shall designate one of the existing or newly appointed alternate members as first alternate one as second alternate and so forth to establish the priority of all alternate members the terms of any additional alternate member shall be for five years unless that term must be reduced by one or more years at the time of appointment to insure that no two alternate members terms end in the same year   432018   part 2003   clerk the clerk or the clerks designee shall act as clerk of the alcohol and licensing review board but shall not be a member thereof and shall keep an accurate record of its proceedings   432018   part 2003   compensation each member of the board shall receive compensation in an amount to be established from time to time by resolution of the common council for attendance on the dates when the alcohol and licensing review board is in actual session each alternate member shall receive compensation in an amount to be as established from time to time by resolution of the common council for attendance on the dates the alcohol and licensing review board is in actual session and the alternate members attendance thereto is requested by the clerk   432018   part 2003   duties the board shall perform the duties functions and proceedings provided for in of the city members of the board will select a chairperson and vice chairperson from its membership it shall be the duty of the chairperson or in their absence the duty of the vice chairperson to conduct the business of the board in addition the chairperson or vicechair person shall appear at the request of the common council or committee of the whole to represent the board and report on the boards findings and recommendations three members shall constitute a quorum action shall be by a majority of those members present and voting   432018   part 2003 historical library and museum board composition the historical library and museum board shall consist of nine members such members
