enforceable upon transfer of title of the property of sale inheritance or will in the manner provided by law for the enforcement of mechanics liens except when such transfer is to a surviving spouse who meets the above requirements 2 the owner of such property his or her heirs personal representative or assigns may discharge the lien at any time by paying the amount of such lien with accrued interest as computed above to the finance officertreasurer who shall execute a proper satisfaction piece which shall be recorded with the register of deeds 3 the holder of any other lien against such real estate may purchase with the written consent of both the property owner and the city such lien of payment of the amount thereof with accrued interest as computed above to the city finance officertreasurer who shall execute and deliver a proper assignment thereof to such payer and upon recording the assignment the assignee shall have the same rights which the city had prior to the assignment 4 the finance officertreasurer will annually notify the property owners of their outstanding debt plus a breakdown of principal and accrued interest in addition an annual report will be submitted to the city administrator reporting on the financial impact of the participants    special charges permissible a in addition to all other methods provided by law special charges for current services may be imposed by resolution by the common council by allocating all or part of the cost of the property served such resolution setting forth the property location the current service rendered by the city and the special charge therefore or cost thereof such resolution for special charges may include but not be limited by enumeration to snow and ice removal weed elimination street sprinkling oiling or tarring repair of sidewalks or curb and gutter garbage and refuse disposal sewer service and tree care or removal the provision for notice of such charges shall be optional with the common council except that in the case of street sidewalk curb or gutter repair twenty 20 days notice published in the official city newspaper or by posting such notice in three places in the city and a copy of such notice mailed to every affected person whose post office address is known at least ten 10 days before the hearing or proceeding such notice shall specify that on a certain date a hearing will be held by the common council as to whether the service in question shall be performed b special charges for current services shall not be payable in installments if not paid within the period fixed by the common council in such resolution such delinquent special charges pursuant to shall become a lien on such property as of the date of such delinquency and shall automatically be extended upon the current or next tax roll as a delinquent tax against the property as provided by 16 of the wisconsin statutes and all proceedings in relation to the collection return and sale of property for delinquent real estate taxes shall apply to such special charge notice of special charges for current services need not be given except as required by 16 of the wisconsin statutes as amended    miscellaneous provisions a if any assessment or charge levied under this chapter is invalid because such statutes are found to be unconstitutional the common council may thereafter reassess such assessment or charge pursuant to the provisions of any applicable law b the common council may without notice or hearing levy and assess all or any part of the cost of any work or improvement upon the property benefited if notice and hearing is waived in writing by property owners affected c notwithstanding any other provision of law or this or other ordinance or resolution it is specifically intended and provided by this section that the city may levy special assessments for work or improvement against the property benefited either before or after the approval of the work plans and specifications contracting for the work or completing the work or improvement    payments installments deferred payments interest penalties a the assessments shall be paid in total in cash or in annual installments as provided by the final assessment resolution annual special assessment installment payments shall be due by january 31st of each year b assessments may be deferred by the council if the council determines such deferral is in the best interest of the city such deferred assessments shall be deferred for a period of time not to exceed ten 10 years from the date the improvements are installed if any portion of the improvements are utilized prior to the end of the ten 10 year period the outstanding principal and interest for the said public improvements shall be paid immediately c to encourage prompt payment of assessments the city will allow property owners a discount of three percent of the total assessment amount for lands located within the city limits if the assessment is paid in full within thirty 30 days of the date of invoice by the city deferred payments and installment payments on lands within the city limits shall bear interest at the rates set forth below 1 if an amount equal to sixty 60 percent of the full lump sum amount of the assessment is paid within thirty 30 days of the date of invoice by the city then the unpaid balance to be paid in equal annual installments together with interest on the unpaid balance at the rate at which the city can borrow for plus two percent 2 if the assessment is paid in equal annual installments without any upfront lumpsum payment then the installment shall incur interest on the unpaid balance at the rate at which the city can borrow for plus three percent 3 if between forty 40 percent and sixty 60 percent of the full lump sum of the special assessment is paid within thirty 30 days of the date of invoice by the city then the unpaid balance shall be paid in a lump sum amount at the end of a period equal to the period allowed for annual installment payments together with interest on the unpaid interest at the rate at which the city can borrow plus two percent 4 any special assessments may be paid in an amount equal to the remaining balance due together with any interest due at any time d all assessments or installments not paid by the specified date shall be extended on the tax roll as a delinquent tax and collected in the same manner as a delinquent real estate tax special assessments or special assessment installments when allowed by the levying resolution which are not paid when due shall be charged fifteen 15 percent of the total late payment as a onetime penalty which together with the late payment shall be added to the tax roll as a delinquent tax against the property installments or assessments not paid when due shall also bear an additional interest charge in an amount of eight percent per annum for the period of delinquency above and beyond the penalty charge established in this section    special assessments outside municipal boundaries a wisconsin statutes 6665 provides that special assessments may be levied for municipal work or improvements under wisconsin statutes 6660 upon property in an adjacent city village or town if such property abuts upon and benefits from such work or improvements b special assessments to property outside of the city limits of the city may be levied under the authority granted in wisconsin statutes 6660 and not under the provisions of the chapter the common council of the city shall adopt a resolution requesting the governing body of the property outside the city limits to approve a resolution authorizing the levying of special assessments by the city against the property outside the city limits upon approval of a final resolution by the adjacent governing body the special assessments shall be levied and collected by the adjoining governing body and remitted to the city when the owner of the property outside the municipal boundaries pays the special assessment he or she is entitled to the use of the work or improvement upon which the assessment is based and with the same conditions as the owner of property within the municipal boundaries c properties outside the corporate limits of the city which are contemplating annexation to the city shall not be specially assessed except pursuant to wisconsin statutes however any property owner contemplating annexation may at their option choose to pay their cost sharing amounts minus fifteen 15 percent of the total amount set forth in subsection  of this section and further provided that payment is made to the city and the city adopts an ordinance annexing the property all within six months of the date of adoption of the final assessment resolution d properties outside the corporate limits of the city which are not contemplating annexation to the city or whose owners do not elect the option provided in subsection c of this section shall not be specially assessed unless the governing body of these properties approves the special assessment and levies collects and remits the special assessment payments to the city such special assessment shall be levied under the authority granted in wisconsin statutes however the city reserves the right to calculate the prorated costs of the improvements resulting in benefit to the properties located outside the city limits as a cost sharing amount together with any interest due to be considered at the time of annexation of the properties to the city the city reserves the right to determine at the time of annexation what cost sharing amounts should reasonably be paid by the property owner and under what payment terms and conditions    petition for improvementswaiver of assessment procedures a any taxpayer and property owner in the city may petition the city for the installation of public improvements to serve the property owned by such petitioner in the city 1 petition requirements the petition for the installation of public improvements shall state that a the petitioners requests public improvements to serve property owned by the petitioner  b shall describe such property  c shall state the type of public improvements requested  d shall contain a waiver of special assessment notice and hearing stating that each petitioner individually shall be responsible and liable for and thereby obligates himself or herself to pay the total direct and indirect costs of the installation of such public improvements  e shall state the petitioners desired term of the special assessments 2 council action in the event a petition for the installation of public improvements is presented to the city council the council shall have the exclusive discretion to approve reject or modify with concurrence of the petitioner the petition the council may refer such petition to its standing committees for determinations of project costs project financing feasibility and timing of construction and other matters or may table it modify it with the petitioner or may reject it but shall act on such petition in some manner within six months of receipt of such petition 3 timing of petition any petition for improvements shall be filed with the city council on or before august 1st of the year preceding the desired installation of the public improvement so as to be considered in the city budget for the following year and so as to permit the necessary engineering of the requested public improvements petitions may be filed with the city council at other times of the year and with other desired installation times the city council andor its standing committee shall review these petitions without commitment or obligation for consideration of the project costs project financing feasibility and timing of construction and other such matters and may elect to authorize the installation of the requested public improvements as a special project or as an addition to a previously authorized project  room tax definitions in this chapter the following definitions shall apply gross receipts has the meaning as defined in 4a wisconsin statutes insofar as applicable hotel or motel means a building or a group of buildings in which the public may obtain accommodations for a consideration including without limitation such establishments as inns motels tourist homes tourist houses or courts bed and breakfast establishments lodging houses rooming houses summer camps apartment hotels resort lodges and cabins commercial indoor lodging facilities as defined in the code of ordinances and any other building or group of buildings in which accommodations are available to the public except accommodations including mobile homes as defined in 1d wisconsin statutes rented for a continuous period of more than one month and accommodations furnished by any hospitals sanitariums or nursing homes or by corporations or associations organized and operated exclusively for religious charitable or educational purposes provided that no part of the net earnings of such corporations and associations inures to the benefit of any private shareholder or individual transient means any person residing for a continuous period of less than one month in a hotel motel or other furnished accommodations available to the public  part 1998 prior code  341   imposition of tax pursuant to wisconsin statutes a tax is imposed on the privilege and services of furnishing at retail or rooms or lodging to transients by hotel keepers motel operators and other persons furnishing accommodations that are available to the public irrespective of whether membership is required for the use of the accommodations such tax shall be at the rate of four percent of the gross receipts from such retail furnishing of rooms or lodgings however starting  such tax rate will be five and onehalf percent of gross receipts from such retail furnishing of rooms or lodgings starting  such tax rate will be seven percent of gross receipts from such retail furnishing of rooms or lodgings such tax shall not be subject to the selective sales tax imposed by 2a wisconsin statutes and may not be imposed upon sales to the federal government and persons listed under 9a wisconsin statutes  12202016   11152016   part 1998 prior code  342   collection of tax this section shall be administered by the city treasurer the tax imposed for the months of january february and march 199 and for each calendar quarter thereafter is due and payable on the last day of the month next succeeding the calendar quarter for which imposed a return shall be filed with the city treasurer by those furnishing at retail such rooms and lodging on or before the same date on which such tax is due and payable such return shall show the gross receipts of the preceding calendar quarter from such retail furnishing of rooms or lodging the amount of taxes imposed for such period and such other information as the city treasurer deems necessary every person required to file such quarterly return shall with their first return elect to file an annual calendar year or fiscal year return such annual return shall be filed within ninety 90 days of the close of each such calendar or fiscal year the annual return shall summarize the quarterly returns reconcile and adjust for errors in the quarterly returns and shall contain such additional information as the city treasurer requires such annual returns shall be made on forms as prescribed by the city treasurer all such returns shall be signed by the person required to file a return or his duly authorized agent but need not be verified by oath the city treasurer may for good cause extend the time for filing any return but in no event longer than one month from the filing date  part 1998 prior code  343   sale or conveyance of business if any person liable for any amount of tax under this section sells out their business or stock of goods or quits the business their successors or assigns shall withhold sufficient of the purchase price to cover such amount until the former owner produces a receipt from the city treasurer that it has been paid or a certificate stating that no amount is due if a person subject to the tax imposed by this section fails to withhold such amount of tax from the purchase price as required they shall become personally liable for payment of the amount required to be withheld by them to the extent of the price of the accommodations valued in money  part 1998 prior code  344   determination of tax by audit a the city treasurer may by office audit determine the tax required to be paid to the city or the refund due to any person under this chapter this determination may be made upon the basis of the facts contained in the return being audited or on the basis of any other information within the city treasurers possession that meets the criteria set forth in 2 wisconsin statutes one or more such office audit determinations may be made of the amount due for anyone or for more than one period b the city treasurer may by field audit determine the tax required to be paid to the city or the refund due to any person under this chapter the determination may be made upon the basis of the facts contained in the return being audited or upon any other information within the city treasurers possession whenever the city treasurer has probable cause to believe that the correct amount of room tax has not been assessed or that the tax return is not correct the city treasurer is authorized to examine and inspect the books records memoranda and property of any person in order to verify the tax liability of that person or of another person nothing herein shall prevent the city treasurer from making a determination of tax at any time  part 1998 prior code  345   failure to file return if any person fails to file a return by this chapter the city treasurer shall make an estimate of the amount of the gross receipts under such estimate shall be made for the period for which such person failed to make a return and shall be based upon any information which is in the city treasurers possession or may come into his or her possession on the basis of this estimate the city treasurer shall compute and determine the amount required to be paid to the city adding to the sum thus arrived at a penalty equal to ten 10 percent thereof one or more such determinations may be made for one or more than one period  part 1998 prior code  346   forfeiture relating to returns not filed timely a forfeiture of twentyfive 25 percent of the room tax due for the previous year or five thousand dollars $500000 whichever is less of the tax imposed is hereby established and due and owing in the event that the room tax is not paid within thirty 30 days after the due date of the return in addition to this forfeiture all unpaid taxes under this section shall bear interest at the rate of twelve 12 percent per annum from the due date of the return until the first day of the month following the month in which the tax is paid or deposited with the city treasurer all refunded taxes shall bear interest at twelve 12 percent per annum from the due date of the return until the first day of the month following the month in which such taxes are refunded an extension of time within which to file a return shall not operate to extend the due date of the return for purposes of interest computation if the city treasurer determines that any overpayment of tax has been made intentionally or by reason of carelessness or neglect or if the tax which was overpaid was not accompanied by a complete return it shall not allow any interest thereon  part 1998 prior code  347   delinquent tax returns delinquent tax returns shall be subject to a twentyfive dollar $2500 late filing fee the tax imposed by this section shall become delinquent if not paid by the due date of the return  part 1998 prior code  348   filing of fraudulent returns if a person files a false or fraudulent return with the intent in either case to defeat or evade the tax imposed by this section a penalty of fifty 50 percent shall be added to the tax required to be paid exclusive of interest and other penalties  part 1998 prior code  349   posting of security as requested by city treasurer in order to protect the revenue of the city the city treasurer may require any person liable for the tax imposed by this chapter to place with him or her such security not in excess of five thousand dollars $500000 as the city treasurer determines if any taxpayer is delinquent in the payment of the taxes imposed by this section the city treasurer may upon ten 10 days notice recover the taxes interest and penalties from the security placed with the city treasurer by such taxpayer no interest shall be paid or allowed by the city to any person for the deposit of such security  part 1998 prior code  3410   record keeping requirements every person liable for the tax imposed by this chapter shall keep or cause to be kept such records receipts invoices and other pertinent papers in such form as the city treasurer requires  part 1998 prior code  3411   confidentiality of tax returns a all tax returns schedules exhibits writings or audit reports relating to such returns on file with the city treasurer are deemed to be confidential except the city treasurer may divulge their contents to the following and no others 1 the person who filed the return  2 officers agents or employees of the federal internal revenue service or the state department of revenue  3 officers employees or agents of the city treasurer  4 other persons for use in the discharge of duties imposed by law or in the discharge of the duties of their office unless otherwise prohibited by law or by order of a court b no person having an administrative duty under this section shall make known in any manner the business affairs operations or information obtained by an investigation of records of any person on whom a tax is imposed by this section or the amount of source of income profits losses expenditures or any particular thereof set forth or disclosed in any return or to permit any return or copy thereof to be seen or examined by any person except as provided in this section any person violating this section or subsequent ordinances or resolutions adopted by the city pertaining to the confidentiality of the information described in this section may be required to forfeit not less than one hundred dollars $10000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000  part 1998 prior code  3412   penalties any person who is subject to the tax imposed by this chapter who fails or refuses to permit the inspection of this records by the city treasurer after such inspection has been duly requested by the city treasurer or who fails to file a return as provided in this section or who fails to post security requested by the city treasurer or who violates any other provisions of this section shall be subject to a forfeiture not to exceed two hundred fifty dollars $25000 each day or portion thereof that such violation continues is deemed to constitute a separate offense the total forfeiture imposed shall not exceed five percent of the tax imposed by this chapter  part 1998 prior code  3413   exemptions for tax year 199 any person or business otherwise required to file a return and make payment to the city under this section will be allowed an exemption from the requirement to collect and pay room tax for any signed contract dated prior to  in which the contract guarantees the lodging rates this exemption will expire on   part 1998 prior code  3414   creation and duties of tourism promotion and development commission a the creation of a tourism promotion and development commission is created under boards commissions and committees of the municipal code of ordinances b seventy 70 percent of the tax collected by the city under this chapter shall be forwarded to the commission to be spent on tourism promotion and development by the commission the commission shall have the authority and carry out the duties set forth in 1mc and d wisconsin statutes and as otherwise provided by law such duties shall include without limitation the following 1 using the room tax revenue that it receives from the city to promote and develop tourism in the city  2 reporting any delinquencies or inaccurate reporting of room tax to the city  3 reporting at least annually to the city the purposes for which the room tax revenues it received were spent c the commission may not however use any of the room tax revenue it receives to construct or develop a lodging facility  part 1998 prior code  3415 title 5  business licenses and regulations chapters licenses and permits generally license fees to be reviewed all permit fees and license fees found in this title shall be reviewed by the finance committee every two years  part 1999  prior code  7134   duty of city clerk with regard to issuing licensesappeals a duty of city clerk with regard to issuing licenses 1 the city clerk shall be charged with the enforcement of all ordinances relating to issuances of all licenses and permits in this code of ordinances unless other provisions are made by the common council for the enforcement 2 in the event that a license or permit is applied for under this municipal code the city clerk shall hold and not issue the license or permit until the city finance officer certified that all personal property taxes hereof and all local taxes assessments claims and forfeitures resulting from a violation and conviction of any city ordinance due and owing at the time of the grant of the license or permit relating to the individual property business or corporation are covered by the license or permit are paid in full b appeal process an individual business or corporation wishing to appeal the city clerks decision not to issue the license or permit may request in writing that the matter be referred to the common council a public hearing shall be scheduled within fourteen 14 calendar days by the common council the council shall consider all of the relevant information and shall render a decision which shall be binding  alcoholic beverage licenses state statutes adopted a the provisions of wisconsin statutes are adopted and incorporated within this chapter all future amendments to wisconsin statutes are adopted and incorporated herein as of the effective dates of those amendments b this section is subject to the provisions of the penalty section of this chapter    classes of alcohol beverages licenses the common council may issue the following licenses in this chapter these licenses are hereinafter referred to as alcohol beverages licenses a fermented malt beverages licenses 1 class a licenses  2 class b licenses  3 wholesalers fermented malt beverages licenses b intoxicating liquor licenses 1 class a licenses  2 class b licenses which authorize the sale of intoxicating liquor to be consumed by the glass only on the premises where sold and also authorize the sale of intoxicating liquor in the original package or container in multiples not to exceed four liters at any one time and to be consumed off the premises where sold wine however may be sold for consumption off the premises in the original package or otherwise in any quantity  3 class c licenses which authorize the sale of wine by the glass or in an opened original container for consumption on the premises where sold the license may be issued to a person qualified under 3m wisconsin statutes 4 reserve class b license a reserve class b license means a license that is not granted or issued on  and is counted under 4br wisconsin statutes which authorizes the retail sale of intoxicating liquor for consumption on the premises where sold by the glass to be consumed on the licensed premises or in the original package or container in multiples not to exceed four liters at any one time and to be consumed off the licensed premises except that wine may be sold in the original container or otherwise in any quantity to be consumed off the premises  452005   part 2000  prior code  723   alcohol beverages license fees the annual fees for alcohol beverages licenses shall be as follows a fermented malt beverages licenses 1 class a license $20000 2 class b license $10000 3 wholesalers license $2500 b intoxicating liquor licenses 1 class a licenses $50000 2 class b licenses $50000 3 class c licenses $10000 4 reserve class b license a subject to the limitations contained herein the fee for a reserve class b license shall be ten thousand dollars $1000000 in addition to any other fee required under this chapter the initial fee is not prorated and must be paid prior to issuance of the license b renewal the annual fee for renewal of a reserve class b license shall be five hundred dollars $50000 c recognition of economic development 1997 wisconsin act 27 provides that reserve class b licenses be required to pay an initial minimum license fee of ten thousand dollars $1000000 after review of the statutory language and various ordinances enacted throughout the state the city of sun prairie finds that i it is in the interests of the public welfare to increase the property tax base provide employment opportunities attract tourists and generally enhance the economic and cultural climate of the community by providing additional economic incentives for new businesses with liquor licenses ii the present fee greatly exceeds the actual cost the municipality incurs to regulate the reserve class b license iii in the absence of action which alleviates the problem outlined above said fee could deter new businesses from opening and new businesses from reopening in the city of sun prairie d alcohol beverage development grant i the city of sun prairie hereby creates a business development grant hereafter development grant to be funded by the fees paid by reserve class b licenses ii thirty 30 days following the granting of any new reserve class b license the applicant may file an application for a development grant of ten thousand dollars $1000000 with the city clerk following the receipt of the application for said development grant the city clerk shall determine whether the licensee is operating in compliance with the approved reserve class b license the city clerk may require the assistance of any other city agency in making said determination iii if the city clerk determines the applicantlicensee is operating in compliance with the previously approved reserve class b license the city clerk shall authorize the approval of the ten thousand dollar $1000000 development grant if the city clerk determines the applicantlicensee is not in compliance with the approved license no development grant may be authorized and the city clerk shall make such finding in writing and deliver a copy of the findings to the applicantlicensee if the applicantlicensee disagrees with the city clerks determination the applicantlicensee may file a written notice of appeal with the city clerk within ten 10 calendar days of the delivery of the written notice of the city clerks findings upon receiving such notice from the applicantlicensee the city clerk shall relay said notice to the city of sun prairie council which shall hold a hearing thereon the city of sun prairie council may affirm or reverse the city clerks determination if the city clerks determination is upheld appeal thereof may be taken to circuit court pursuant to title 4 administrative determination review of the municipal the city of sun prairie if the city clerks determination is reversed the city clerk shall authorize the payment of the development grant iv in accepting the onetime development grant the applicantlicensee agrees to waive any claim hesheit may have against the city of sun prairie for refund of any part of the reserve class b license fee paid to the city by the applicantlicensee this waiver shall be effective whether such license fee be repealed rescinded or modified by action of the state legislature or by the courts by accepting this onetime development grant of ten thousand dollars $1000000 the applicantlicensee also agrees that in the event any court of competent jurisdiction shall determine the citys development grant program does not serve a public purpose or is otherwise contrary to law the applicantlicensee will upon demand by the city repay the onetime development grant to the city c temporary liquor licenses 1 temporary class bclass b license $1000 a applications received less than sixty 60 days prior to the event will incur a late fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 payment of the late filing fee shall not relieve any person from any other penalties prescribed in this chapter for failure to obtain the license payment of late filing fees with permit fees must be made with a credit card certified check or cash d late fees alcohol licenses shall be applied for by april 15 and shall be obtained on or before june 30 of each year or be subject to a late filing fee of one hundred dollars $10000 applications submitted may 1 and after shall be subject to a late filing fee of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 payment of the late filing fee shall not relieve any person from any other penalties prescribed in this chapter for failure to obtain the license payment of fees after june 20 must be made with a credit card certified check or cash e background check fees in addition to the fees stated all processed applications will be assessed the actual cost of the background check as incurred by the city for each person listed on the application f change of agent fees a licensee requesting a change of agent shall conform to all provisions of wisconsin statutes and this section of the city ordinances in addition the licensee shall be required to pay a fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 plus the actual cost of the background check incurred by the city g change of premises fees a licensee requesting a change to the permanent or temporary premises description shall conform to all provisions of wisconsin statutes and this section of the city ordinances in addition the licensee shall be required to pay a fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 plus the actual cost of the background checks as incurred by the city for each person listed on the application  2016   1212009   452005   2002   alcohol beverages license quotas the common council shall issue no more than the following number of alcohol beverages licenses to be effective at any one time a fermented malt beverages licenses 1 the number of class a fermented malt beverage licenses to be issued hereunder shall not exceed one license for every one thousand 1000 of population in the city as determined by the annual wisconsin department of administration population estimate  2 the number of class b licenses shall be equal to the number of class b licenses and reserve class b licenses this quota shall not apply to special event class b licenses b intoxicating liquor licenses 1 the number of class a liquor licenses to be issued hereunder shall not exceed one license for every 1000 one thousand of population in the city as determined by the annual wisconsin department of administration population estimate  2 eighteen 18 class b licenses as of   3 the number of class b licenses shall be as provided in 4 wisconsin states  2003   2002   qualification of applicants a qualification requirements the qualification requirements for applicants for alcohol beverages licenses shall include the qualification requirements adopted from of the wisconsin statutes and the requirements prescribed in this section b right to premises to be eligible to receive or retain any alcohol beverages license an applicant must have the right to possess during the time period that the license would be or is effective the premises described in the application c citizenship of natural persons to be eligible to receive or retain any alcohol beverages license natural persons must be citizens of the united states and residents of wisconsin d qualifications of corporate applicants to be eligible to receive or retain any alcohol beverages license a corporation shall not have more than fifty percent 50% of the stock interest legal or beneficial of such corporation held by any person or persons not eligible for an alcohol beverages license under this chapter    application requirements a general application requirements the application requirements and procedures for an alcohol beverages license shall include the requirements and procedures adopted from of the wisconsin statutes and the requirements and procedures prescribed in this section b corporate applicants each corporate applicant shall file with its application a statement showing the names and addresses of the persons who have been its officers directors and stockholders and the amount of stock held by each such stockholder during the previous twelve 12 months each corporate applicant or licensee shall file with the city clerk a statement describing any transfers of stock within five business days of each such transfer c applications for premises which include an outdoor area if an application for an alcohol beverages license includes an outdoor area as a part of the description of the proposed premises 1 the applicant shall accurately describe the outdoor area which applicant proposes to be a part of the premises  2 the applicant shall describe the nature of the fencing or other measures intended to provide control over the operation of the outdoor area  3 the city clerk or designated department shall notify by first class mail all property owners within one hundred fifty 150 feet of the outdoor area of the pendency of the application such notices shall state the date time and place the plan commission will consider the application such notices shall be mailed at least ten 10 days prior to such plan commission these notice provisions shall not apply to any application for the renewal of a license unless such application is for premises which would include an outdoor area or a portion of an outdoor area which was not a part of the premises previously licensed to the licensee a publication will also be made in the official newspaper for the notice of the public hearing held by the common council and plan commission d applications for temporary class b fermented malt beverages and class b wine licenses 1 each application for a temporary class b class b license a shall correctly state the identity of the applicant  b shall state the hours and dates for which such license is requested no such license shall be valid for more than four consecutive calendar days  c shall if the event for which the license is requested is proposed to take place on city park property identify the exact location and size of the area or areas proposed to be fenced in and shall identify the proposed main point of sale facility the area or areas shall be proposed by the applicant and shall be subject to the approval of the director of recreation and the public works director or the directors designee  d shall if the event for which the license is requested is proposed to take place on cityowned property other than park property identify the exact location and size of the area or areas proposed to be fenced in and shall identify the proposed main point of sale facility the area or areas shall be proposed by the applicant and shall be subject to the approval of the chief of police or the chiefs designee  e shall if the applicant is some type of group identify the group the application shall be signed by the president of the group making such application or if there is no president by the person who holds the highest position of leadership within the group if any other person signs an application on behalf of a group that person is in violation of this paragraph if any person or group applies for a license as a front for some other person or group the person or group which applied for the license is in violation of this paragraph  f shall be accompanied by the following if any portion of the proposed premises includes part of a city street sidewalk or park or part of any other area owned controlled or maintained by the city i a signed agreement to protect the city and others from claims relating to such license such agreements shall include an agreement to indemnify defend and hold harmless the city and the citys common council committees officials officers employees and agents against any and all claims relating to any matter or incident which is in any way related to such license or is in any way related to acts or omissions related to such license the issuance of such license or the use of such license such agreement shall include any other terms required by the city administrator ii written confirmation of the existence of a liability insurance policy issued to the applicant and approved as to the policys form and limits by the city finance officer  g shall be filed with the city clerk at least sixty days 60 prior to the granting of any such license  1192016   part 2000   1998  prior code  727   review of applications and issuance of licenses a departments review the city clerk shall provide copies of each application for an alcohol beverages license including each application for renewal of an existing license to the chief of police the chief of the fire department the building inspector city planner public works director ems director and finance director or designees 1 the chief of police the chief of the fire department building inspector city planner public works director ems director and finance director or designees shall review each application and conduct any other appropriate investigation for the purpose of determining whether consistent with the departments responsibilities to the city if the department has any objection to issuance of the requested license a written report shall be submitted to the city clerk which states whether the department has any such objection and if it does the basis for the objection b public works director and the director of recreation if the application is for a special event class b license for an area which is outdoors which includes city park property the city clerk shall provide a copy of the application to the director of recreation and public works director the director or the directors designee shall review the application and conduct any other appropriate investigation and then submit a written report to the city clerk which states whether the director has any objection to the application and if he or she does the basis for the objection c reports to council the city clerk shall provide to the common council all reports and recommendation received from the chief of police the chief of the fire department the building inspector director of recreation city planner public works director ems director and finance director or designees d discretion of council the common council shall review and act upon each application for an alcohol beverages license on the basis of the particular merits of each such application nothing in this chapter limits the factors the common council may consider when reviewing or acting upon each such application e issuance of licenses if the common council approves an alcohol beverages license the city clerk shall issue the appropriate license to the applicant upon payment of the license fee f information on licenses all alcohol beverages licenses shall be numbered in the order in which they are issued and each shall state clearly the specific premises for which the license has been issued the date of issuance the date the license fee was paid and the name of the licensee and the conditions approved by the common council  1192016     standards for premises a definitions except as otherwise provided in this section 1 convenience store means a retail store featuring an incomplete assortment of food food preparation materials and household items characterized by daily extended hours of operation ie fifteen 15 to twentyfour 24 hours seven days a week where the average customer stay is short and parking turnover is high convenience stores are utilized by customers as quickstop grocery stores usually selling beverages and food items 2 grocery store means a retail store of ten thousand 10000 square feet or greater whose principal business is the sale of a complete line of food for offpremises consumption 3 immediate supervision means that the supervisor must be able to see at all times the activities of those persons selling the fermented malt beverages andor intoxicating liquors 4 liquor store means a retail store whose principal business is the sale of intoxicating liquor fermented malt beverages and related items such as cups ice mixers and snacks 5 mixed retail store means a retail store whose principal business includes the sale of such things as various lines of food for offpremises consumption andor the sale of common necessaries like household goods clothes or pharmacy items examples of such stores include what are commonly called big box stores and which are not otherwise included in other defined businesses within this section 6 specialty food store means a retail store under ten thousand 10000 feet whose principal business is the sale of fresh meats seafood cheeses produce candies or other similar food items 7 premises means the area described in a license or permit 8 principal business means the primary activity as determined by analyzing the amount of capital labor time attention and floor space devoted to each business activity and by analyzing the sources of net income and gross income the name appearance and advertising of the entity may also be taken into consideration b terms and conditions the following standards are conditions precedent to issuance of any alcohol beverages license and are terms and conditions of every alcohol beverages license issued under this chapter c general standards the general standards are 1 compliance with law the premises shall comply with all city state and federal ordinances regulations codes rules statutes and laws including those which become effective after issuance of an alcohol beverages license 2 houses the premises shall not consist of or be in any dwelling house flat or residential apartment 3 unpaid assessments the premises shall not have any delinquent or unpaid city taxes assessments or other financial claims of the city there shall not be any equipment on the premises which has delinquent or unpaid city taxes assessments or other financial claims of the city d standards for premises licensed with a class a fermented malt beverage license only the following premises may be granted a class a fermented malt beverage license 1 a liquor store with access to the public only provided directly from a public way sales and displays of fermented malt beverages or displays of merchandise may only take place in the licensed premises 2 a convenience store provided a a separate area is provided for the sale of fermented malt beverages and said area is surrounded by solid or gated walls at least seven feet six inches in height that restrict access to the fermented beverage area by the general public directly from a public way a checkout to serve both sides of the business may be employed if it can be secured to prohibit access by the general public to the licensed premises when closed after permitted hours one access for the general public may also be provided from the convenience store however such access shall be restricted in width to five feet wide and shall be able to be securely closed by use of a locked door or gate during those hours when sales are prohibited upon entering the licensed premises from the convenience store customers may not return to the convenience store connecting doorway but must exit directly to a public way b fermented beverage sales are prohibited in the nonlicensed portion of the business c fermented malt beverages or displays of merchandise may only take place in the licensed premises d during all hours that fermented beverage sales are permitted no less than two employees shall be working at the convenience store location and all sales of fermented beverages must occur in the licensed premises and the sales transaction must be handled by a person licensed or directly supervised by a person licensed for the sale of fermented malt beverages as required by state law 3 a grocery store or mixed retail store provided a the area containing alcoholic beverages is only open to the public between the hours of eight am and nine pm if the store continues in operation beyond those hours a separate area for containing alcoholic beverages shall be provided secured and located as follows i that the separate area provided for the display of fermented malt beverages is either enclosed by solid walls at least seven feet six inches in height or in a separate aisle with solid shelving structures on each side at least seven feet six inches in height so as to not allow access either over the adjoining structure into the fermented beverage area by the general public during hours of closure ii the that opens to the general store area may not exceed eight feet in width and must be capable of being locked and secured during the hours of closure with doors or gates so as to prevent a person from entering as required by state law b an additional display of fermented malt beverages of up to five hundred 500 square feet shall be permitted throughout the general store area between the hours of eight am and nine pm in the event the store holds both a class a intoxicating liquor license and a class a fermented malt beverage license the combined display of both wine and fermented malt beverages shall be limited to five hundred 500 square feet or less the display must be removed from the general store area and placed in a secure area between nine pm and eight am c sales may occur in the licensed premises or at the store checkout lines by a person licensed or directly supervised by a person licensed for the sale of fermented malt beverages d if the fermented malt beverages are not kept in a separate clearly defined area the applicant shall submit a security plan for loss prevention and present it for approval by the sun prairie police department for the issuance of any license issuance of the license is contingent upon approval of the security plan 4 a specialty food store provided a the store is only open to the public between the hours of eight am and nine pm b the display of the fermented malt beverage is limited to one hundred 100 square feet or less in the event the specialty food store holds both a class a intoxicating liquor license and a class a fermented malt beverage license the combined display of both intoxicating liquor and fermented malt beverages is limited to one hundred 100 square feet or less c all sales transactions must be handled by a person licensed or directly supervised by a person licensed for the sale of fermented malt beverages as required by state law e standards for premises licensed with a class a intoxicating liquor license only the following premises may be granted a class a intoxicating liquor license 1 a liquor store with access to the public only provided directly from a public way sale and displays of intoxicating liquor or displays of merchandise may only take place in the licensed premises 2 a convenience store provided a a separate area is provided for the sale of intoxicating liquor beverages and said area is surrounded by solid or gated walls at least seven feet six inches in height that restrict access to the fermented beverage area by the general public directly from a public way a checkout to serve both sides of the business may be employed if it can be secured to prohibit access by the general public to the licensed premises when closed after permitted hours one access for the general public may also be provided from the convenience store however such access shall be restricted in width to five feet wide and shall be able to be securely closed by use of a locked door or gate during those hours when sales are prohibited upon entering the licensed premises from the convenience store customers may not return to the convenience store connecting doorway but must exit directly to a public way b intoxicating liquor sales are prohibited in the nonlicensed portion of the business c intoxicating liquor beverages or displays of merchandise may only take place in the licensed premises d during all hours that intoxicating liquor sales are permitted no less than two employees shall be working at the convenience store location and all sales of fermented beverages must occur in the licensed premises and the sales transaction must be handled by a person licensed or directly supervised by a person licensed for the sale of intoxicating liquor as required by state law 3 a grocery store or mixed retail store provided a the area containing alcoholic beverages is only open to the public between the hours of eight am and nine pm if the store continues in operation beyond those hours a separate area for containing alcoholic beverages shall be provided secured and located as follows i that the separate area provided for the displays of intoxicating liquor is either enclosed by solid walls at least seven feet six inches in height or in a separate aisle with solid shelving structures on each side at least seven feet six inches in height so as to not allow access either over the adjoining structure into the intoxicating liquor area by the general public during hours of closure ii the throughway that opens to the general store area may not exceed eight feet in width and must be capable of being locked and secured during the hours of closure b an additional display of wine of up to five hundred 500 square feet shall be permitted throughout the general store area between the hours of eight am and nine pm in the event the store holds both a class a intoxicating liquor license and a class a fermented malt beverage license the combined display of both wine and fermented malt beverages is limited to five hundred 500 square feet or less the display must be removed from the general grocery area and placed in a secure area between nine pm and eight am c sales may occur in the licensed premises or at the store checkout lines by a person licensed or directly supervised by a person licensed for the sale of intoxicating liquor as required by state law d if the intoxicating liquor is not kept in a separate clearly defined area the applicant shall submit a security plan for loss prevention and present it for approval by the sun prairie police department for the issuance of any license issuance of the license is contingent upon approval of the security plan 4 a specialty food store provided a the store is only open to the public between the hours of eight am and nine pm b the display of the intoxicating liquors is limited to one hundred 100 square feet or less in the event the specialty food store holds both a class a intoxicating liquor license and a class a fermented malt beverage license the combined display of both intoxicating liquor and fermented malt beverages is limited to one hundred 100 square feet or less c all sales transactions must be handled by a person licensed or directly supervised by a person licensed for the sale of intoxicating liquors as required by state law f standards for premises which include an outdoor area 1 unless an alcohol beverages license contains express language to the contrary premises licensed under this chapter include only areas within buildings and do not include any outdoor area 2 the premises shall not include any outdoor area unless a all parts of the outdoor area are more than one hundred 100 feet from all structures used for residential purposes except the outdoor area does not have to be any distance from residential uses located in a structure which would be part of the licensed premises b the outdoor area is less than fifty percent 50% of the gross floor area of the portion of the proposed premises which is inside a building c the outdoor area is completely enclosed with a fence not less than five feet high d the outdoor area does not comply with subsections f2ac above but is authorized by permit under 24 or 25 of the zoning regulations pertaining to private outdoor cafes and sidewalk cafes respectively g standard for premises licensed with a special event class b license premises inside a building which are licensed with a special event class b license shall have suitable exits and open spaces and adequate sanitary facilities to accommodate the number of people it is anticipated will attend the event h additional standards for class b premises 1 no class b class b reserve class b or special event class b licensee shall suffer or permit any person to appear on licensed premises in such manner or attire as to expose to view any portion of the pubic area anus vulva or genitals or any simulation thereof nor shall suffer or permit any female to appear on licensed premises in such a manner or attire as to expose to view any portion of the breast below the top of the areola or any simulation thereof 2 any licensee who shall violate the preceding paragraph shall be subject to revocation suspension or refusal to renew the license as set forth in the procedures in such section shall govern  1132015   6162015   362012   8192008   872007   6212005   2002   use of licenses a terms and conditions the following standards are terms and conditions of every alcohol beverages license issued under this chapter b general standards the general standards are 1 compliance with law the licensee shall comply with all city state and federal ordinances regulations codes rules statutes and laws including those which become effective after issuance of an alcohol beverages license 2 hours a premises with a fermented malt beverages license hours for premises for which a class a or class b license has been issued are as established by the wisconsin statutes except as provided below the following provisions do not apply to businesses which are exempt from their application under state law i class a licenses between nine pm and eight am no person on premises for which a class a license has been issued may sell any alcohol beverage between the same hours the premises may not be open for the conduct of any type of business ii class b licenses between nine pm and eight am no person on premises for which a class b license has been issued may sell any alcohol beverage in an original unopened package container or bottle or for consumption away from the premises b premises with an intoxicating liquor license hours for premises for which a class a class b or class c license has been issued are as established by the wisconsin statutes except as provided below the following provisions do not apply to businesses which are exempt from their application under state law i class a licenses between nine pm and eight am no person on premises for which a class a license has been issued may sell any alcohol beverage between the same hours the premises may not be open for the conduct of any type of business ii class b licenses between nine pm and eight am no person on premises for which a class b license has been issued may sell any alcohol beverage in an original unopened package container or bottle or for consumption away from the premises iii class c license between nine pm and eight am no person on premises for which a class c license has been issued may sell any alcohol beverage in an original unopened package container or bottle or for consumption away from the premises c standards which apply to certain premises 1 clubs no club shall sell or give away any alcohol beverages except to bona fide members or guests invited to be members 2 temporary class bclass b premises a fences the applicant shall specify on their application what type of fencing they request for approval for the serving and consumption area fencing requirements shall meet one of the standards as listed below all licenses shall comply with fencing requirements as approved by the common council 1 a single eightfoot chainlink fence may be used to meet the fence requirements there shall be only one point of ingress and egress  or 2 a double fence with one point of ingress and egress the double fence shall be a minimum of four feet high and minimum of six feet between fences 3 a single fourfoot vinyl fence with one point of ingress and egress  or 4 the applicant may request no fencing used customers are allowed to consume in the designated event area signs shall be used to define the area i customers allowed to leave the sales area with no more than two cups of alcohol which were consumed in the consumption area ii volunteers stationed at the perimeter to enforce the alcohol containment in the area b signs the licensee shall post at a conspicuous location at the main point of sale and at all remote points of sale signs stating that no fermented malt beverages shall be served to any underage person the licensee shall post all required signs designated in their permit c underage persons at point of sale or distribution no underage person shall assist in the sale or distribution of fermented malt beverages at any point of sale no underage person shall be inside the fenced area at any point of sale unless accompanied by his or her parent guardian or spouse who has attained the legal drinking age d underage person onpremises the licensee shall station a licensed operator or security guard at the entrance of each point of sale for the purpose of determining whether each person who attempts to enter the fenced area is the legal drinking age or older 1 an underage person may enter and remain onpremises for which a temporary class b license is issued under 6 wisconsin statutes if the licensee permits underage persons to be on the premises and is authorized by the common council e licensed operators a licensed operator shall be stationed at all points of sale at all times f permitted containters alcohol beverages shall be sold and served in approved containers serving containers shall meet the standards as listed below 1 alcohol beverages may be served in the following containers which has been opened with the cap removed by the server  paper  foam  aluminum or  plastic containers g exemptions the city council may exempt an applicant from requirements of subsections c2a upon a finding that such exemption is not contrary to the safety and well being of the public when making such a finding the council shall review a site plan of the area in which the fermented beverage andor wine will be sold or distributed the hours of operation the ability to maintain a secure perimeter around the premises the method by which underage persons will be identified the number of points of sale and the provision of security the council may require additional security at the applicants costs and add additional conditions to the license ie wristbanding time limits etc to provide for the safety and wellbeing of the public 3 outdoor premises if the premises include an outdoor area a no amplified sound or music is permitted in the outside area unless approved by the common council  1192016   652007   2000  prior code  7210   nonuse of license any class a class b class a class b or class c fermented malt andor intoxicating liquor andor wine license granted under this chapter may be revoked by the city council following a public hearing for the following reasons a the subject premises is not open for business within one hundred fifty 150 days of the granting of such license  or b the subject premises is not open for business for a period of one hundred fifty 150 consecutive days or more  9192006   suspension revocation or nonrenewal of alcoholic beverages licenses a alcohol and licensing review board the city shall use the alcohol and licensing review board hereinafter referred to in this section as the board for all purposes for which the wisconsin statutes allow a committee of the common council to be used in proceedings relating to the possible suspension revocation or nonrenewal of an alcohol beverages license b alcohol beverages license point system 1 purpose the purpose of the alcohol beverages license point system hereinafter referred to as the point system is to create a demerit point system which will establish a standard for determining whether an alcohol beverages license shall be suspended or revoked the point system is not intended to provide the only such standard and such licenses may be suspended or revoked under other provisions of this code including provisions adopted from the wisconsin statutes 2 assessment of demerit points a the police chief or designee shall make point assessment recommendations to the board when it has been determined that a demerit point violation has occurred in accordance with the alcohol and license review board guidelines a point violation occurs when a violation which is described within the demerit point schedule occurs on premises which are licensed with an alcohol beverages license the alcohol license review by the alcohol and licensing review board may decrease the total demerit points assessed when the ownerbartender takes action to preventcontrol the violation including by initiating contact with the police the violation may also be assessed when it occurs on properties adjacent to the licensed premises or in parking lots serving the licensed premises b the issue of whether a point violation has occurred may be determined by a court or judge or if it has not been so determined at the time the matter is before the board or the common council it shall be determined by the board andor the common council as necessary c if it is determined that a point violation has occurred points shall be assessed against the licensee of the premises where the point violation occurred points shall be assessed in accordance with the demerit point schedule d if it is determined that a point violation has occurred points shall be assessed against the licensee of the premises where the point violation occurred regardless of whether the licensee or some other person or entity committed the point violation and regardless of whether such point violation was committed with licensees approval or knowledge e if a point violation continues from one calendar day to the next calendar day each calendar day that the point violation exists is a separate point violation 3 demerit point schedule the demerit point schedule is as follows violations demerit points commission of any act on the premises which requires a license which the premises does not have 100 failure to use license as that offense is described in this chapter 100 failure to make the premises available for entry and inspection as required by ordinance these points are assessed one time for any one incident regardless of the number of people who committed the violation 100 illegal transfer of an alcohol beverage to an underage person on the premises 50 illegal transfer of an alcohol beverage by licensee or licensees agent or employee to an intoxicated person on the premises 50 underage person on the premises illegally 50 commission of any act on the premises which is defined as a crime this does not require a criminal charge or criminal conviction 50 violation of any ordinance relating to hours 50 failure to have licensee agent or operator on the premises as required 50 improper exhibition as that offense is described in this chapter 50 any violation of any other city state or federal ordinance regulation code rule statute or law 25 4 suspension or revocation if a licensee has an activity that could be considered a violation at any one premises within any twelvemonth period the alcohol license review board may issue a letter of warning as an alternative to point assessment the violation would be listed on file if a licensee has an activity that could be considered a violation at any one premises within any twelvemonth period the alcohol license review board may issue a letter of concern and point assessment up to one hundred 100 points if a licensee is assessed one hundred 100 or more points for one or more point violations which occurred at any one premises within any twelvemonth period all of the licensees alcohol beverages licenses for such premises may be suspended or revoked the alcohol license review board as an alternative may issue a formal letter of reprimand as an alternative to suspension andor revocation to a licensee who has been assessed one hundred 100 or more points but less than two hundred 200 points for one or more point violations which occurred at any one premises within any twelvemonth period if the licensee is assessed additional demerit points following the issuance of the formal letter of suspension or revocation within the same twelvemonth period all of the licensees alcohol beverages licenses for such premises shall be suspended or revoked if a licensee is assessed two hundred 200 or more points for one or more point violations which occurred at any one premises within any twelvemonth period all of the licensees alcohol beverages licenses for such premises shall be suspended or revoked if a license is suspended it shall be suspended for not less than ten 10 days and not more than ninety 90 days licenses may be suspended or revoked during a certain license year regardless of whether point violations occurred during that same license year or during one or more previous license years 5 initiation of proceedings under the point system a the alcohol and licensing review board shall initiate proceedings to determine whether an alcohol beverages license must be suspended or revoked under the point system if i the board deems it appropriate  or ii the board receives notice from anyone that a licensee has been assessed one hundred 100 or more points for one or more point violations which occurred at any one premises within a twelvemonth period  or iii the board receives notice from the city attorney that it is the city attorneys opinion that one or more point violations have occurred which would cause a licensee to be assessed one hundred 100 or more points and that such point violations occurred at one premises within a twelvemonth period the city attorneys opinion may be based in whole or in part upon determinations made by a court or judge b if the alcohol and licensing review board initiates proceedings under the point system it shall proceed as it would if a sworn written complaint against a licensee alleging that the licensee had violated this chapter had been filed with the city clerk by a city resident c hearing procedures during any hearing before the alcohol and licensing review board relating to the possible suspension revocation or nonrenewal of an alcohol beverages license 1 all parts of the hearing shall be audio recorded if any party requests a stenographic recording and transcription the city shall make the necessary arrangements but the expenses shall be borne by the requesting party 2 the rules of evidence which apply during hearings of contested cases under wisconsins administrative procedure chapter of the wisconsin statutes shall be followed so far as practicable at any hearing before the committee 3 the city clerk shall serve as secretary to the board 4 charges against a licensee must be proved to a reasonable certainty by the greater weight of the credible evidence 5 the boards report to the city council shall be by majority vote of the board members present d common council review procedures 1 the city clerk shall provide each member of the common council with a copy of the alcohol and licensing review report copies of all exhibits from the hearing and a copy of the transcript of the alcohol and licensing review hearing if such a transcript is prepared and is made available to the city clerk prior to the councils consideration of the matter 2 only those members of the common council who have certified to the city clerk that they have read all of the materials provided to them about the matter by the city clerk shall be permitted to vote on the matter the city clerk shall make such certifications a part of the record 3 if the common council decides to suspend revoke or not renew an alcohol beverages license the licensee subject to that action shall pay the city an amount equal to the total of all expenses the city incurred in connection with the suspension revocation or nonrenewal proceeding e issuance of licenses after revocation or nonrenewal 1 if the common council revokes a licensees alcohol beverages license a the city shall not issue any alcohol beverages license to that licensee within twelve 12 months of the date of revocation b the city shall not issue any alcohol beverages license to any successor of that licensee within twelve 12 months of the date of revocation i successor of that licensee includes any corporation in which that licensee is an officer or director or in which that licensee has a financial interest ii if the licensee whose license has been revoked is a corporation successor of that licensee also includes any individual who was an officer or director of that corporation at any time during the twelve 12 months prior to revocation  any individual who had a financial interest in the corporation at any time during the twelve 12 months prior to revocation  and any corporation which has an officer director or stockholder that was at any time during the twelve 12 months prior to revocation an officer director or stockholder of the corporation whose license has been revoked 2 if the common council decides to not renew a licensees alcohol beverages license a the city shall not issue any alcohol beverages license to that licensee which would be effective within twelve 12 months of the expiration date of the license which was not renewed b the city shall not issue any alcohol beverage operator license to that licensee which would be effective within twelve 12 months of the expiration date of the license which was not renewed c the city shall not issue any alcohol beverages license to any successor of that licensee which would be effective within twelve 12 months of the expiration date of the license which was not renewed i successor of that licensee includes any corporation in which that licensee is an officer or director or in which that licensee has a financial interest ii if the licensee whose license has been revoked is a corporation successor of that licensee also includes any individual who was an officer or director of that corporation at any time during the twelve 12 months prior to revocation  any individual who had a financial interest in the corporation at any time during the twelve 12 months prior to revocation  and any corporation which has an officer director or stockholder that was at any time during the twelve 12 months prior to revocation an officer director or stockholder of the corporation whose license has been revoked  1192016   652012   12152009   452005   part 2003  prior code  7211   security plan a security plan in addition to any other conditions placed upon a license by the common council at the time of approval renewal or after a suspensionrevocation or nonrenewal hearing pursuant to of these ordinances the police chief or designee is hereby authorized to impose additional conditions on such license subject to the limits on authority in subsection b of this section the clerk is directed to issue a new license that includes such additional conditions when notified in writing of such additional conditions by the police chief or designee the previously issued license is declared void upon the clerks preparation of the new license b limits on authority the police chief or designee is only authorized to formulate additional conditions that comprise a security plan in response to frequent or severe incidents requiring police intervention no condition that is part of a security plan may be contrary to or inconsistent with any statute or ordinance regulating alcohol beverages or any other condition authorized to be placed upon the license by the common council the police chief or designee shall consult with the city attorney in regards to the security plan c elements of plan a security plan may only include but is not limited to the following elements 1 provision for licensed security guards 2 monitoring of interior and exterior areas by licensee 3 regulating traffic flow in parking areas 4 exterior and interior lighting 5 regular meetings with the police chief or designee andor police department personnel 6 the posting of regulatory signage to aid enforcement efforts 7 limitations on the number of patrons allowed on the premises at certain times 8 video surveillance d procedures the chief of police or designee are encouraged to meet with license holders to develop a security plan but the elements of the plan are to be solely determined by the chief of police or designee the chief of police or designee shall provide notice of the contents of the security plan in writing to the licensee implementation of the security plan shall commence within thirty 30 days of the delivery of the notice to the licensee and complete adherence to the plan shall be achieved within ninety 90 days of the delivery of the notice to the licensee e appeal if the licensee objects to the security plan the licensee shall so notify the city clerk within ten 10 days of the date of the plan if the clerk receives an objection from the licensee the clerk shall notify the alcohol and licensing review then shall schedule a hearing the chief of police or designee and the licensee shall both be allowed to present evidence and make arguments the alcohol and licensing review board may consider any probative evidence without regard to the rules of evidence the hearing shall be audio recorded the alcohol and licensing review board may accept reject or modify the security plan as presented by the chief of police or designee if the licensee is aggrieved by the action of the alcohol and licensing review board the licensee has ten 10 days from the date of the decision by the alcohol and licensing review board to seek review by the common council review before the common council shall be upon a transcript of the proceeding before the alcohol and licensing review board the common council may accept reject or modify the decision of the alrb  1192016   2202007   operators licenses a the common council may issue operators licenses to applicants who are of the age eighteen 18 or older and in accordance with state statutes b the city clerk shall prepare a form which applicants for
