cityissued refuserecycling carts per residential unit  9182012   432012  prior code  15115   street trees a street trees shall be planted throughout all residential land divisions street trees shall be planted in accordance with b and  b fees a fee as established by the common council per residential lot shall be collected for a street tree at the time a building permit is issued for the initial construction of the residence the fee shall be placed into a city forestry fund to be used for the planting of new trees in the neighborhood in which the residence is located no fee shall be collected under this section if a street tree fee is required by b and   2000  prior code  15116   fences a permit required no person shall construct or authorize the construction of a fence without issuance of a building permit b permit fees a fee shall be collected pursuant to the building permit fee schedule referred to in each fence installed c location a plot plan shall be submitted showing the proposed location and shall be subject to the setback requirements of the zoning code  2003  prior code  15117   swimming pools a permit required a swimming pool in the ground on the ground or in a building shall not be constructed or installed without issuance of a building permit exemption storable swimming or wading pools with a maximum wall height of thirty 30 inches and constructed to be readily disassembled for storage and reassembled for use b public swimming pools and private indoor pools all public swimming pools and private swimming pools shall comply with the requirements of wis adm public swimming places c private outdoor swimming pool no permit shall be issued for an outdoor pool unless the following requirements are met 1 an enclosure at least fortyeight 48 inches high and a minimum of three feet from the pool of such construction as will make access difficult shall completely enclose the pool access shall be closing and latching gates with a locking device and shall be kept locked when pool is not in use  2 the enclosure may be omitted where above ground pools are installed and have a raised deck around the entire pool perimeter with an attached railing on the top outer edge of the raised deck or where the sidewalls of an above ground pool are extended by an enclosure fence to a minimum of six feet above grade access shall be closing and latching gates with a locking device and shall be kept locked when pool is not in use where pool ladders are provided they shall be a type that can be removed when pool is not in use  3 distance from all electrical wires to be a minimum of ten 10 feet  4 water connections and all plumbing shall comply with the plumbing code  5 pool shall not occupy more than thirty 30 percent of the rear yard and conform to permitted accessory uses regarding side and rear yard distance to lot lines   prior code  15118 electrical code state electrical a wis adm is adopted by reference and made a part of this chapter and shall apply to all electrical installed altered or repaired in the city any future amendments revisions and modifications of the administrative code provisions incorporated herein are intended to be made a part of this code a copy of these administrative code provisions and any future amendments thereto shall be kept on file in the office of the city clerk   8152017      access to buildings the electrical inspector or his or her authorized agent may during reasonable hours enter any public building in the discharge of his or her official duties or for the purpose of making any inspection or tests of the defective wires contained therein    authority to discontinue electric operation the electrical inspector may cause the turning off of electrical current to any equipment which is found to be in an unsafe condition and may cut or discontinue electrical services in cases of emergency and where such electrical currents are dangerous to life or property or may interfere with the work of the fire department no person shall reconnect any equipment thus cut off until permission is given by the electrical inspector    electrical license a required no person shall do electrical wiring in the city for a fee or other remuneration or compensation unless he or she has a license therefor from the city the electrical inspector may however issue a permit to any person desiring to personally install electrical wiring in his or her own private single family residence if such person proves he or she is competent to do such work in conformity with all rules and regulations governing the installation of electrical wiring in residences and pay the designated fee for such permit b application application for a license shall be made to the electrical inspector stating the license desired his or her name character of business for which license is desired and location thereof the license shall be issued by the building inspector c qualifications the electrical inspector shall determine the qualifications of the applicant and if satisfied that the applicant is competent to carry on the business stated in the application the electrical inspector shall issue the license d expiration of licenses each license unless sooner revoked shall expire january 1st next after the issuance thereof unless renewed by the payment of the annual fee on or before january 1st e license fees the fee shall be fifty dollars $5000 or twenty dollars $2000 on an inactive basis per year 1 licenses in force at the time of the adoption hereof shall remain in force until their expiration there being no other ground of disqualification such licenses shall be renewable without examination 2 it shall be the responsibility of every licensee to keep the building inspection division informed of any change in mailing address andor place of employment f revocation of license or permit any license or permit granted hereunder may be revoked by the common council if the licensee violated any provisions of this section or installs electrical construction which is a hazard to life or property    permits a required except as hereinafter provided no electrical wiring in new construction or building alterations shall be done in the city without a permit therefor from the electrical inspector no permit shall be issued unless satisfactory proof is furnished to the electrical inspector upon his or her request that the applicant has been employed to perform the work or installation and will be responsible for the performance thereof in the manner required by city ordinances and state law b application application for such permit shall be made on blanks furnished by the electrical inspector c inspection of existing wiring any owner of any premises in the city may request electrical inspection of his or her premises at the same fees as new construction d exceptions electrical work done on one and twofamily dwellings pursuant to permit and inspection under this title shall be exempt from the provisions of this section    electrical inspections any person upon completion of roughed in wiring before sheathing or covering any wiring from view shall notify the electrical inspector and he or she shall if satisfied upon inspecting the wiring as to workmanship and materials so far completed and installed give his or her approval when the wiring is completed another inspection shall be made and fees paid before the electrical inspector shall order the current turned off if convenient for the inspector and such person installing and wiring extra inspections may be made as work progresses on wiring on larger or more extensive installations the cost of such extra inspections shall be paid by the person requesting such extra inspections any person desiring an inspection shall notify the inspector at least fortyeight 48 hours before such inspection is expected to be completed    rewiring of existing buildings in the rewiring of existing buildings residential or when a residential service is changed the following work shall be done a receptacles shall be installed to provide a minimum of two in each living room one in each bedroom one in dining room two in each kitchen and in laundry exposed wiring in basements shall be in conduit all drop cords shall be removed and the furnace if necessary shall be rewired to comply with existing requirements b all defective sockets switches and other devices shall be repaired andor replaced proper lighting of all stairways in flats and apartments and for all basement stairs shall be provided all abandoned wiring in basements or where otherwise exposed shall be removed  plumbing code state plumbing a the provisions and regulations of wisconsin statutes and wisconsin administrative sps 381 are made a part of this chapter by reference and shall extend over and govern the installation of all plumbing installed altered or repaired in the city any future amendments revisions and modifications of the administrative code provisions incorporated herein are intended to be made a part of this code a copy of these administrative code provisions and any future amendments thereto shall be kept on file in the office of the city clerk b approvals required 1 requirements permits for plumbing installations or alterations under subsection a of this section shall be issued by the city building inspector only for plans which have been approved under subsection b2 of this section approvals may be obtained in any order provided no permit shall be issued by the building inspector until plans stamped or endorsed by all approving authorities are on file in his or her office 2 state approval required except when authority to approve plans has been delegated to the city building inspector all plans for commercial industrial or other classes of buildings or places of employment described in wisconsin statutes shall be approved by the wisconsin department of safety and professional services   8152017      definitions plumbing for the purpose of this chapter is defined as follows a as is stated in 1acd and e wisconsin statutes  b the construction connection to or alteration of any drain soil or waste pipe to carry domestic sewage stormwater or industrial waste from a point three feet outside of the foundation walls of any building to the sewer lateral at the curb or other disposal terminal including the private sewage disposal or treatment plant this definition does not include minor repairs to faucets and the removal of stoppages in soil or waste pipes    compulsory inspection the plumber in charge of each installation or repair of plumbing in the city shall notify the plumbing inspector whenever the work is ready for inspection all plumbing shall be left exposed until such time as the inspector has completed his or her examination and inspection when the inspector determines a test is necessary he or she may require a water or air test on any part of the entire installation    application and permits a no plumbing shall be installed in the city without first filing an application with accompanying fee as provided in this title  with the building inspector obtaining approval thereof and a permit therefrom this provision shall also apply to any building located outside the city before such building may be connected to the sewer or water system of the city licensed master plumbers may only receive such permits except a permit may be issued to a property owner to install plumbing in a singlefamily residence which is owned and occupied by such owner as his or her home b inspection fees upon certification by the plumbing inspector that the inspections have been made and that the installation is in accordance with applicable state codes and city ordinances the city shall be paid inspection fees as provided in this chapter  fee schedules permit plan examination administrative and field services fees a collection the fees fixed in this chapter shall be assessed and collected by the building inspection division for the plan examination permitting and inspection of new buildings and structures additions and alterations and other administrative and field services provided by the division fees are collected in advance from owner or agent and shall include any fees which apply b determination of square footage for the purpose of determining the fee on the basis of square foot floor area measurements shall be taken from outside of building at each floor level including basement and attic space if floor is installed c determination of estimated cost fees for the purpose of determining the fee on the basis of estimated cost it shall represent the actual cost for alterations and repairs to existing buildings including all labor and material less the cost of real estate and installation of electrical heating and plumbing equipment and sewers as if done by competitive bids building permit fee schedule existing piping inside a building the fee shall be determined in accordance with the following procedures a sanitary building sewer drain and vent 1 total all of the drainage fixture units which are being added or relocated 2 refer to s sps 38230 table 382302 and determine the horizontal drain size which would be required if all new or relocated fixtures discharged pipe note disregard the asterisk limitation regarding water closets this pipe size is used for determining the fee only and does not necessarily mean this pipe size is used in actual design or installation 3 determine the and 2 and convert to gallons per minute gpm in accordance with s sps 38240 table 382403 2 the fees shall be determined in accordance with gpm demand of the new or relocated fixtures as specified in 12202011   3152011   1998  prior code  15150   monies owed city a applications deemed incomplete any application for a permit required by title 15 from a person firm or corporation having unpaid and overdue property taxes special assessments sanitary sewer hookup fees park fees impact fees building permit fees erosion control and stormwater management fees any fees andor charges owed pursuant to a predevelopment agreement development agreement or an outstanding judgment owed to the city of sun prairie shall be deemed incomplete and shall not be reviewed by staff this section does not apply to fees paid in installments pursuant to a development agreement if made within thirty 30 days of the issuance of an invoice by the city b hearing request upon receipt of such an application from a person firm or corporation having unpaid fees or accounts due to the city of sun prairie the person firm or corporation shall be notified the application will not be accepted and that they may request a hearing before the finance committee regarding the unpaid fees the request for a hearing must be made within thirty 30 days of the issuance of the notice c appeal the applicant has a right to appeal the decision of the finance committee to the city council within thirty 30 days of issuance of a denial of their appeal  2002 enforcement penalties and violations a any building or structure hereafter erected enlarged altered or repaired or any use hereafter established in violation of the provisions of this shall be deemed an unlawful building structure or use the building inspector shall promptly report all such violations to the common council and city attorney who shall bring an action to enjoin the erection enlargement alteration repair or moving of such building or structure of the establishment of such use or to cause such building structure or use to be removed and may also be subject to a penalty as provided in general penalty provisions the city of sun prairie code of ordinances in any such action the fact that a permit was issued shall not constitute a defense nor shall any error oversight or dereliction of duty on the part of the building inspector constitute a defense compliance with the provisions of this chapter may also be enforced by injunctional order at the suit of the owner or owners of any real estate within the jurisdiction of this chapter b 1 if an inspection reveals a noncompliance with this chapter or the uniform dwelling the building inspector shall notify the applicant and the owner in writing of the violation to be corrected all cited violations shall be corrected within thirty 30 days after written notification unless an extension of time is granted pursuant to 101c wis adm if after written notification the violation is not corrected within thirty 30 days a stopwork order may be served on the owner or his or her representative and a copy thereof shall be posted at the construction site such stopwork order shall not be removed except by written notice of the building inspector after satisfactory evidence has been supplied that the cited violation has been corrected 3 each day each violation continues after the thirty 30 day written notice period has run shall constitute a separate offense nothing in this chapter shall preclude the city from maintaining any appropriate action to prevent or remove a violation of any provision of this chapter or the uniform dwelling if any construction or work governed by the provisions of this chapter or the uniform dwelling commenced prior to the issuance of a permit double fees shall be charged c any person feeling aggrieved by an order or a determination of the building inspector may appeal from such order or determination to the board of appeals those procedures customarily used to effectuate an appeal to the board of appeals shall apply d except as may otherwise be provided by the statute or ordinance no officer agent or employee of the city charged with the enforcement of this chapter shall render himself or herself personally liable for any damage that may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of his or her duties under this chapter any suit brought against any officer agent or employee of the city as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of his or her duties under this chapter shall be defended by the legal representative of the city until the final determination of the proceedings therein  handicapped access to public buildings grievance procedures regarding access to public buildings by handicapped persons a statement of purpose the city is committed to providing adequate access by handicapped or visually impaired persons to public buildings financed in part by federal revenue sharing this section provides for a grievance procedure providing for prompt and equitable resolution of complaints alleging any action prohibited by the office of revenue sharings ors regulations 31 cfr 5155d2 implementing of the rehabilitation act of 197 as amended 29 usc 794 states in part that no otherwise qualified handicapped individualshall solely by reason of his handicap be excluded from the participation in be denied the benefits of or be subjected to discrimination under any program or activity receiving federal financial assistance b complaint procedure 1 complaints should be filed with the city administrator who has been designated to coordinate compliance 2 a complaint should be filed in writing or verbally contain the name and address of the person filing it and briefly describe the alleged violation of the regulations 3 a complaint should be filed within thirty 30 days after the complainant becomes aware of the alleged violation processing of allegations of discrimination occurring before this grievance procedure was in place will be considered on a casebycase basis 4 an investigation as may be appropriate shall follow a filing of a complaint the investigation will be conducted by an appropriate person designated by the city administrator who should review the handicapped requirements handbook published by the federal programs advisory service 5 a written determination as to the validity of the complaint and description of resolution if any shall be issued by the designated person and a copy forwarded to the complainant no later than thirty 30 days after its filing 6 the coordinator shall maintain the files and records of the city relating to the complaints filed c appeals 1 the complainant may appeal the decision of the coordinator where he or she is dissatisfied with the resolution the appeal request shall be made within seven days to the city administrator 2 the grievance shall be heard by the common council within ten 10 working days after the filing of an appeals request the grievance shall be heard at the municipal building at a convenient time fixed by the council the city clerk shall give at least three days written notice to the applicant by first class mail of any such grievance hearing 3 either party to the grievance may be represented present evidence by testimony or otherwise crossexamine witnesses and make argument either in person or by an agent of his or her choosing proceedings may and upon request of the applicant shall be recorded 4 the decision of the common council on the grievance appeal shall be in writing and shall state the reasons for the decision the decision of the council shall be rendered within three working days of the close of the hearing and the common council shall immediately upon rendering the decision mail a copy thereof by first class mail to the applicant at the current post office address given in his or her application and record a copy of its determination with the city clerk d other remedies the right of a person to a prompt and equitable resolution of the complaint filed hereunder shall not be impaired by the persons pursuit of other remedies such as the filing of a complaint with the office of revenue sharing us department of the treasury utilization of this grievance procedure is not a prerequisite to the pursuit of other remedies however the city believes that resolution of the complaint will be more promptly achieved if the city is able to provide a remedy before the complaint is brought to an external organization e due process this section shall be construed to protect the substantive rights of interested persons to meet appropriate due process standards and to assure that the city complies with the ors regulations  erosion control authority this chapter is adopted pursuant to the authority of and in accordance with the standards set forth in   and 28133 wisconsin statutes  part 2001  prior code  1541   findings and purpose a findings the common council finds as follows 1 stormwater runoff from construction sites and from lands after development carries a significant amount of sediment and other pollutants to the waters of the state and the city of sun prairie 2 the city has had in place an erosion control ordinance since at least  when it adopted  to regulate land disturbing and land developing activities on lands within the boundaries and jurisdiction of the city and the public and private lands subject to extraterritorial review under wisconsin statutes 3 recent developments in erosion control practices suggest a substantial need to incorporate current best practices into the citys erosion control ordinance 4 this ordinance is intended to achieve an eighty percent 80% reduction in sediment load rates to dane county waters in all new developments forty percent 40% reduction in all redevelopments and twenty percent 20% reduction in existing developments 5 this ordinance is intended to ensure no increase in temperature of stormwater runoff in order to protect cold water communities b purpose it is the purpose of this chapter to promote public health safety and general welfare and to protect natural resources  to further the maintenance of safe and healthful conditions  to prevent and control water pollution  to protect spawning grounds fish and aquatic life  to control building sites placement of structures and land uses  to preserve ground cover and scenic beauty  and to promote sound economic growth  2002   part 2001  prior code  1542   applicability this chapter applies to any land disturbing activity occurring on lands within the territorial limits and jurisdiction of the city and publiclyowned or privatelyowned lands within the extraterritorial land division review jurisdiction of the city pursuant to wisconsin statutes which lands involve any of the following a a subdivision of land or a land division by certified survey as those terms are defined in wisconsin statutes title 14 of the sun prairie ordinances  b an area of four thousand 4000 square feet or greater that will be disturbed by grading removal of protective ground cover or vegetation excavation land filling or other land disturbing activities or activities on a slope steeper than twelve percent 12%  c excavation filling or a combination of excavation and filling thereof exceeds four hundred 400 cubic yards or more of dirt sand or other excavation or fill material  d any public street highway road or bridge is to be constructed enlarged relocated or substantially reconstructed  e any public or private utility laying repairing replacing or enlarging an underground pipe or facility for a distance of three hundred 300 feet or more  f ingress or egress of property using areas which are not constructed as driveways or roadways when such activities will disturb existing vegetation site stabilization andor erosion control measures  g activities which may be unrelated to actual building construction such as but not limited to land disturbing activity prior to excavation for foundation work landscaping auxiliary buildings garages patios or decks installation of driveways parking areas and sidewalks extensive earth work on sites not directly related to structural concerns development of ponds and channelized water courses commercial parks and landing strips or airport runways h land disturbing that disturbs more than one hundred 100 lineal feet of road ditch grass waterway or other land area where surface drainage flows in a defined open channel  including the placement repair or removal of any underground pipe utility or other facility within the crosssection of the channel i any new public or private road or access drive longer than one hundred twentyfive 125 feet j land disturbing activity that disturbs less than four thousand 4000 square feet of land including the installation of access drives that the city determines to have a high risk of soil erosion or water pollution or that may significantly impact a lake stream or wetland area  6202006   2002   part 2001  prior code  1543   exemptions and clarifications the following activities are exempt from this chapter a any activity directly related to the planting growing and harvesting of agricultural crops b onefamily and twofamily dwelling units regulated under the wisconsin uniform dwelling disturbing activities in excess of one acre or not associated with the constriction of a dwelling are not exempt from this chapter c projects specifically exempted from this chapter under state and federal statute it is the responsibility of the landowner to demonstrate such exemption with documentation acceptable to the city engineer d projects subject to an approved shore land erosion control permit under wisconsin statutes e agricultural development not subject to f municipal or county highway projects not exempted under subsection c above are exempt from where all of the following conditions are met 1 the purpose of the project is only to meet current state or federal design or safety guidelines  2 all activity takes place within the existing rightofway  3 all other requirements of are met  and 4 the project does not include the addition of new driving lanes  6202006   definitions as used in this chapter administering authority means the city employee or departments agent or designee empowered to administer this chapter affected means that a regulated activity has significantly a caused negative impacts on water quality or the use or maintenance of land or business  or b endangered health safety or general welfare agricultural land use means use of land for planting growing cultivating and harvesting of crops for human or livestock consumption and pasturing or yarding of livestock applicant means any person who applies for a permit to undertake activities governed by this chapter average annual rainfall means measured precipitation in madison wisconsin between march 12 and  bank erosion means the removal of soil or rock fragments along the banks or bed of a stream channel resulting from high flow after rain events best management practices means a practice technique or measure that is an effective practical means of preventing or reducing soil erosion or water pollution or both from runoff both during and after land development activities these can include structural vegetative or operational practices board of appeals means the board of zoning appeals for the city business day means a day which the citys offices are routinely and customarily open for business  means of the sun prairie ordinances city means the incorporated city of sun prairie wisconsin and all lands within the boundaries thereof cold water community means surface waters capable of supporting a community of cold water fish and other aquatic life or serving as a spawning area for cold water fish species nr 102043a wisconsin administrative  commercial land use means use of land for the wholesale or retail sale of goods or services common plan of development or sale means all lands included within the boundary of a certified survey or subdivision plan created for the purpose of development or sale of property where multiple separate and distinct land developing activity may take place at different times and on different schedules connected imperviousness means an impervious surface that is directly connected to a separate storm sewer or water of the state via an impervious flow path construction period means the span of time from the initial groundbreaking until permanent vegetation is established control measure means practice or combination of practices to control erosion and attendant pollution control plan means the written description of the number locations sizes and other pertinent information of control measures designed to meet the requirements of this chapter submitted by the applicant for review and approval by the city design rainfall event means discrete rainstorm characterized by a specific duration rainfall intensity return frequency and total depth of rainfall effective infiltration area means the area of the infiltration system that is used to infiltrate runoff and does not include the area used for site access berms or pretreatment erosion means the detachment and movement of soil sediment or rock fragments by water wind ice or gravity existing development means buildings and other structures and impervious area existing prior to  gross aggregate area means the total area in acres of all land located within the property boundary containing the land development activity irrevocable letter of credit means an agreement with a bank or other institution to pay money or extend credit to honor the term of the permit with the city impervious surface means a surface that releases the rainfall as surface runoff during a large portion of the design rainfall event rooftops sidewalks gravel and pavement parking lots and street surfaces are examples of impervious surfaces industrial land use means exterior storage areas loading and unloading areas equipment washing areas or other area or surface directly associated with an industrial process or a land use activity covered under the wisconsin pollutant discharge elimination system infiltration for the purpose of this chapter refers to any precipitation that does not leave the site as surface runoff karst feature means an area or surficial geologic feature subject to bedrock dissolution so that it is likely to provide a conduit to groundwater and may include caves enlarged fractures mine features exposed bedrock surfaces sinkholes springs seeps or swallets land development activity means any activity which changes the volume or peak flow discharge rate of rainfall runoff from the land surface or means the construction of buildings  roads  pavement or gravel parking lots andor storage areas  and similar facilities excluding agricultural land use land disturbing construction activity means any manmade change of the land surface including removing vegetative cover excavating filling and grading but not including agricultural land uses landowner means any person holding title to or having an interest in land land user means any person operating leasing renting or having made other arrangements with the landowner by which the landowner authorizes use of his or her land major project means landdisturbing activities covering an area twenty thousand 20000 square feet or larger or an area four thousand 4000 square feet or larger with any slopes of twelve percent 12% or steeper or an area draining directly into any sensitive area not including construction or modification of a one or two family home or multifamily dwellings of four units or fewer manuals of practice means the wisconsin construction site best management practice handbook and wisconsin stormwater manual of practice published by the department of natural resources maximum extent practicable mep means a level of implementing best management practices in order to achieve a performance standard specified in this chapter which takes into account the best available technology cost effectiveness and other competing issues such as human safety and welfare endangered and threatened resources historic properties and geographic features mep allows flexibility in the way to meet standards and may vary based on the performance standard and site conditions minor project means landdisturbing activities covering an area less than twenty thousand 20000 square feet or an area less than four thousand 4000 square feet with any slopes of twelve percent 12% or steeper or for construction or modification of a one or two family home or multifamily dwellings of four units or fewer nonstructural measure means a practice technique or measure to reduce the volume peak flow rate or pollutants in stormwater that does not require the design or installation of fixed stormwater management facilities offsite means located outside the property boundary described in the permit application for land development activity onsite means located within the property boundary described in the permit application for the land development activity permit means written authorization made by the building inspection or engineering department to the applicant to conduct building construction land disturbing or land development activities permit administration fee means a sum of money paid to the building inspection or engineering department by the permit applicant for the purpose of recouping the cityrelated expenses incurred by the authority city in administering the permit person means any individual corporation partnership limited liability company association trust or other entity postdevelopment condition means the extent and distribution of land cover types anticipated to occur under conditions of full development that will influence rainfall runoff and infiltration principal responsible party means an individual person assigned by property owner to be responsible for installing and maintaining erosion control measures runoff means the rainfall snowmelt or irrigation water flowing over the ground surface sensitive area means lakes ponds perennially flowing and intermittent streams or wetlands environmental corridors mapped by the city and any lands within the token creek watershed site means the entire area included in the legal description of the land on which the land disturbing or land development activity is proposed in the permit application soil classification means classification of soils as designated by the soil survey of dane county wisconsin by the united states department of agriculture soil conservation service soil loss rate means the rate measured in tons per acre per year at which soil movement occurs as a result of sheet and rill erosion and does not apply to ditches or areas of concentrated flows the soil loss rate is calculated using the universal soil loss equation stop work order means an order issued by the engineering or building inspection departments which requires that all construction activity on the site be stopped stormwater drainage system means and includes channels swales pipes culverts street gutters ditches detention basins retention basins infiltration devices and any facilities for conveying storing or managing runoff from a site wpdes stormwater permit means the permit issued by the wisconsin department of natural resources in accordance with state of wisconsin administrative comm  and any other applicable agency regulations as such regulations may hereafter be amended  6202006   2002   part 2001  prior code  1544   design standards and specifications for erosion control measures a the applicant for a permit may employ structural or nonstructural measures necessary to achieve all applicable standards set out in this chapter however these measures will be evaluated to determine that they follow currently accepted design criteria and engineering standards b the following general principles shall be used when evaluating control plans and granting permits under this chapter 1 activities on the site shall be conducted in a logical sequence to cause the smallest area of land shall be exposed for the shortest period at any given time during development 2 the rough grading of the lot shall include backfilling the foundation and walls and all excess earth shall be hauled off the lot unless stockpiled and covered to prevent erosion by wind or water 3 accommodation of any increased runoff caused by changed soil and surface conditions during and after development 4 runoff from all areas upslope of the site shall be diverted around disturbed areas diverted runoff shall be conveyed in a manner that will not erode the receiving channels 5 all roof drainage shall discharge to vegetated mulched or other stable pervious surface 6 all temporary roadways and parking areas shall be constructed with minimal cuts and on relatively flat grades all disturbed side slopes shall be stabilized with mulching and seeding or equivalent control measures within seven days of construction of the cuts 7 permanent final plantings or structures shall be installed prior to final acceptance of public improvements or issuance of occupancy permits 8 the plan of development shall relate to the topography and soils of the site so that the lowest potential for erosion is created 9 natural plant covering shall be retained and protected and shall be deemed a dominating factor in developing the site and temporary vegetation mulching or other cover shall be used to protect the area exposed during the landdisturbing activity 10 all detention and retention basins that serve multiple phases or a single drainage area shall first be constructed to act as a settling basin with conversion to the permanent basin upon completion of the development 11 any soil or dirt piles which will be in existence for more than ten 10 days may not be located within twentyfive 25 feet of a roadway or drainage channel and shall be stabilized by mulching vegetative cover tarps or other means 12 the developer for all plats or phases thereof shall submit for approval a postimprovement erosion control plan that details structural measures and responsibility for erosion control after the initial improvements have been made the postimprovement erosion control plan shall propose erosion control measures to protect all improvements and include a revegetation schedule for denuded areas that takes into account the time of year this plan may accompany the initial plan or be submitted separately but must be approved prior to the citys acceptance of the plat improvements 13 april 30th th prior to acceptance of site improvements or issuance of occupancy permits the developers representative shall visit the site with the citys representative to review the final site stabilization measures the citys representative must approve the final site stabilization measures prior to acceptance of public utilities or issuance of occupancy permits 14 winter construction as soon as weather conditions permit the completion of final site stabilization measures but prior to acceptance of site improvements or issuance of occupancy permits the developers representative shall visit the site with the citys representative to review the final site stabilization measures the citys representative must approve the final site stabilization measures prior to acceptance of public utilities or issuance of occupancy permits c the following erosion control measures shall be required on sites with public improvements 1 the landowner or hisher representative is required to make erosion control inspections at the end of each week and within twentyfour 24 hours after a precipitation event of 05 inches or greater inspection reports shall be prepared and filed as required and submitted to the citys representative within four business days of the required inspection this shall not relieve the landowner or hisher representative of any responsibilities under nr 216 or comm  wisconsin administrative any other applicable agency regulations as such regulations may hereafter be amended 2 disturbed areas more than twenty 20 feet behind the curb and gutter shall be restored when rough grading is completed if the area will not be seeded and mulched within fortyeight 48 hours of rough grading silt fence or erosion mat shall be installed parallel to the street twenty 20 feet the curb and gutter until final landscaping is completed 3 install minimum six foot to seven foot wide erosion mat along the back of curb after topsoil has been placed in the terrace if this area will not be seeded and mulched within fortyeight 48 hours of placing topsoil 4 silt fence or erosion mat shall be installed along the contours at one hundred 100 foot intervals down the slope on disturbed slopes steeper than five percent and more than one hundred 100 long that sheet flow to the roadway 5 place heavy mulch twenty 20 feet wide to prevent sediment from leaving the lots mulch shall be at least twenty 20 mm thick in accordance with latest edition of the state of wisconsin standard specifications for highway and structure construction seed and double mulch all terraces 6 clean sediment from curb and gutter on a daily basis more often if needed after a rain event and prior to the project acceptance 7 place temporary seed if disturbed areas will not be restored immediately after rough grading temporary seed shall be placed in accordance with of the wisconsin standard specifications for highway and structure construction 8 catchall inlet protection devices or equal as determined by the city engineer shall be installed in all storm sewer catch basins and maintained until the final surface layer of asphalt has been placed in new developments the devices shall also be placed and maintained in additional locations such as catch basins down gradient of the development as determined by the city engineer d erosion control measures shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the wisconsin construction site best management practice handbook and the city standard specifications for public works improvements e riprap design for culvert pond and storm sewer outfalls shall be in accordance with the state of wisconsin department of transportation facilities development manual drainage erosion and water pollution control construction shall be in accordance with the wisconsin department of transportation standard specifications for highway and structure construction latest edition f site dewatering water pumped from the site shall be free of visible sediments and shall be discharged to drainage facilities so as not to cause erosion at the discharge point or in the receiving drainage facility g waste and material disposal all waste and unused building materials shall be disposed of frequently and in licensed solid waste or wastewater facilities no garbage debris cleaning wastes toxic materials or hazardous materials shall be buried on site dumped on the land surface or in detention basins or discharged or otherwise allowed to be carried by runoff into a receiving channel or storm sewer system h tracking each site shall provide the following to prevent sediment from being tracked onto public or private roadways 1 each site shall have graveled access drives and parking areas of sufficient width length and wearing surface 2 all unpaved roads serving more than five vehicles per day shall be graveled 3 vehicle and equipment wash water shall be discharged to an infiltration area detention basin or equivalent control measure 4 any sediment reaching a public or private road shall be removed by sweeping before the end of each work day i drain inlet protection all storm drain inlets on the site shall be protected by a stone weeper placed tightly around the inlet or sand bags piled around the inlet a minimum of one foot above the inlet j minimum slope stabilization requirements stabilization practices beyond the standard seeding and mulching are often needed to control erosion on exposed slopes as the length and steepness of the slope increases so do the forces of soil erosion and the level of protection needed use the chart below to determine the stabilization requirements for any given slope where runoff is in sheet flow minimum slope stabilization requirements slope stabilization requirements notes slope lengths shown above refer to the area of exposed soil and assumes no runoff from upslope area if upslope runoff exists use the next more stringent stabilization measure in the chart or temporarily divert the runoff around exposed areas polyacrilamides from the wisdnr and wisdot product acceptability list and disced mulch are considered equal methods to hold mulch in place  6202006   part 2001  prior code  1545   maintenance of control measures all control measures necessary to meet the requirements of this chapter shall be maintained a by the applicant or subsequent landowner during both the period of land disturbance and land development of the site and the subsequent occupation of the site  b at the frequency and in the manner described in the manuals of practice  part 2001  prior code  1546   landdisturbing activities subject to construction site erosion control a general requirement any landowner or land user who undertakes commences or performs landdisturbing activities  or who permits another person to do the same on land is subject to this section b landdisturbing activities subject to erosion and sediment control 1 those requiring a subdivision plat approval or the construction of housing or commercial industrial or institutional buildings on lots of approved subdivision plats  2 those requiring a certified survey approval or the construction of housing or commercial industrial or institutional buildings on lots of approved certified surveys  3 those involving grading removal of protective ground cover or vegetation excavation land filling or other land disturbing activity affecting a surface area of four thousand 4000 square feet or more or activities on a slope steeper than twelve percent 12%  4 those involving excavation or filling or a combination of excavation and filling affecting four hundred 400 cubic yards or more of dirt sand or other excavation andor fill material  5 those involving public street highway road or bridge building parking lot driveway or walkway construction enlargement relocation or reconstruction or substantial reconstruction  6 ingress or egress of property using areas which are not constructed as driveways or roadways when such activities will disturb existing vegetation site stabilization andor erosion control measures  7 activities such as but not limited to landdisturbing activity prior to excavation for foundation work landscaping auxiliary buildings garages patios or decks pools installation of driveways parking areas and sidewalks extensive earth work on sites not directly related to structural concerns developments of ponds and channelized water courses commercial parks and landing strips or airport runways  8 the area is adjacent to or draining directly to a sensitive area 9 land disturbing activity that disturbs more than one hundred 100 lineal feet of road ditch grass waterway or other land area where surface drainage flows in a defined open channel  including the placement repair or removal of any underground pipe utility or other facility within the crosssection of the channel 10 any new public or private road or access drive longer than one hundred twentyfive 125 feet 11 land disturbing activity that disturbs less than four thousand 4000 square feet of land including the installation of access drives that the city determines to have a high risk of soil erosion or water pollution or that may significantly impact a lake stream or wetland area c permitting or causing erosion prohibited in addition to the permit requirements set forth in this chapter no person shall cause or permit erosion or the tracking or dropping of dirt or sediment deposits upon adjacent lands public streets or bodies of water from any land whether or not otherwise subject to this chapter  2002   part 2001  prior code  1547   performance standards for erosion control measures a allowable soil loss standard plans will not be approved nor permits issued unless the proposed design suggested location and phased implementation of effective practicable erosion control measures shall prevent gully and bank erosion and 1 permissible soil loss limit total offsite annual aggregate soil loss resulting from sheet and rill erosion of exposed areas to an annual cumulative rate not to exceed seven and onehalf tons per acre per year 2 erosion control measures for plan approval need not attempt to regulate soil transportation within the boundaries of the applicants site 3 discharges from new construction sites must have a stable outlet capable of carrying designed flow as required in at a nonerosive velocity outlet design must consider flow capacity and flow duration this requirement applies to both the site outlet and the ultimate outlet to stormwater conveyance or water body b calculation method plan compliance under subsection a of this section shall be determined using the soil conservation service universal soil loss equation usle which includes the following considerations season of year site characteristics soil erodibility and slope computer version of usle for dane county excel or quatropro versions and sample hand calculations are available from dane county land conservation wwwcodanewius another commonly accepted soil erosion technology approved by the city engineer and the dane county conservationist that considers season of year site characteristics soil erodibility and slope may be considered for use c sites required to provide calculations plan compliance shall include the determination of soil loss rates as calculated by accepted soil erosion control methodology for 1 sites twenty thousand 20000 square feet or larger excluding onefamily and twofamily homes and multifamily dwellings of four units or fewer  2 sites four thousand 4000 square feet or larger with any slopes twelve percent 12% or steeper  and 3 all major project sites adjacent to or draining directly into any sensitive area not including construction or modification of a onefamily or twofamily home or multifamily dwelling of four units or fewer d internally drained site for internally drained sites erosion control measures for plan approval need not attempt to regulate soil transportation within the limits of the disturbed area  6202006   2002   part 2001  prior code  1548   permit application control plan and permit issuance a general unless specifically excluded by this chapter no owner occupant or user may undertake an activity subject to this chapter without receiving a permit each owner occupant or user desiring to undertake a regulated activity subject to this chapter shall submit an application for a permit together with the appropriate fee in addition 1 the submittal must be signed by the landowner or included a notarize statement signed by the landowner authorizing the applicant to act as the landowners agent and bind the landowner to the terms of this ordinance 2 if a landowner appoints an agent to submit an application the landowner shall be bound by all the requirements of this ordinance and the terms of any permit issued to the agent 3 submittal for a permit under this ordinance shall constitute permission by the applicant and landowner for the inspecting officer of the city to enter upon the property and inspect the property prior to construction inspect the project under construction and inspect the project upon completion of the project to confirm compliance with the requirements of the approved plan b control plan required 1 unless specifically exempted by this chapter applicants for plats or other developments with public improvements shall submit four copies of a control plan to control erosion and sedimentation which would result from the proposed activity the materials shall be submitted to the city official designated to review such plans under this chapter 2 for landdisturbing activities covering an area twenty thousand 20000 square feet or larger or an area four thousand 4000 square feet or larger with any slopes of twelve percent 12% or steeper or an area draining directly into any sensitive area applicants shall submit the following along with the permit application a the control plan including the information described below  b soil loss rate calculations for the construction period per the usle 3 sites not requiring a control plan and calculations under subsection b2 of this section and onefamily and twofamily dwellings or multifamily dwellings of four units or fewer shall submit one copy of the erosion control checklist and plan with the application c content of the control plan the site plan for all landdisturbing activities covering an area twenty thousand 20000 square feet or larger or an area four thousand 4000 square feet or larger with any slopes of twelve percent 12% or steeper shall contain the following control plan information 1 existing site map a map of existing site conditions on a scale of at least one inch equals fifty 50 feet but no more than one inch equals twenty 20 feet including a site boundaries property line lot dimensions and adjacent lands which accurately identity site location  b existing site topography at a contour interval not to exceed two feet and extending onto adjacent contiguous properties a minimum of fifty 50 feet or as necessary to show land features and existing drainage patterns  c all natural and artificial water features including but not limited to lakes streams including intermittent streams wetlands as defined by the wisconsin department of natural resources andor the army corps of engineers environmental corridors as shown on the environmental corridor map for the city prepared by the dane county regional planning commission natural and historic resource protection overlay zoning districts as shown on the city zoning map channels ditches and other watercourses on the site and those off the site that may be affected by the land disturbing or land development activity  and areas of natural woodland or prairie d one hundredyear floodplains flood fringes and floodways and delineated wetland boundaries a certified flood zone determination andor wetland delineation may be required at the applicants expense e existing drainage patterns  f location map and type of predominant soils as determined in the soil survey of dane county wisconsin by the united states department of agriculture soil conservation service and soil boring or test pit information if available  g existing vegetative cover  h location and dimensions of existing stormwater drainage systems upstream and downstream to the point of ultimate disposal  i locations and dimensions of existing utilities structures roads highways and paving 2 plan of final site conditions a plan of final site conditions on the same scale as the existing site map including a site boundaries property lines lot dimensions and adjacent lands which accurately identify site location  b existing and proposed site topography at a contour interval not to exceed two feet and extending onto adjacent contiguous properties a minimum of fifty 50 feet or as necessary to show land features and existing drainage patterns  c all natural and artificial water features including but not limited to lakes streams including intermittent streams wetlands as defined by the wisconsin department of natural resources andor the army corps of engineers environmental corridors as shown on the environmental corridor map for the city prepared by the dane county regional planning commission natural and historic resource protection overlay zoning districts as shown on the city zoning map channels ditches and other watercourses on the site and those off the site that may be affected by the land disturbing or land development activity  and areas of natural woodland or prairie d one hundredyear floodplains flood fringes and floodways and delineated wetland boundaries a certified flood zone determination andor wetland delineation may be required at the applicants expense e proposed drainage patterns including watershed size for each drainage area design discharges for ditches and structural measures and runoff velocities f cross sections of and profiles of channels swales and road ditches g culvert sizes h limits of impervious surfaces in square feet including buildings include all public and private roads interior roads driveways parking lots and indicate type of paving and surfacing material i makeup of surface soil upper six inches on areas not covered by buildings structures or pavement  j kind of cover on areas not covered by buildings structures or pavement  k seeding mixtures and rates lime and fertilizer application rates and kind and quantity of mulching for both temporary and permanent vegetative control measures  l locations and dimensions of proposed and remaining portions of existing stormwater drainage systems and stormwater management control measures  m locations and dimensions of proposed and remaining utilities structures roads highways and paving  n calculations of soil loss as calculated using the usle  o prior to acceptance of public improvements or issuance of an occupancy permit a walkthe site shall be conducted to review the final erosion control measures and stabilization measures for the site measures shall be in place at the time of the walk the walkbe attended by a representative of the city engineering or building department and the ownerdeveloper 3 site construction plan a site construction plan including a property lines lot dimensions and limits of disturbed area  b locations and dimensions of all soil stockpiles  c locations and dimensions of all construction site erosion control measures show phasing of measures where applicable necessary to meet the requirements of this chapter  d schedule of anticipated starting and completion date of each landdisturbing or land developing activity including the installation of construction site erosion control measures needed to meet the requirements of this chapter  and e provisions for maintenance of the construction site erosion control measures during construction 4 erosion control methods a description of the methods to be employed to prevent erosion and sedimentation including the following a a detailed land disturbance schedule including time schedules for stabilization of ditches and slopes  b provision for sequential steps mitigating erosive effect of land disturbing activities to be followed in appropriate order and in a manner consistent with accepted erosion control methodology suitable to proposed sites and amenable to prompt revegetation including runoff calculations as appropriate  c provisions to prevent mudtracking offsite onto public thoroughfares during the construction period  d provisions to disconnect impervious surfaces where feasible  e provisions to prevent sediment delivery to and accumulation in any proposed or existing stormwater conveyance systems  f existing or proposed elevations referenced to the national geodetic vertical datum of 1929 and existing and proposed contours in the area where deemed necessary  g any other information necessary to reasonably determine the location nature and condition of any physical or environmental features of the site 5 copies of permits or permit applications or approvals required by any government entity d content of the erosion control checklist plan the erosion control checklist plan the checklist plan shall serve as the control plan for lots of less than twenty thousand 20000 square feet and onefamily and twofamily dwellings or multifamily dwellings of four or fewer units on lots of less than twenty thousand 20000 square feet and onefamily and twofamily dwellings the applicant shall agree to undertake all control measures required by the checklist plan which are as follows 1 stripping of vegetation grading excavation or other landdisturbing activities shall be done in a manner which will minimize soil erosion if possible construction should be scheduled for times of year when erosion hazards are minimal 2 only those areas approved for the placement of physical improvements may be cleared of topsoil trees and other natural features existing stable vegetation shall be retained and protected on all other areas until the final ground cover is placed 3 only the site referenced on the checklist form shall be included in the construction site activities ingress egress and storage of materials shall take place on this site only use of adjacent properties shall constitute a violation of this chapter if a control plan including those properties has not been approved 4 temporary stabilization and control measures seeding mulching tarping erosion matting etc are required for protection of exposed areas which will remain unworked for a period in excess of two weeks during construction or other landdisturbing activities 5 proposed drainage facilities shall be designed to accommodate increased runoff resulting from developments or disturbances to the soil and surface conditions during and after development or disturbance without causing erosion of the drainage facility runoff shall be conveyed to the nearest public drainage facility 6 water runoff shall be managed in a manner that meets the minimum requirements of the citys stormwater management sediment shall be retained onsite vehicles shall riot track or direct debris onto adjacent roadways and sediment shall not be carried off the site by surface runoff 8 any temporary or permanent diversions sediment basins or other such erosion and runoff control measures as required shall be installed prior to any onsite grading or land disturbances except in the areas subject to land disturbance 9 surplus excavation materials shall be removed from the site immediately after rough grading the disposal site for the surplus excavation is also subject to the requirements of this chapter if within the city limits e review of applications the city shall not begin to review any application submitted under this chapter until receipt of the application the control plan if required the soil loss calculations if required and the application fee if required 1 minor projects within seven days of receiving the required information and fee the building inspector or its designee shall review the information and notify the applicant whether the application is approved disapproved approved with modifications or whether additional information is required 2 major projects less than two acres within twenty 20 days of receiving the required information and fee the city engineer or its designee shall review the information and notify the applicant in writing whether the application is approved disapproved approved with modifications or whether additional information is required 3 other major projects greater than two acres within fortyfive 45 days of receiving the required information and fee the city engineer or its designee shall review the information and notify the applicant in writing whether the application is approved disapproved approved with modifications or whether additional information is required 4 additional information requests for all applications the reviewing city official may if deemed appropriate request comments from other city departments and other governmental agencies 5 approval disapproval or supplemental information requests if the requirements of this chapter have been met the reviewing official shall approve the application inform the applicant and issue a permit if the conditions are not met the reviewing official shall inform the applicant in writing and may either disapprove the permit application or either require needed information to address issues raised by the application if the applicant promptly submits such information the reviewing official shall within ten 10 days for minor projects and within thirty 30 days for major projects of the receipt of such information determine whether the application and supporting materials now meet the requirements of this chapter if the application is disapproved the reviewing official shall inform the applicant in writing of the reasons for the disapproval 6 permit conditions a duration permits shall be valid a period of one hundred eighty 180 days from the date of issuance unless otherwise noted the reviewing official may extend the duration beyond one hundred eighty 180 days on larger projects where the completion is expected to extend beyond this period the reviewing official may grant an extension on approvals upon written request extensions may require additional control measures as a condition of approval if necessary to meet the requirements of this chapter b security as a condition of approval and issuance of the permit the city may require the applicant to deposit a surety bond or irrevocable letter of credit escrow funds or post other security acceptable to the city to guarantee good faith execution of the approved control plan and any permit conditions without limiting the foregoing and subject to applicable law the city may require such security if the applicant undertakes winter construction to ensure that any necessary cleanup or landscaping measures shall be implemented promptly upon the conclusion of the freezing weather that prevents immediate implementation c other permit conditions all permits shall require the permittee to i notify the city official who reviewed and issued the permit five work days prior to commencing any land disturbing activity  ii notify such reviewing official of the completion of any control measures within ten 10 days of completion of their installation  iii obtain written permission from the city prior to modifying the control plan  iv maintain all road drainage systems stormwater drainage systems control measures and other facilities identified in the control plan  v repair any damage to adjoining surfaces and drainage ways resulting from land developing or disturbing activities  vi inspect the construction control measures after each rain of onehalf inch or more and at least once each week and make needed repairs inspection reports shall be submitted to the city representative within four business days of the inspection  vii pay any proportional share of the cost of offsite drainageway stream channel or other modifications necessitated by the land development or land disturbing activity  viii allow the inspecting official as defined below to enter the site for the purpose of inspecting compliance with the control plan or for performing any work necessary to bring the site into compliance with the control plan  ix a copy of the approved permit and erosion control plan shall be kept on the project site in a place readily accessible to contractors engineers local approval authority inspection staff and other authorized personnel x make all reasonable corrections or repairs to control measures ordered by the inspecting official so as to meet the requirements of this chapter d release of security the city shall release the surety bond or return the irrevocable letter of credit after verifying the completion of the control plan requirements and satisfaction of the permit conditions e permit transfers shall be required to follow the following procedures i whenever a permittee andor landowner act to transfer an interest in property subject to an approved plan prior to completion of the proposed steps to attain soil stabilization the permittee must secure approval from the city engineer ii when a permittee andor landowner transfers ownership possession or control of real estate subject to an uncompleted erosion control plan the successor in interest to any portion of the real estate shall be responsible to control soil erosion and runoff and shall comply with the minimum standards provided in this ordinance iii when ownership possession or control of property subject to an uncompleted erosion control plan is transferred the former owner seller shall notify the new owner buyer as to the current status of compliance with notice to the authority and provide the new owner buyer with a copy of the erosion control plan iv transfers of interest in real estate subject to an approved uncompleted plan may be conducted consistent with this ordinance under any of the following arrangements  a the transferee shall file a new approved erosion control plan with the city engineer b the transferee shall obtain an approved assignment from the city engineer as subpermittee to complete that portion of the approved plan regulating soil erosion and runoff on the transferees property v if deemed necessary by the city engineer the permittee shall provide the city with a duly completed and executed continuing approved means of surety in an amount sufficient to complete the work in the approved plan f plan or permit amendments any proposed modifications to the approved plans construction schedules or alterations to accepted sequencing of land disturbing site activities shall be approved by the city engineer in consultation with the citys plan review agency prior to implementation of said changes  8182009   7 6202006   2002   part 2001  prior code  1549   inspection a the city engineer andor the city building inspector or hisher authorized designees the inspecting official shall inspect construction sites periodically to ensure compliance with the approved control plan as follows 1 for major projects such inspection shall be performed by the city engineer or the authorized designee  and 2 for minor projects such inspections shall be performed by the city building inspector or the authorized designee b to conduct such inspections to determine if any activities subject to this chapter are being carried out without a permit or contrary to the terms of a previously approved control plan the inspecting official shall have the authority to enter the land pursuant to the provisions of wisconsin statutes  part 2001  prior code  15410   enforcement the inspecting official shall cause the enforcement of this chapter a the inspecting official may post a stopwork order if 1 any activity subject to this chapter is being undertaken without a permit  or 2 the control plan is not being implemented in a good faith manner  or 3 any permit holder fails to comply with any applicable erosion control requirement set forth in any applicable permit or regulations of the dnr or the wisconsin department of commerce relating to the site  or 4 if the conditions of the permit are not being met b if the permittee does not cease the activity or comply with the control plan or permit conditions within twentyfour 24 hours the inspecting official may revoke the permit if the permit is revoked all construction and building activity on the property shall terminate immediately c if the landowner or land user where no permit has been issued or where a permit has been revoked does not cease the activity within twentyfour 24 hours the public works committee andor inspecting official may request the city attorney to obtain a stop work order d the inspecting official the plan commission or the board of appeals acting upon a properlypresented appeal may retract the stopwork order or the permit revocation e seventytwo 72 hours after posting a stopwork order the inspecting official may issue to the permittee or landowner or land user a notice of the citys intent to perform work necessary to comply with this chapter authorized agents of the city may go on the land and commence the work beginning at any time after twentyfour 24 hours after issuing the notice of intent the cost of the work performed by the city plus interest at a rate equal to five percent over the citys borrowing rate then in effect shall be billed to the permittee or the landowner in the event a permittee or landowner fails to pay the amount due the city clerk shall enter the amount due on the tax rolls and the city shall proceed to collect the unpaid amounts as a special tax against the land f any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be subject upon conviction to a civil forfeiture as provided below and shall be liable to pay the costs of prosecution for each violation each day a violation exists shall constitute a separate offense 1 minor projects a first offense a forfeiture of not less than one hundred dollars $10000 nor more than two hundred fifty dollars $25000 together with the costs of prosecution and any costs incurred by the city in connection with the claims of third parties  b second offense a forfeiture of not less than two hundred fifty dollars $25000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 together with the costs of prosecution and any costs incurred by the city in connection with the claims of third parties  c subsequent offenses a forfeiture of not less than five hundred dollars $50000 nor more than one thousand dollars $100000 together with the costs of prosecution and any costs incurred by the city in connection with the claims of third parties 2 major projects a first offense a forfeiture of not less than two hundred dollars $20000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 together with the costs of prosecution and any costs incurred by the city in connection with the claims of third parties  b second offense a forfeiture of not less than five hundred dollars $50000 nor more than one thousand dollars $100000 together with the costs of prosecution and any costs incurred by the city in connection with the claims of third parties  c subsequent offenses a forfeiture of not less than one thousand dollars $100000 nor more than one thousand seven hundred fifty dollars $175000 together with the costs of prosecution and any costs incurred by the city in connection with the claims of third parties 3 other violations under this schedule of forfeitures as for minor projects g the city may also obtain an injunction to enforce the provisions of this chapter  2002   part 2001  prior code  15411   appealsvariances a public works committee the public works committee created under the city  shall hear and decide appeals where it is alleged that there is error in any order decision or determination made by the inspecting official or public works committee in administering this chapter  2 upon appeal may authorize variances form the provisions of this chapter which are not contrary to the public interest and where owning to special conditions a literal enforcement of the provisions of this chapter will result in unnecessary hardship  and 3 shall use the rules procedures duties and powers authorized by statute in hearing and deciding appeals and authorizing variances b who may appeal any applicant permittee landowner land user may appeal any order decision or determination made by the plan commission or inspecting official in administering this chapter  2002   part 2001  prior code  15412   fees for permit administration fee for permit applications and erosion control plans applicants for permit erosion control plans or other approvals under this chapter shall pay the permit application fees based on the citys current fee schedule when a plan or application is filed the common council shall have authority and discretion to make adjustments to the fees a schedule of the permit administration fees is available from the city engineering department the permit application fee also includes the cost for city staffs review of the stormwater management plan submittal as well as all inspection of construction activities some projects will require both the submittal of an erosion control plan and a stormwater management plan when considering a project subject only to the requirements of this ordinance erosion control permit administration fee shall be determined by the criteria listed in   12192017    2002   part 2001  prior code  15413 15414 stormwater management title and authority the chapter shall be known as the stormwater management  and is adopted pursuant to 5 wisconsin statutes  2002   findings and purpose a findings the common council finds as follows 1 uncontrolled stormwater runoff from land development has significant adverse impacts on water resources and the health safety property and general welfare of the community and can diminish the public enjoyment and use of natural resources specifically stormwater runoff can a carry sediment nutrients pathogens organic matter heavy metals toxins and other pollutants to regional lakes streams and wetlands  b diminish the capacity of water resources to support recreational and water supply uses and a natural diversity of plant and animal life  c clog existing drainage systems increasing maintenance problems and costs  d cause bank and channel erosion  e increase downstream flooding  f reduce groundwater recharge which may diminish stream base flows and lower water levels in regional lakes ponds and wetlands  g contaminate drinking water supplies  h increase risk of property damage and personal injury and  i cause damage to agricultural fields and crops 2 that effective sediment and stormwater management depends on proper planning design and timely installation of conservation and management practices and their continuing maintenance 3 recent developments in stormwater management practices suggest a need to incorporate current practices into the citys stormwater management ordinance b purpose 1 it is the purpose of this chapter to set forth the minimum requirements for stormwater management that when incorporated will diminish threats to public health safety public and private property and natural resources of the city of sun prairie 2 this chapter is intended to regulate stormwater runoff with the intentions of accomplishing the following objectives a promote regional stormwater management by watershed  b minimize sedimentation water pollution from nutrients heavy metals chemical and petroleum products and other contaminants flooding and thermal impacts to the water resources of the city of sun prairie  c promote infiltration and groundwater recharge  d protect functional values of natural
