such work by the city engineer prior to commencing construction c improvement guarantee the subdivider shall include in such detailed development agreement an instrument of public improvement guarantee by personal guarantee thereby guaranteeing maintenance repair replacement by the developer of such public improvements which deteriorate or fail to meet performance or operating standards within one year of completing or acceptance by the city whichever is later or as otherwise provided in the detailed development agreement and payment of any penalties which may be incurred as a result thereof equal to fifteen 15 percent of the city engineers estimate of the cost of the public improvements if within one year after the date of final acceptance of any public improvement by the city council or such longer period of time as may be prescribed by laws or regulations or by the terms of any special guarantee required by the terms of such detailed development agreement as may be necessary due to the phasing of the construction of public improvements any work on any public improvement is found to be defective the subdivider shall remove it and replace it with nondefective work in accordance with written instructions given by the city engineer if the subdivider does not promptly comply with the terms of such instructions or in an emergency where delay would cause serious risk of loss or damage the city may cause the removal and replacement of such defective work and charge all direct indirect and consequential costs of such removal and replacement to the subdivider d the subdivider is responsible for requesting in writing for acceptance of the improvements and to start the oneyear guarantee period when the improvements are completed all improvements with the exception of the binder course of asphalt shall be guaranteed for one year the binder course of asphalt shall be guaranteed until the surface course of asphalt is placed at which point in time the oneyear guarantee will begin for the surface course of asphalt the subdivider is responsible for requesting in writing for a oneyear guarantee inspection to relieve the subdivider of maintenance of any improvements deemed defective after one year and to release the instrument of surety e designated projects manager the subdivider shall designate a project manager who shall be readily available on the project site during the construction of the required public improvements the project manager shall be granted authority on behalf of the subdivider to make decisions related to the construction of the required public improvements as they may arise during the course of the construction the project manager shall also be responsible for the scheduling and coordination of the required work to construct the required improvements correspondence with or verbal orders to the designated project manager shall have the same authority as with the subdivider directly  4192016   1102014   reserved for future use   extrasized and offsite facilities in order to serve future developments the city may require proposed developments to provide utilities that are oversized and installed to depths beyond that required to serve the proposed development the city will require developments to install water mains up to twelve 12 inches in diameter without additional cost to the utility owner sanitary sewers shall be installed to diameters up to twelve 12 inches and to depths of sixteen 16 feet as measured from the finished grade to the pipe invert without additional cost to the utility owner a the city shall pay the developer for the cost of additional depth when the request for additional depth results in the following additional costs to the developer 1 when the sanitary sewer depth to serve the development plus five feet exceeds sixteen 16 feet in depth as measured to the invert 2 when the developer can demonstrate that the additional depth will encounter rock or water conditions that would not have been encountered at the depth required to serve the development 3 storm sewers storm channels retention and detention facilities will be addressed on a casebycase basis as a general rule the developer will be allowed to recover costs for extraoversize 4 the city may also require and may pay for extra oversize except streets overdepth and offsite improvements to accommodate future development b the developer will not be compensated for additional depth under the following conditions 1 sanitary sewers extended to the perimeter of the proposed land division at minimum grade and when the depth is equal to or less than sixteen 16 feet in total depth as measured to the invert sewers may not be laid at greater than minimum grade unless approved by the city engineer 2 if the depth required in order to provide service to the development exceeds sixteen 16 feet 3 storm sewers extended to the perimeter of the proposed land division at minimum grade and when the depth is equal to or less than ten 10 feet as measured to the invert c the developer at no additional cost to the city or upstream development shall install sanitary sewers up to and including twelve 12 inches in diameter d the developer at no additional cost to the water and light commission or upstream development shall install water main up to and including twelve 12 inches in diameter e when any public improvements of adequate capacity are not available at the boundary of proposed land division the city or its duly authorized representative shall require as a prerequisite to approval of a final plat or certified survey assurances that such improvement extensions shall be provided as follows in accordance with the following sections 1 design capacity all improvements within or entering or leaving the proposed development shall be installed to satisfy the service requirements for the entire service or drainage area in which the development is located and the improvements shall be of sufficient capacity to handle the expected development of the overall service area involved 2 lift stations where sanitary or storm sewer lift stations and force mains are required to lift sewerage to the gravity system the subdivider shall have plans profiles specifications and estimated operation and maintenance costs prepared for the installation of such facilities to the city engineers requirements equipment similar to existing city equipment shall be utilized whenever possible the installation inspection supervision and engineering fees for lift stations andor force mains shall be paid for by the subdivider unless otherwise determined and agreed upon by the city council gravity sanitary sewer service shall be employed whenever determined by the city engineer to be feasibly accessible   site grading a the subdivider shall be required to grade the full land division in accordance with the requirements of prior to receiving acceptance of the public improvements the subdivider shall submit for approval a master grading map for the limits of the land division phase of development this map shall show the design spot elevations at all lot corners break points and low points both an electronic copy and hard copy of this map shall be submitted in a format acceptable to the engineering department b grading of the site may commence after a developers agreement has been approved and signed by all pertinent parties if the subdivider wishes to commence with land disturbance activities prior to the finalization of the developers agreement the subdivider must receive an approved erosion control permit and all required regulatory permits surety in an amount acceptable to the city engineer shall be submitted along with an insurance certificate acceptable to the citys finance department prior to the commencement of any land disturbance activities grading shall not be allowed on the land development until the land division development agreement is approved or until the subdivider receives an erosion control permit provides an insurance certificate all required regulatory permits and surety covering the intended work grading operations occurring prior to the plat being recorded and construction plan approval shall be performed at the subdividers risk   recapture agreement the city may at the discretion of the city council enter into a written recapture agreement with the subdivider which provides for the recapture costs of public improvements from those properties benefiting from the improvements the recapture agreement shall prohibit development on those properties until payment has been made the subdivider may contract directly with adjacent property owners andor subdividers of adjacent land for reimbursement of the oversized andor offsite improvements constructed such recapture agreement shall provide that the subdivider be reimbursed for those oversized improvements constructed within the proposed land division but which are oversized to serve lands beyond the boundaries of the land division or other lands within the subdividers control such reimbursement shall be only for the actual additional cost of constructing the oversized improvements within the boundaries of the land division and shall not provide for payment of any interest only land divisions within phase i of the staged development plan for public facilities map 133 identified in the citys comprehensive development plan are eligible to proceed under this provision   streets a grading the subdivider shall be required to grade the full width of rightofway of all roadways alleys pedestrian andor bike paths access easements and other public ways required to be improved as a result of the platting whether or not such public ways are within the boundaries of the plat such grading shall be made to the required grade and cross section and of the street and of materials approved by the city engineer b roadways the subdivider shall be required to provide improved roadways to meet the following criteria for each street classification street classification minimum row width minimum pavement width required pavement structural no design lane equiv axle loadsday local residential for developments of four dwelling units per gross acre or less 56 feet  33 feet  back of curb to back of curb 250 5 local residential high density for developments of more than four dwelling units per gross acre 60 feet  33 feet  back of curb to back of curb 300 25 residential collector 60 feet  33 feet  350 50 light industrial 66 feet  39 feet  350 50 general industrial 66 feet  39 feet  400 150 commercial 66 feet  39 feet  375 75 other collector 66 feet  39 feet  350 75 majorminor arterials individual design for streets other than those shown on the official map shall be determined by the city engineer  as determined by the city engineer  widths of pavement are back to back with 30inch c&g in typical roadway and rightofway sections except that the minimum pavement widths for local residential streets and local residential high density streets shall be measured from the back of curb to back of curb  additional widths for pavement and rightofway may be required at intersections or in other locations when determined by the city engineer required rightofway width and pavement width may be increased above the minimum standards or reduced below the minimum standards when deemed appropriate by the city engineer appropriateness shall be determined based on criteria including but not limited to the reduction of environmental impacts due to runoff from impervious cover the need to calm traffic and reduced longterm costs for street construction reconstruction and longterm maintenance 1 pavement designs the subdivider shall submit to the city engineer for review alternative bituminous street pavement designs based upon the aashto structural number design method interim guide and shall include consideration of construction year and design year anticipated traffic loads soils support values a 20year design life a minimum bituminous pavement serviceability index of 25 and a regional factor of 30 and summarized as follows sn   a1d1 + a2d2 + a3d3 +  where a   the coeff for each structural material layer d   the final design thickness of each structural material layer in inches chemical stabilizations will not be considered in the pavement design calculations the coefficients for geotextile fabrics shall not exceed eighty percent 80% of the manufacturers published values when used in the design calculations structural material coefficient bituminous concrete binder 044 bituminous concrete surface 040 crushed aggregate base 014 geotextile fabrics 80% of manufacturer published value all street pavements within the city shall be designed and constructed in accordance with a standard specifications for road and bridge construction state of wisconsin department of transportation division of highways current edition  b city of sun prairie standard specifications current edition  c the requirements of the city engineer design requirements for the pavement shall be adequate for the zoning classification of the area served by the subject street a street which divides areas with different zoning classifications shall be constructed in accordance with the requirements of the area requiring the higher quality pavement any variation of this must have prior approval of the city engineer combination concrete curb and gutter is required on all streets refer to section describing requirements for curbs and gutters a copy of all design assumptions and computations on which the proposed design is based shall be submitted street grades shall not exceed the following with due allowance for reasonable vertical curves street classification maximum percent grade arterial 5 collector 7 local 8 all pavement shall have a cross slope of  feet feet  and a minimum longitudinal slope of 050 percent intersection radius grades shall be a minimum of one percent 1% unless otherwise approved by the city engineer all subbases and gravel bases shall be proofrolled to the satisfaction of the city engineer prior to the commencement of any street construction the subdivider shall notify the city engineer at least one workday in advance as to the nature of the work being done all subgrade material shall have a minimum california bearing ration cbr of 5 subgrade material having a cbr less than 5 shall be removed and replaced with a suitable fill material or the pavement must be designed to compensate for the soil conditions the soil support cbr values selected for use by the designer should represent a minimum value for the soil to be used the minimum total bituminous pavement thickness shall be three inches one and threefourths inches of binder and one and onefourth inches of surface the placement of bituminous asphalt pavement shall follow the guidelines outlined in the citys twophase approach to street building which delays the placement of the surface layer for approximately two years natural gas mains proposed for installation in the street rightsofway shall be installed prior to placement of the surface paving the minimum thickness of crushed aggregate base course shall be nine inches five inches of threeinch material and four inches of one and onehalfinch material no vehicular traffic shall be permitted on the pavement for a minimum period of between twentyfour 24 and seventytwo 72 hours following paving as determined necessary by the city engineer to protect the new pavement 2 continuity and transitions all street pavement widths on streets continued from previously developed or platted streets shall wherever practical provide for the greater of either the existing or required pavement type width grade and cross slope the design of the street extension shall be approved by the city engineer where it is necessary to provide for a transition of pavement width andor type between new and existing streets the transition shall occur in a safe manner as approved by the city engineer in width transitions the ratio of the transition length to width shall be not less than  unless the city engineer determines that special circumstances prevent use of such a ratio 3 selection of alternative design the city engineer shall select a pavement structure to be used after reviewing equivalent alternative pavement designs with the subdivider the city engineer shall require one or more of the pavement designs of the subdivider based on the following criteria a life cycle cost  b history of similar pavements in the area  c adjacent existing pavements  d staging of construction  e construction season  f friction requirements  g depressed surface or elevated design  h higher governmental preference eg if state highway  i stimulation of competition  j conservation of materials  k construction considerations  l recognition of local industry  m availability of materials and methods locally when the usda soil survey of dane county wisconsin has rated the native soil as having a severe or very severe limitation for local streets the subdivider may be required to provide drain tile near the edge of pavement to accommodate the drainage of the subgrade material as approved by the city engineer the drain tile shall be connected to the city storm sewer system 4 curbs and gutters suitable concrete curb and gutter c&g shall be constructed along the outside edge of all street pavements curb and gutter in residential areas shall have a sixinch barrier curb with a 24inch flag except at driveway aprons where depressed curb shall be constructed depressed curb ramps shall be constructed at all handicap ramps for sidewalks and at all bikeways such curbs and gutters shall conform to the current edition of the sun prairie standard specifications streets with medians shall be constructed with a twelveinchwide curb head in the median curb and gutter section the minimum radius at the intersection of local streets shall be twenty 20 feet measured to face of curb unless otherwise approved by the city engineer the minimum radius of the bulb portion of a culdesac on residential streets shall be fortynine and onehalf 495 feet measured to the face of curb unless otherwise approved by the city engineer c sidewalks and bike paths 1 the subdivider shall be required to provide sidewalks and bikeways to city specifications as follows sidewalks and bikeways shall normally be located as far from the traffic lane as is possible but not closer than six inches to the rightofway line where as a result of such major obstructions as large and established trees steep hills drainageways or major utility lines the construction costs of the sidewalk or bikeway in its normal location would be prohibitive sidewalks or bike paths may be located elsewhere within the street rightofway or within an easement with the approval of the city engineer sidewalks and bikeways constructed at street intersections or within five feet of a legal crosswalk shall include provisions for curb ramping as required by wisconsin statutes and in accordance with city standards in all cases where the grades of sidewalks or bike paths have not been specifically fixed by ordinance the sidewalks and bike paths shall be laid to the established grade of the street refer to 2 wisconsin statutes 2 sidewalks in street rightsofway shall be specifically intended to serve pedestrian traffic bike paths shall be intended to serve both pedestrian and bicycle traffic in areas where the majority of the adjoining lots do not have frontage or access to the street or are not being served by the bike paths in general those lots which do not front or have access on the street in question are not the generating or terminating point for the pedestrian or bicycle traffic 3 construction standards typical sidewalks shall be constructed of concrete at least five feet in width in accordance with the current edition of the sun prairie standard specifications sidewalks may be a minimum of five inches thick where driveway locations are not yet established  otherwise sidewalks shall be a minimum of four inches thick except at known driveway locations where they shall be a minimum of six inches thick bikeways shall be constructed of bituminous pavement at least ten 10 feet in width in accordance with standard city specifications 4 required locations the subdivider shall be required to install sidewalks andor bike paths in full accordance with the city sidewalk policy and the following a on both sides of all public streets including culdesac streets and eyebrows within the subdivision  b on all streets and highways bordering or adjacent to property within the subdivision  c the director of parks recreation and forestry the director of public works the city planner and the city engineer shall determine when it is appropriate to substitute a bike path within the rightofway for a sidewalk d when it is determined to be in the public interest sidewalks andor bike paths may be required along private streets d street lighting the subdivider shall arrange with the sun prairie water and light utility manager for and pay the costs of providing the street lighting necessary to serve the proposed development such street lighting shall be designed and installed in accordance with the citys street lighting policy as approved by the director of public works the police chief and the sun prairie water and light utility manager the design style location and calculations of the street lighting design shall be reviewed and approved by the street lighting committee prior to signing the agreement or work order with water and light for the installation of the street lighting improvements the agreement or work order for the installation of the street lighting shall be signed and executed prior to city acceptance of the street improvements e street signing the subdivider shall arrange with the city for and pay the costs of providing the street signing necessary to serve the development such signing shall include all street name signs and traffic control signing and other devices including such temporary barricades and road closed signs as may be required by the city engineer until the street improvements have been accepted by city council resolution f street trees street trees shall be planted throughout all land divisions such trees shall be planted in the terraces equidistant between the sidewalks and curb or in street tree easements platted in accordance with no closer than ten 10 feet from any sanitary sewer service water service or driveway apron the trees shall be spaced as approved by the city forester at street corners trees shall be located at least thirty 30 feet from the intersection of rightofway lines   sanitary sewer there shall be provided a sanitary sewerage system to all lots and each duplex unit approved by the city engineer and in conformity with the master plan of sewers as approved by the city council the subdivider shall install adequate sanitary sewer facilities and connect them to city sewer mains subject to specifications and inspection of the city engineer all sanitary sewers shall be in accordance with wisconsin administrative subdivider shall pay all the costs of all sanitary sewer work including the bringing of the sanitary sewer of adequate capacity and depth from where it exists to the land division in question as well as providing all sanitary sewer work within the land division   public water supply system a there shall be provided a water supply system in conformity with the master plan of the water system as approved by the utilities commission the subdivider shall install and connect city water to serve all lots and each duplex unit from property line to property line subject to specifications and inspection of the utilities commission and the state of wisconsin or shall petition the city for installation and connection of city water to serve all lots the subdivider either shall pay all costs of installing and connecting adequate city water including the bringing of water from where it exists to the land division in question as well as providing all waterworks within the land division the subdivider shall provide for a minimum water main diameter of eight inches unless otherwise approved by the water and light utility manager and the location of public fire hydrants along the public streets as approved by the fire chief but not greater than a 500foot spacing nor greater than a 400foot spacing in multifamily residential commercial and industrial areas for lots served by alleys that are greater than four hundred 400 feet in length provisions for unobstructed access to accessory buildings at the rear of the lots shall be provided in one of the following manners at the subdividers discretion 1 the provision of a midblock fire hydrant along the street and a fivefootwide midblock fire protection access easement located along or centered on a side lot line that provides unobstructed access free of landscaping fencing mechanical equipment etc for the purpose of extending fire hose from the street to the alley in the event of a fire at the rear of any of the lots  or 2 the provision of a fire hydrant along the alley within fifty 50 feet of the center of the alley with the water line serving the hydrant looped ie connected to the water supply system on both ends  or 3 alternative provisions as proposed by the subdivider subject to the approval of the fire chief the water and light utility manager and the city administrator b fire hydrants which have not passed testing or have not been operationalized shall be covered with securely attached bags to preclude their being inadvertently used by the fire department in an emergency situation   public landsopen spaces a development of area 1 when park land or other open lands are dedicated to the public the subdivider is required to bring the dedicated land up to the contours established in the approved street and utility plans topsoiled with a minimum of six inches of quality topsoil seeded as specified by the parks and recreation director fertilized with 1666 fertilizer at the rate of seven pounds per one thousand 1000 square feet and mulched as specified in the standard specifications for highway and structure construction  the topsoil furnished for the site shall consist of the natural loam sandy loam silt loam silty clay loam or clay loam humusbearing soils adapted to the sustenance of plant life and such topsoil shall be neither excessively acid nor excessively alkaline fine grading and seeding must occur within one year following issuance of the first building permit within that land division unless otherwise authorized by the parks and recreation commission the improved area shall not be deemed officially accepted until a uniform grass cover to a two inch height has been established and all areas planted after september 10 of each year will not be accepted as established grass until after may 15 the following year to insure uniformity of growth it shall be the responsibility of the subdivider to maintain the area until the city accepts the dedication it shall be the responsibility of the city to maintain the dedicated areas upon its dedication and acceptance by the city the owner of such land shall be responsible for its maintenance and liability thereon except that such owner shall not develop the surrounding area in a manner which would unduly depreciate the purpose use or value of the dedicated property and except if such owner shall reside on one of the subdivided parcels in which case such owner shall be responsible for the maintenance of adjacent public property as may be required in other laws of the city a neighborhood park area shall be provided by the subdivider with a standard residential water service unless located directly adjacent to a fire hydrant a community park area shall be provided by the developer with a minimum oneinch water service and at least one fire hydrant and at least one fourinch sanitary sewer lateral all located at the street property line 2 the subdivider shall pay all costs of public improvements in the public streets adjacent to or within all public andor park lands   stormwater management a purpose the following provisions are established to preserve and provide properly located public sites for stormwater management as the community develops and to insure that the costs of providing and developing such public sites b dedication of drainageways whenever a parcel is to be subdivided or consolidated and embraces any part of a drainageway identified in the most current stormwater management plan andor official map or any portion thereof such part of such existing or proposed public drainageway shall be platted and dedicated by the subdivider as an easement outlot or rightofway in the location and at the size indicated along with all other streets and public ways in the land division whenever any parcel is to be subdivided or consolidated and is part of a drainage district established under the authority of wisconsin statutes the subdivider shall petition the circuit court to transfer the jurisdiction of that portion of the drainage district being subdivided or consolidated to the city in accordance with wisconsin statutes c dedicationpreservation of stormwater management facilities the subdivider shall dedicate sufficient land area for the storage of stormwater to meet the needs to be created by the proposed land development and in accordance with the standards for onsite detention and as determined by the city engineer whenever a proposed stormwater management facility eg detention or retention basin shown on the most current stormwater management plan andor official map is located in whole or in part within the proposed land division ground areas for providing the required storage capacity in such proposed public facility shall be dedicated to the public to the requirements of the most current stormwater management plan andor official map storage areas necessary to serve areas outside the land division shall be held in reserve for a period of five years from the date of final plat approval for future acquisition by the city dane county or other appropriate agency having the authority to purchase such property the subdivider and city shall enter into an agreement with the city to provide for the purchase of the lands held in reserve prior to the conclusion of the fiveyear reserve period d storm drainage facilities the subdivider at such subdividers cost shall install all drainage facilities identified in the erosion control plan or determined by the city engineer as being necessary for the management of all lands and roadways within the development in addition drainage capacity development from other areas shall be provided in accordance with the most current city of sun prairie stormwater management plan andor official map all required storm management facilities shall be protected from seedplant washout and sediment deposits to the satisfaction of the city engineer and constructed and operational prior to street construction 1 the subdivider shall submit to the city engineer for review and approval a report on the ability of existing watercourse channels storm sewers culverts and other improvements pertaining to drainage or flood control within the land division to handle the additional runoff which would be generated by the development of the land within the land division additional information shall be submitted to adequately indicate that provision has been made for disposal of surface water without any damage to the developed or undeveloped land down stream or below the proposed land division the report shall also include a estimates of the quantity of stormwater entering the land division naturally from areas outside the land division  b quantities of flow at each inlet or culvert  and c location sizes and grades of required culverts storm drainage sewers and other required appurtenances 2 a grading plan for the streets blocks and lots shall be submitted by the subdivider for the area within the land division 3 the design criteria for storm drainage systems shall be reviewed by the city engineer and approved or modified should development not commence within six 6 months of the approval the city may require the design to be resubmitted to the city for reapproval the city reserves the right to reevaluate the design to account for changes in the citys design standards changes to the citys design standards shall be accommodated to the greatest extent practicable 4 material and construction specifications for all drainage projects ie pipe culverts seed code etc shall be in compliance with standards and specifications provided by city ordinance andor city engineer e minor drainage system the subdivider shall install all minor drainage system components necessary to reduce inconvenience and damages from frequent storms minor drainage components shall include all inlets piping gutters channels ditching pumping and other facilities designed to accommodate the postdevelopment runoff resulting from a fiveyear 24hour rainfall 10year 24hour rainfall for commercial zoning district event as determined in noaa atlas 14 temporary accumulations of storm runoff from ponding or flowing water in or near minor system components shall be permitted providing such accumulations do not encroach on any traffic lane of any collector or arterial street nor on the center sixteen 16 feet of any twentyeight 28 foot back of curb to back of curb street or twenty 20 feet of all other streets except on culdesac or permanently deadend streets serving less than ten 10 dwelling units where such accumulations may not overtop the curb or otherwise approved by the city engineer in drainageways and drainageway easements accumulations of water shall not inundate beyond the limits of the drainageway or drainageway easement crossstreet drainage channels valley gutters shall not be permitted except on culdesac or permanent deadend streets serving less than ten 10 dwelling units and where the minimum grade in the valley gutter and street gutter between the valley gutter and the next downstream drainage inlet is not less than one percent 1% f major drainage system the subdivider shall install all major drainage system components necessary to reduce inconvenience and damages from infrequent storms major system components shall include large channels and drainageways streets easements and other paths and shall be capable of accommodating postdevelopment runoff in excess of that accommodated by minor system components resulting from 24hour rainfall events for storms with return frequencies greater than two years up to and including the 100year return event as identified in noaa atlas 14 on local and collector streets and drainageways and drainage easements accumulations of water shall not inundate any buildings at the ground line unless such buildings are floodproofed on arterial streets and in commercial zoning districts accumulations of water shall not inundate any buildings at the ground line unless such buildings are floodproofed and the center twelve 12 feet of the street to permit operation of emergency vehicles g drainage piping systems unless otherwise approved by the city engineer all drainage piping of twelve 12 inches diameter and greater in street rightsofway shall be constructed of class 3 reinforced concrete pipe piping materials outside of rightsofway shall be subject to approval of the city engineer when the usda soil survey of dane county wisconsin has rated the native soil as having a severe or very severe limitation for dwellings with basements the subdivider shall be required to provide approved sump pump laterals from the storm sewer piping system to the property line of each lot for connection to by the property owner agricultural drain tiles which are disturbed during construction shall be restored reconnected or connected to public storm drainage facilities unless otherwise directed by the city engineer h open channel systems where open channels are utilized in either the minor or major drainage system they shall be designed so as to minimize maintenance requirements and maximize safety drainage easements in lieu of dedications shall be utilized to accommodate open channels provided adequate access by the city for maintenance of drainage capacity side slopes shall not exceed a  slope drainageways with grades of threefourths percent or less or where subject to high groundwater continuous flows or other conditions as determined by the city engineer that would hamper maintenance operations due to consistently wet conditions shall have a treatment approved by the city engineer and the director of public works in areas where invert paving is not required the drainageway bottom shall be approved by the city engineer and the director of public works if the drainageway has a bare soil bottom or the natural grasses in the drainageway are disturbed due to development operations the drainageway bottom shall be restored as approved by the city engineer and the director of public works other disturbed areas shall be seeded and prepared in accordance with the citys erosion control requirements velocities for grasslined channels shall not exceed those presented in the citys stormwater management plan i standards for onsite detention and storage the subdivider may employ onsite detention to control erosion and sedimentation reduce the post development peak runoff rate or temporarily store stormwater runoff due to inadequate downstream drainage facilities the detention storage facilities shall be subject to regulation in accordance with the following standards 1 where onsite detention is temporarily employed for erosion and sedimentation control the detention facilities shall safely contain the postdevelopment runoff from a 25year storm event of 24hour duration within the limits of the facility 2 where onsite detention is permanently employed to reduce the postdevelopment peak runoff the detention facility shall safely contain the postdevelopment runoff from a 25year storm event of 24hour duration within the limits of the facility 3 detention facility peak discharge rates shall be designed to meet requirements in  all temporary detention facilities shall safely contain or pass the runoff from any storm of any duration which exceeds the maximum storm required to be contained up to the 100year storm event of 24hour duration 5 all permanent detention facilities shall safely contain the runoff from the 100year storm event of 24hour duration on both public and if necessary private properties without inundating any building at the ground elevation the center twelve 12 feet of any arterial or collector street and the depth of water in any local street cannot exceed six inches as measured at the crown 6 determination of onsite detention volumes shall be computed by procedures established by the united states soil conservation service in the most current edition of its technical publication entitled urban hydrology for small watersheds tr55 and as accepted and approved by the city engineer 7 the storage of stormwater runoff shall not encroach on any public park except parks designed with detention facilities or any private lands outside the land division unless an easement providing for such storage has been approved and recorded for such lands 8 all detention facilities shall be designed with the safety of the general public and any considerations for ease of maintenance as high priorities 9 wet detention facilities shall include riprap as required at the discretion of the city engineer from one foot below the normal water elevation to not less than two feet above the normal water elevation 10 the sides of all detention facilities shall have a maximum slope ratio of  horizontal to vertical with flatter slopes being required where determined practical by the city engineer 11 the city council upon recommendation by the director of public works may require the installation of fencing or other such security measures in detention facilities with excessively long drawdown times or permanent water features or other features requiring additional security for safety reasons 12 all detention facilities shall be restored with native seeds and plants selected and approved by a native plant consultantmanagement service based on the conditions of the site the seeding and planting shall include the detention facility bottom in dry facilities basin banks and extend thirty 30 feet beyond the bank at the highest level the native plant restoration shall be warranted until native plants cover approximately ninety percent 90% of the site with less than ten percent 10% of the area dominated by weeds exotic species or invasive plants the warranty period shall be a minimum of three years unless otherwise approved by the director of public works  5192015   8182009   erosion control a finding and declaration of purpose the city finds that urbanizing land uses have accelerated the process of soil erosion runoff and sediment deposition in the waters of the city therefore it is declared to be the purpose of this section to control and prevent soil erosion and minimize stormwater runoff increases and thereby to preserve the natural resources control floods and prevent impairment of dams and reservoirs protect the quality of public waters protect wildlife protect the tax base and protect and promote the health safety and general welfare of the people of the city b land disturbing activities subject to erosion and sediment control 1 general requirement any owner occupant or user who undertakes commences or performs any land division activities  or who permits another person to do the same on land under such owner occupant or users control shall be subject to this section a control plan required every land division involving construction of public improvements shall include a plan to control erosion sedimentation and runoff which would result from the proposed activity with the design of the public improvements submitted to the city engineer for review and shall be in full compliance with the citys erosion control ordinance b contents of the control plan the control plan required above shall contain such information needed to determine soil erosion sedimentation and runoff control i detailed written description of how the site will be developed narrative including the scope of land disturbing activities and sequence of construction events ii plan drawing of site of known scale and including property lines lot dimensions limits of impervious area land cover type natural and artificial water features 100year floodplain delineated wetland boundaries location of all proposed erosion control practices iii direction of runoff flow indicated by contours or arrows iv watershed size for each contributing drainage area v provisions to prevent mudtracking onto public thoroughfares during construction ie tracking pad or existing gravel drive vi provisions to prevent the delivery of sediment to stormwater conveyance system ie inlet protection or stone weeper vii prevent gully and bank erosion and apply minimum standards for sheet and rill erosion 75 tonsunit per acreyear universal soil loss equation  usle worksheets must be completed and attached viii provisions for sequential steps mitigating the erosive effect of land disturbing activities list of erosion control practices ix proposed schedule for installation and completion of all elements of the erosion control plan dates must be consistent with usle and be appropriate for each practice x fertilizer and seeding rates seed mulch polymer fertilizer etc xi itemized estimated cost of all elements of the erosion control plan including installation and labor a letter of credit loc is required of estimated cost is greater than five thousand dollars $ xii design discharge for ditches and structural measures flow calculations xiii cross sections and profiles of road ditches and channels existing and proposed xiv runoff velocity in channels to ensure channel stability xv culvert sizes existing and proposed xvi proof of stable outlet capable of carrying the design flow at a nonerosive velocity having no ditches swales culverts downspouts or other features that concentrate runoff present and having all runoff leave the site as sheet flow may be sufficient to satisfy this requirement xvii copy of preliminary review letter permits or approvals by other agencies eg wdnr army corps of engineers driveway permit etc xviii any other information necessary to reasonably determine the location nature and condition of any physical or environmental features of the site c review of control plan the city engineer shall review all control plans and shall determine if measures are adequate to meet all the applicable standards as set out in this section the applicant will be informed in writing whether the control plan is approved disapproved requires modification or if additional information is required in the event that the plan is not approved the applicant shall resubmit a new control plan d conditions all approvals under this section shall be issued subject to the following conditions and requirements i all land disturbances will be done pursuant to the approved control plan and requirements of the citys erosion control ordinance  ii the subdivider shall give two working days notice in advance of the start of any activity  iii the subdivider shall file a notice within ten 10 days after completion of land disturbing activities  iv approval in writing shall be obtained prior to any modifications to the approved control plan  v the subdivider shall be responsible for maintaining all proposed public roads road rightsofway streets runoff and drainage facilities and drainageways as specified in the approved plan until they are accepted and become the responsibility of the city  vi the subdivider shall be responsible at said subdividers own expense for repairing any damage to all adjoining surfaces and drainageways caused by runoff andor sedimentation resulting from permittees activities  vii the subdivider shall provide and install at such subdividers expense all drainage runoff control and erosion control improvements as required by this section and the approved control plan and shall provide for the perpetual maintenance of all private control facilities or to and acceptance by the city  viii no portion of the land which is disturbed will be allowed to remain uncovered for greater than ten 10 days after the work activity is completed if the city engineer determines there exists a potential for erosion to leave the site of the work or the boundaries of the land division  ix the subdivider agrees to permit the city engineer or designee to enter onto the land regulated under this chapter for the purpose of inspecting for compliance with the approved control plan  and x the subdivider authorizes the city to cause or perform any work or operations necessary to bring the condition of the lands into conformity with the approved control plan and further consents to the city collecting the total of the costs and expenses of such work and operating as a special charge against the property for current services rendered as provided by law e duration approvals issued developers agreement shall be valid for a period of eighteen 18 months from the date of issuance the city engineer is authorized to extend the expiration date of the approval the city engineer is authorized to modify the plans to prevent any increase in sedimentation erosion or runoff resulting from any extension of the approval c standards and criteria 1 standard for erosion and sediment control for land disturbing activities plans for public improvement construction shall not be approved nor permits issued unless erosion and sedimentation leaving the site during and after the land disturbance will not exceed that which would have been eroded if the land had been left in its undisturbed state andor are controlled in accordance with established procedures including but not limited to erosion in urbanizing areas or other technical guidelines as developed by the dane county land conservation district in cooperation with the us department of agriculture soil conversation service 2 standards for onsite detention and storage where onsite detention is employed to control erosion and sedimentation or to reduce the postdevelopment peak runoff rate the detention shall be subject to regulation in accordance with the standards of with additional allowances for sediment accumulation 3 design criteria engineering standards and general principles the applicant for a permit shall employ the bmps necessary to achieve all applicable standards set out in this chapter however these measures will be evaluated to determine that they follow currently accepted design criteria and engineering standards the following general principles shall be used when evaluating control plans and granting permits under this chapter a the smallest area of land shall be exposed for the shortest period at any given time during development  b the rough grading of the lot shall include hauling of all surplus material including topsoil off the lot  c accommodation of the increased runoff caused by changed soil and surface conditions during and after development  d permanent final plant covering or structures shall be installed prior to acceptance of the required public improvements by the city  e the plan of development shall relate to the topography and soils of the site so that the lowest potential for erosion is created  and f natural plant covering shall be retained and protected and shall be deemed a dominating factor in developing the site and temporary vegetation mulching or other cover shall be used to protect the area exposed during the land disturbing activity d administration 1 delegation of administrative authority the city engineer shall administer approve plans and enforce the provisions of this section on lands being subdivided by plat or certified survey within the citys corporate and extraterritorial limits for plat review in accordance with wisconsin statutes for erosion and runoff control including both public lands and private lands 2 administrative duties the administration and enforcement of this section shall include the following duties a keep an accurate record of all plan data received plans approved approvals issued inspections made and other official actions  b review all plans and applications received when accompanied with the necessary information and the appropriate fee and issue the permits  c investigate all complaints made to the application of the ordinance codified in this chapter  and d revoke any approvals of construction plans granted under this section if the subdivider has misrepresented any material fact or has failed to comply with the plan as originally approved or as modified in writing  or has violated any of the other conditions of the approval issued by the city engineer 3 inspection authority the city engineer or a designee of such city engineer is authorized to enter upon any public or private lands affected by this section to inspect the land prior to permit issuance for the purpose of determining whether to approve the plan and after permit issuance to determine compliance with this section if permission cannot be received from the owner occupant or user entry shall be according to 1 2 and 3 wisconsin statutes 4 enforcement authority the city engineer or a designee of such city engineer is authorized to post a cease and desist order upon land which has had the approval revoked or to post a cease and desist order upon land which is currently undergoing any activity in violation of this section a copy of each cease and desist order will be sent to the city administrator and building inspector for the city these orders shall specify that the activity must be ceased or brought into compliance with the title within a time frame identified by the city engineer any revocation or cease and desist order shall remain in effect until retracted by the city engineer or by a court of appropriate jurisdiction activities in violation of the ordinance must be ceased immediately in situations where the city engineer finds a substantial threat to the human or physical environment the city shall be allowed by the developer to take corrective action in emergency situations shall the subdivider fail to do so if the city is required to take such action the cost thereof may be charged against the property and such failure will be considered a breach of the development agreement   utilities property shall be graded within six inches of the finished grade property stakes installed and payments made to the sun prairie water and light commission prior to the installation of utilities in so far as possible all utilities including but not limited to natural gas telephone cable tv and electric shall be installed underground along side and rear lot lines or along other public rightsofway as necessary overseeing the restoration of the site following the installation of utilities shall be the responsibility of the project manager   acceptance of improvements and dedications a the dedication of any improvements utilities streets parks easements rightsofway or other lands or rights to the city or the public shall not be considered accepted by the city for public ownership until such time as the required public improvements within the intended dedication or necessary because of the intended dedication have been completed and accepted by the city council by adoption of a resolution accepting such dedication the subdivider shall be responsible for and liable for the maintenance safety and operation of all required public improvements until such time as the improvements are accepted by the city council by resolution in the event the city must take measures to maintain operate or make safe a public improvement existing or required as a result of the land division but which has not yet been accepted by the city the costs of such measures shall be determined to be city incurred costs to be reimbursed to the city by the subdivider in accordance with the provisions of b after any of the following increments of the required improvements have been installed and completed the subdivider shall notify the city engineer in writing that the work is complete and ready for final inspection  shall file a hard copy of the entire plan set of the record drawings including the planprofile details cross sections and grading plans and also an electronic copy in a format acceptable to the city engineer of the completed improvements and shall file lien waivers and affidavits in a form acceptable to the city engineer and approved by the city attorney evidencing that there are no claims actions or demands for damages based upon contract or tort arising out of or in any way related to the project and that no moneys are owed to any surveyor mechanic contractor subcontractor material man or laborer after all required improvements have been installed acceptance of the improvements may be requested in the following increments 1 sewer mains and services either storm or sanitary  2 water mains and services  3 streets comprised of all grading gravel curb and gutter and paving  4 other miscellaneous appurtenances to the above increments such as sidewalks bikeways street lighting street signing etc the city finance officer shall certify that there are no unpaid taxes or unpaid special assessments on any of the lands included in the area of acceptance and shall prepare a final billing for engineering inspection and legal fees and submit it to the subdivider for payment the city engineer or designee shall conduct any necessary final inspections of the improvements when the engineering inspection taxes special assessments and legal fees have been paid and when the necessary lien waivers and affidavits have been filed the report of the city engineer shall be forwarded to the public works committee for approval upon completing its review the public works committee shall recommend city council adoption of a resolution accepting the improvements and the dedications c no such resolution shall be adopted unless the subdivider has deposited with the city finance officer an instrument of guarantee or corporate surety performance bond in accordance with a bonding company with assets exceeding ten million dollars $1000000000 and authorized to do business in the state of wisconsin guarantees maintenance repair replacement by the developer of such public improvements which deteriorate or fail to meet performance or operating standards during the bond term or any penalties which may be incurred as a result thereof such bond to be in an amount equal to fifteen percent 15% of the approved estimate of the cost of the required improvements but not less than ten thousand dollars $1000000 or as recommended by the city engineer for a term not less than two years from city acceptance of the last increment of the land division improvements and dedications with a termination date not in the months of november december january february march or april together with an affidavit by the subdivider that the maintenance of such public improvements will be guaranteed by the subdivider due to use of the improvements by purchasers and construction traffic d prior to any maintenance repair or replacement being performed by the developer during the bond period it shall notify the city engineer at least one work day prior to the doing of the work and obtain approval of the city engineer as to the nature and manner of work to be done fees land division feesgeneral a required conceptual plat preliminary plat final plat replat and certified survey map fees shall be as set by resolution of the common council the subdivider shall pay to the city all fees at the time of submittal b any application for land division in the city limits or the citys extraterritorial plat or joint zoning jurisdiction andor petition for annexation from a person firm or corporation having unpaid and overdue property taxes special assessments sanitary sewer hookup fees park fees impact fees building permit fees erosion control and stormwater management fees gis fees any fees andor charges owed pursuant to a predevelopment agreement development agreement or an outstanding judgment owed to the city of sun prairie shall be deemed incomplete and shall not be reviewed by staff this section does not apply to fees paid in installments pursuant to a development agreement if made within thirty 30 days of the issuance of an invoice by the city c upon receipt of such an application from a person firm or corporation having unpaid fees or accounts due to the city of sun prairie the person firm or corporation shall be notified the application will not be accepted and that they may request a hearing before the finance committee regarding the unpaid fees the request for a hearing must be made within thirty 30 days of the issuance of the notice d the applicant has a right to appeal the decision of the finance committee to the city council within thirty 30 days of issuance of a denial of their appeal   reserved editors note of adopted feb 21 201 repealed   which pertained to geographic information systems fees and carried no amendatory history   stormwater management fee a the subdivider shall pay a stormwater management fee for each acre undergoing land division or each fraction thereof the fee shall be based on the acrefeet of storage required to detain the 25year postdevelopment storm and shall be determined by the city council by multiplying acrefeet of stormwater storage required by the current stormwater management unit fee acrefeet of stormwater storage required shall be calculated using the current version of tr55 or other method as determined by the city engineer and the current requirements of this chapter note all developments are subject to this fee b annual fee adjustment these fees are to be adjusted annually by resolution by the city council the index used to adjust this figure will be the construction code index for the minneapolis area this index factor is reported in the engineering news record agreements will be prepared using the fee currently in effect and adjusted retroactively to january 1st when the new year cost index becomes available   stormwater management and fee in lieu of dedication a where upon the recommendation of the citys public works committee there is no land suitable for stormwater management facilities or the land would not be compatible with the citys stormwater management plan comprehensive master plan andor official map or if the city public works committee determines that a cash contribution would better serve the public interest the subdivider shall pay a fee in lieu of making the required land dedication the amount of this fee shall be in addition to the fee paid per this chapter and shall be determined by the acrefeet of storage required to detain the 25year storm event the fee in lieu of dedication shall be determined by the city council by multiplying acrefeet of stormwater storage required by the current stormwater management unit fee acrefeet of stormwater storage required shall be calculated using the current version of tr55 and the current requirements of this chapter note developments that provide onsite stormwater management facilities are not required to pay this fee b annual fee adjustment the fees are to be adjusted annually by resolution of the city council the index used to adjust this figure will be the construction cost index for the minneapolis area this index factor is reported in the engineering news record agreements will be prepared using the fee currently in effect and adjusted retroactively to january 1st when the new year cost index becomes available   plan review fee the subdivider shall pay a fee equal to onequarter of one percent of the cost of the public improvements required for the land division as approved by the city engineer or five hundred dollars $50000 whichever is greater within ten 10 days of approval of the developers agreement by the city council such fee is determined to cover the costs of the city engineers review of the construction documents and such other administrative costs as may be incurred by the city engineer this fee shall not include the costs for onsite inspection of the actual construction operations additional costs to the city for consulting services inspections testing legal services or any other costs resulting from the review shall be charged to the subdivider at the actual cost to the city as outlined in  8212012   outstanding assessments all outstanding assessments taxes or other past due fees due to the city shall be paid prior to the signing of the final plat or certified survey by the city   public park fees a fee in lieu of dedication where in the discretion of the plan commission and the parks and recreation commission there is no land suitable for parks within the proposed land division or the dedication of land would not be compatible with the citys comprehensive development plan or the parks and recreation commission determines that a cash contribution would better serve the public interest the plan commission and parks and recreation commission may recommend to the committee of the whole that the subdivider pay a fee in lieu of making the required land dedication the amount of any fee imposed shall be determined as follows for each proposed development the fee shall be the current rate as established by the common council for each dwelling unit any adjustment or changes in the number of dwelling units before final plat acceptance will be subject to this section reconfiguration of existing lots which does not create new additional lots shall not be subject to the provisions of this section b dedication and fee 1 the plan commission and the parks and recreation commission may recommend the subdivider satisfy the requirements by combining land dedication with fee payments the fee in such cases shall be determined by subtracting the credited value of the dedicated land from the total fee which would have been imposed had no land been dedicated by the subdivider 2 payment may be made by one of the following methods a option alump sum a lump sum amount shall be paid prior to the issuance of any building permit for the development  or b option bpayment of onethird of all land dedication and fee payments the subdivider shall pay the city thirtythree and fourtenths 334 percent of the total fee by the date the first building permit is issued at such time that thirtythree and fourtenths 334 percent of the building permits are issued for the approved development or after one year from the date that the city issued the first building permit whichever occurs first the subdivider shall pay the second installment of thirtythree and threetenths 333 percent of the total fee at such time that sixtysix and seventenths 667 percent of the building permits are issued for the approved development or after two years from the date that the city issued the first building permit whichever occurs first the subdivider shall pay the final installment of thirtythree and threetenths 333 percent of the total fee if this method of payment is used the outstanding balance after the first payment is made shall be charged the interest rate earned by the park trust fund for the period of time that the second and third installments are outstanding 3 subdividers shall make the lump sum payment identified in option a above under the following circumstance the development is less than twentyfive 25 dwelling units 4 failure to make the proper payments as defined above shall result in the immediate withholding of all building and occupancy permits until all delinquent payments are made to the city c additional feeassessment per unit in addition at the time a building permit is issued for new construction of a single unit or multifamily units a onetime fee per dwelling unit will be assessed for park development as established by the common council these fees shall be placed in the park fund for park development d use of fees paid the city shall place the fees collected pursuant to the provisions of this section in the park trust fund for land acquisition and park development e annual fee adjustment all fees in these sections shall be annually adjusted by the city administrator by adding to the base fees the consumer price index for small metro areas north central states size class c for all urban consumers cpi cost on march 1st of each year   subdivider to reimburse the city for costs sustained the subdivider of land divisions within the city shall reimburse the city for its actual cost of design inspection inventorying mapping and collecting attribute information for infrastructure features for the gis database testing construction and associated legal and real estate fees for the required public improvements for the land division unless otherwise recovered fees the citys costs shall be determined as follows a the cost of city employees time engaged in any way with the required public improvements based on the hourly rate paid to the employee multiplied by a factor determined by the city finance officer to represent the citys cost for expenses benefits insurance sick leave holidays vacation and similar benefits  b the cost of city equipment employed  c the cost of mileage reimbursed to city employees which is attributed to the land division  d the actual costs of city materials incorporated into the work including transportation costs plus a restocking andor handling fee not to exceed ten percent 10% of the cost of the materials  e all consultant fees associated with the public improvements at the invoiced amount plus administrative costs unless the amount totals less than fifty dollars $5000 the city shall bill the subdivider monthly for expenses incurred by the city bills outstanding for more than thirty 30 days shall accrue interest at the rate of one percent per month bills outstanding for more than ninety 90 days may be forwarded to the subdividers surety agency for payment amounts less than fifty dollars $5000 shall be held for billing by the city until amounts total more than fifty dollars $5000 or until the conclusion of project activities f a predevelopment surety of one thousand dollars $100000 per acre of development at a minimum of five thousand dollars $500000 to a maximum of twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 shall be provided to the city until the final plat or certified survey map has been recorded  2212012   street trees a for residential buildings containing up to four dwelling units a per dwelling unit fee as established by the common council shall be collected for street trees at the time a building permit is issued for the initial construction of the residence the fee shall be placed into a city forestry fund to be used for the planting and maintenance of new trees in front of the lot or in the neighborhood in which the building is located b for nonresidential buildings and residential buildings containing five or more dwelling units a fee as established by the common council shall be collected for street trees at the time a building permit is issued for the initial construction of the building at a rate of one tree per fifty 50 feet of lot frontage on a public street the fee shall be placed into a city forestry fund to be used for the planting and maintenance of new trees in front of the lot or in the neighborhood in which the building is located   development agreement fee the subdivider shall pay an application fee for the preparation of a development agreement such fee is intended to cover staff time and such other administrative costs as may be incurred by the city in association with the preparation of the development agreement these fees shall be established and adjusted by resolution of the city council  1102014 title 17  zoning chapters introduction   title this title shall be known cited and referred to as the city of sun prairie zoning as referred to herein where it shall be known as this title    authority this title is enacted pursuant to the authority granted by the state of wisconsin statutes specific statutory references are provided within the body of this title solely as a means of assisting the reader such references are not to be considered as all inclusive and shall in no manner be construed so as to limit the application or interpretation of this title    legislative intent in enacting this title special attention has been given to ensuring a direct relationship of these regulations to the city of sun prairies comprehensive plan the general intent of this title is to implement certain goals and objectives of the comprehensive plan which are best addressed approaches    rationale throughout this title paragraphs labeled rationale are included to ensure a complete understanding of the purpose and reasoning of the city in adopting that particular portion of this title each rationale is intended as an official statement of the legislative findings or purposes and shall serve to guide the administrative and judicial interpretation of this title the specific rationale expressed in each rationale section are not intended to be exhaustive and other nonexplicit rationale may also be applicable these sections have been legislatively adopted together with the more formal text of this title and shall be treated in the same manner as other aspects of legislative history    purpose a the overall purpose of this title is to implement the city of sun prairie comprehensive plan to the extent possible under zoning b this title is designed to lessen congestion in the streets  to secure safety from fire panic and other dangers  to promote health and the general welfare  to provide adequate light and air including access to sunlight for solar collectors and to wind for wind energy systems  to encourage the protection of groundwater resources  to prevent the overcrowding of land  to avoid undue concentration of population  and to facilitate the adequate provision of transportation water sewerage schools parks and other public requirements  and to preserve burial sites as defined in l wisconsin statutes c specifically this title is adopted for the purpose of protecting the public health safety morals comfort convenience and general welfare by implementing certain goals and objectives of the comprehensive plan rationale in developing the specific regulations of this title much effort has gone into balancing the goals and objectives of the comprehensive plan the current status of this title and its components including the official zoning map represents the cohesive result of carefully considered plan implementation practices amendments to these provisions andor the official zoning map shall seriously consider the effect of such changes on the interrelationships which exist within this title and between this document the comprehensive plan and related longrange planning policies and programs see     abrogation it is not intended that this title abrogate or interfere with any constitutionally protected vested right    application a in their interpretation and application the provisions of this title shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety morals and welfare b where property is affected by the regulations imposed by any provision of this title and by other governmental regulations the regulations which are more restrictive or which impose higher standards or requirements shall prevail regardless of any other provision of this title no land shall be developed or used and no structure erected or maintained in violation of any state or federal regulations c no structure shall be constructed erected modified converted enlarged reconstructed altered placed or maintained and no land shall be used modified or maintained for any purpose nor in any manner which is not in conformity with the provisions of this title d except as provided in this title under provisions for nonconforming uses  nonconforming developments  nonconforming lots  and nonconforming structures and buildings  no building structure development or premises shall be hereinafter used or occupied and no applicable permit granted that does not conform to the requirements of this title e in cases of mixedoccupancy or mixeduse the regulations for each land use shall apply to the portion of the structure or land so used f except for outlots authorized under to contain permanently protected green space area no yard or other open space shall be considered as providing a yard or open space for a building or structure on any other lot    jurisdiction this title is applicable to all territory located within the corporate limits of the city of sun prairie    reenactment and repeal a this title in part carries forward by reenactment some of the provisions of the regulations governing zoning and related matters being previously known collectively as the zoning ordinance title 17 of the code of ordinances for the city of sun prairie adopted prior to the effective date of this title it is not the intention of this title to repeal but rather to reenact and continue in force such existing provisions so that all rights and liabilities that have accrued thereunder are preserved and may be enforced unless explicitly surrendered by specific provisions of this title or altered by the official zoning map b all provisions of title 17 of the city of sun prairie code of ordinances which are not reenacted herein are repealed c the adoption of this title shall not adversely affect the citys right to prosecute any violation of the predecessor zoning ordinance provided the violation occurred while that ordinance was in effect    effective date all plans approved under previous zoning regulations shall be valid and may be used to obtain permits for a period of not more than one year after the effective date of this title this title shall become effective upon passage and posting according to law following the date of repeal and reenactment of the official zoning map  definitions purpose the purpose of this chapter is to define words terms and phrases contained in this title which are essential to the understanding administration and enforcement of this title and which are not part of common english usage    word usage the interpretation of this title shall abide by the provisions and rules of this section except where the context clearly requires otherwise or where the result would clearly be inconsistent with the manifest intent of this title a words used or defined in one tense or form shall include other tenses and derivative forms b words in the singular number shall include the plural number and words in the plural number shall include the single number c the masculine gender shall include the feminine and the feminine gender shall include the masculine d the words shall must and will are mandatory e the words may can and might are permissive f the word person includes individuals firms corporations partnerships associations trusts and any other similar entities g the word city means the city of sun prairie wisconsin h the word county means the county of dane wisconsin i the word state means the state of wisconsin j the word commission means the city of sun prairie plan commission k the words council city council and common council shall refer to the city of sun prairie common council l the word board means the city of sun prairie board of zoning appeals m if there is any ambiguity between the text of this title and any caption illustration or table the text shall control
